response: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Boil water in a large skillet. Add green chilies and onion. Simmer for 5 minutes. Drain and add cream cheese and half of the cheddar cheese. Combine until melted and smooth. Lay out 8 tortillas and spread 2 Tbsp. of cream cheese mixture down center of each. Sprinkle with a little of the remaining cheese. Lay 1/4 of the chicken and 2 green chilies and 2 tbsp. of sour cream across each tortilla. Roll up and place in a buttered 13 x 9 inch pan. Pour heavy whipping cream over enchiladas. Bake for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake for 5 more minutes. Serve with guacamole or salsa. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Cut the eggplant lengthwise into slices 1/2 inch thick. Put in a bowl and toss with 1/2 of the olive oil. Place in a roasting pan and bake 20 minutes or until tender. Combine the remaining olive oil with the orange juice, miso and honey in a small bowl. Whisk well and pour over the cooked eggplant. Sprinkle with orange zest and cayenne to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375. Peel apples, remove cores. Cut apple into thin wedges. Toss apple pieces with sugar and flour. Combine eggs, vanilla sugar and milk in a mixing bowl. Pour egg mixture over apples. Bake in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish for 45 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

In a large pot combine brown sugar, cola, worcestershire, and mustard until smooth. Bring to a boil over high heat then add ham. Cover, reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 1 hour or until ham is fully cooked and glaze has thickened to your liking. Cook ham for an additional 30 minutes uncovered for a crispier ham crust. Serve hot or cold. Serve with extra mustard if desired.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the bacon strips in the skillet until browned and crisp, about 5 to 7 minutes. Drain on paper towelsset aside. Place the chicken breasts in a large resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. In a small bowl combine the Italian seasoning and parmesan cheese. Add the Italian seasoning and cheese to the bag of chickenseal and shake to coat. In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise and mustardspread over the cut sides of the bread slices. Lay the bacon strips on the bottoms of the sandwiches. Top each with a chicken breast half and a slice of swiss cheese. Close the sandwiches and wrap tightly in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes and up to overnight. When ready to serve, slice the sandwiches in half and serve on the plates.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute green bell pepper and onion until tender. Add mushroom soup, chicken soup, and tomatoes and heat through. Stir in the cooked chicken and heat until heated through. Place tortillas in a 13x9 inch baking dish and top with chicken mixture and cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve immediately.
Prepare and bake chow mein noodles until crisp. Drain and cool. Combine noodles and nuts with remaining ingredients. Stir well. Store in airtight container. Makes about 24 cups.

In a large saucepan, combine the rice, broth, turmeric and cinnamon and cook, uncovered, over medium heat for 35 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the dried fruit and nuts and cook for about another minute. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 8 servings.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium high heat. Sprinkle pork chops with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Place pork in skillet. Cook about 4 minutes on each side or until juices run clear. Pour in wine. Cover. Cook additional 4 minutes. Pour in mustard and cherries. Cook another minute or two. Stir in butter. Remove from heat.

Bring 1 cup boiling water to a boil in a medium sauce pan. Add gelatinstir until dissolved. Remove from heatcool completely, about 1 hour. In a small bowl, whisk together ice cream, gelatin mixture, and salt until blendedtransfer to an 8-cup mold. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate at least 2 hours or until firm. To unmold, run warm water over bottom of moldgently loosen ice cream with rubber spatula. Garnish with chopped strawberries and mint sprigs.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. When hot, place the pork chops into the pan and season with salt and pepper. Sear the pork chops about 3 minutes per side. Transfer the pork chops to the baking pan. Add the sliced onions to the skillet and season with the bouillon cubes. Stir well and saute over high heat for 2 minutes. Pour the hot water over the onions and stir well. Add the sour cream and stir well. Remove the pork chops from the baking pan and place over the onions. Pour the sauce over the pork chops. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Place parsley flakes, celery flakes, bay leaf, thyme leaves and marjoram in cheesecloth and tie with string. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 2 months.

Bring 4 quarts water to a boil over high heat. Salt the water and cook the penne according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat the oil over medium heat and cook the garlic until golden. Stir the garlic into the cooked pasta along with the egg and the sea salt. Serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl combine cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk. Add creme de menthe and red food coloring. Mix well. Fold in whipped topping. Place one pie crust in a 9 inch pie plate. Spread half of the filling over the crust. Top with the second crust. Decorate top and sides with whipped topping. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 8 servings.
In crock pot, combine first eight ingredientscook on high 6-8 hours. Stir in spinach. Top with french fried onions. Serves 8.

In a large skillet brown chicken in oil. Cut into bite size pieces. Melt butter in a casserole. Add chicken, onion and tarragon. Stir in poultry seasoning. Combine soup, milk and mushrooms. Stir into chicken mixture. Cook until heated through. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 degrees for 35 minutes or until hot. Makes 6 servings.

Marinate in refrigerator overnight. In a large skillet brown chicken in hot oil. Remove chicken from skillet. Add soya sauce to skillet and stir. Bring to a boil. Add water, sugar, ginger, garlic, and onion powder. Reduce heat. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the chicken back to the skillet. Heat until hot. Add dry mustard, stirring constantly. Add pepper to taste. Serve over white rice or egg noodles.

Season tenderloin with salt and pepper. In saute pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add leeks and fennel seed and saute for about 4 minutes. Add apple and continue to saute. Add sherry wine vinegar and honey and let simmer until apples are tender. Place tenderloin in saute pan and cook for about 5 minutes. Turn over and cook another five minutes. Remove and slice. Spoon the apple mixture over the tenderloin and serve.

Combine chocolate, water, and egg in double boiler until melted and smooth. Add sugar gradually while constantly stirring until thick and glossy. Remove from heat and add flavorings if desired. Cool before using.

Beat crisco, sugar, milk, and vanilla until well blended. Beat in egg. Add flour and salt. Stir until mixed well. Stir in chocolate chips and pecans. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes. Cool on racks. Makes about 2 dozen.

In a large bowl mix ground beef, stuffing mix and milk. Form into 1 inch meatballs. Brown in a skillet and set aside. In a small saucepan combine soup, ketchup, and worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Place meatballs in a 9 x 13 inch pan and top with the sauce. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and continue to bake for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft and transparent. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the cumin and cook for 1 minute. Add beans and water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the lime juice and season with cayenne pepper and salt to taste. Serve warm.
Mix flour, sugar and baking powder. Add vanilla, rice and eggs. Mix well. Roll into small balls. Roll in egg then flour. Fry in deep hot fat until brown. Drain. Dip in powdered sugar. Roll in nutmeg.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10x13-inch baking pan.Combine cake mix, apple pie filling and eggs in a large bowlbeat until blended. Pour into prepared pan.Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes before cutting.Spread vanilla ice cream over top of cake and sprinkle with walnuts. Serve immediately or freeze until ready to serve.
Brown meat with onion, peppers. Drain. Add remaining ingredients. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Serves 8.

Bring a large pot of water to boiling. Add pasta. Cook according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water. Drain pasta. Toss pasta in a large bowl with 2 Tbsp. olive oil. Add 1/2 cup walnuts and set aside. Heat remaining 1 Tbsp. olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add orange and lemon peels. Cook for 1 minute. Add salt, parsley and pepper. Cook 1 minute more. Add pasta mixture. Add pasta water 1/4 cup at a time until desired consistency is reached. Toss. Divide pasta onto 4 plates. Sprinkle each serving with remaining 1/4 cup walnuts.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until cold and serve.

In a large skillet cook beef with oregano, garlic salt, celery salt and onion salt. Drain. Stir pizza sauce into beef. Set aside. Spread beef mixture on 4 hamburger buns. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375 degrees F for 12 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve on plate. Serve with ketchup or pizza sauce for dipping.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place asparagus spears in a single layer in a baking dish. Sprinkle spears generously with salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil and toss to coat. Roast for 15 minutes, or until spears are tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle generously with cheese.

Add onion and garlic to a large skillet and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add anchovy fillets and break up with a fork. Cook until they break up and begin to thicken. Add 1/2 teaspoon pepper and 2 tablespoons of water and continue cooking until thick. Toss with pasta and serve hot.

Cut kabocha in half lengthwiseremove seeds and discard. Place squash, cut side down, in a small baking dish and bake at 400 for 45 minutes or until flesh is tender when pierced with a fork. Meanwhile, heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add butter and leekssaute until tender and translucent, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in sage and a pinch of salt. Combine squash and leeks and serve hot.

Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a large pot. Add pasta and cook as directed on package, stirring occasionally. Drain pasta well in colander and set aside. In large saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Whisk in flour and salt to taste. Slowly whisk in milk. Cook, whisking constantly, over low heat until sauce thickens. Remove from heatstir in cheese and cooked pastamix well. Pour into 13 x 9 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes until top is lightly browned and cheese is bubbly around edges. Makes 12 servings. Serve with crusty bread or rolls for soaking up all that delicious cheese sauce!

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 9 by 13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a small bowl combine the onion powder, bouillon powder, parsley and butter. Spoon mixture evenly over chicken breasts in baking dish. Bake uncovered 35 to 45 minutes or until chicken is tender, turning once during cooking time. Cut into strips to serve. Serves 4.

Brown the beef and drain well. Stir in the onion. In another skillet, combine the refried beans and chili pepper and heat through. Heat the enchilada sauce and mix into the beef mixture. Spread 1/2 cup of the beef mixture over the bottom half of the tortillas and top with 1/4 cup of the bean mixture and 1/4 cup of the cheese. Roll up the tortillas and place them seam side down in a shallow baking dish. Pour the remaining sauce over the enchiritos and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. Combine chicken with lemon juice, oil, garlic, oregano and cayenne pepper. Place on cookie sheet. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until juice from chicken is clear. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Peel and cube the eggplant and toss with the olive oil. Spread in a single layer on a cookie sheet and roast for 30 minutes. Add the marinara sauce and the red pepper flakes and toss. Sprinkle with the cheeses and bake for 5 more minutes. Serve with a loaf of crusty Italian bread.

Saute bacon over medium-high heat in a skillet until crispy. Cut pork into bite-size chunks. Drain fat from skillet and add onion and garlic. Cook until onion is softened, stirring occasionally. Add pork chops, thyme, tomatoes, white wine and pinto beans. Bring mixture to boil and reduce heat. Cover, simmer for 20 minutes or until pork chops are tender. Stir in parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Pour brownie mix into greased 9x13 inch pan and spread evenly to corners. Bake according to package directions. While brownies are baking combine oil, orange juice, liqueur, egg, chocolate chips and 1/4 cup nuts. Pour evenly over brownies and bake 10 more minutes. Let brownies cool 1 hour before cutting into squares. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

Place mayonnaise in a small bowl. Stir in cheese. Arrange mushroom pieces over bottom of baking dish. Cover with the french fried onion rings. Sprinkle with the cheese mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes. Makes 40 servings.

Place lemon rind and orange rind in small bowl and rub together with your fingers. Add kosher salt and red pepper and rub together again. Place garlic clove in bowl and rub it with your fingers. Place steak in bowl and rub mixture all over. Place in refrigerator for 20 minutes. Heat grill to medium. Spray with cooking spray. Grill steak for 8 minutes per side. Let sit for 5 minutes. Slice steak into 2 1/2 inch slices. Serve with arugula salad.

In a large heavy saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons oil over medium-high heat. Saute carrots, celery ribs, onion and garlic for 5 minutes or until slightly softened. Stir in zucchini and saute for 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in kale for 1 minute or until wilted. Stir in 1/3 cup stock. Cover and cook 3 minutes or until kale is tender. Stir in remaining 3 cups stock. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowcover and simmer for 10 minutes or until kale is tender. Stir in beans, zucchini mixture, tomatoes, thyme and remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Bring to a boilcover and simmer 10 minutes or until thickened. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 8 servings.

Grease a baking sheet. Mix coconut and condensed milk together. Add egg and mix well. Add butter and almond essence and mix well. Spread mixture on baking sheet. Bake at 300f for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Cut into squares and roll in powdered sugar.

Place baking potatoes in microwave and cook for 20 minutes or until done. Let cool. Cut in half and scoop out pulp. Mash the pulp with sour cream, roquefort cheese and green onions with tops. Stuff the halves with the mixture and sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve with green salad and garlic bread.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add flour, stirring frequently, until slightly toasted, 3 to 4 minutes. Add beef stock, roast, potatoes, diced tomatoes, mixed vegetables, seasoning and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat griddle or frying pan over medium heat until hot. Sift flour, baking powder and bicarbonate of soda into a large mixing bowl and whisk through to combine well. Whisk egg and sugar together in a jug or large measuring cup. Make a well in the centre of the flour mixture and pour in the egg mixture and yogurt, followed by milk, stirring constantly until mixture is smooth. Leave for 5 minutes. Melt 2 tbsp of the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add remaining butter and icing sugar and stir until melted, then remove from heat. Whisk into pancake mixture until smooth and light. Lightly grease the griddle or frying pan with oil. Spoon pancake mixture onto griddle or pan, in 6-8cm rounds, until well browned. Flip pancakes over, reduce heat if necessary, until browned on both sides. Remove from griddle or frying pan. Serve hot with warm maple syrup on top of pancakes or with berries or fruit.

Peel apples and cut in slices. Add sugar and water in a sauce pan and let simmer until thick and apples are tender. Add cinnamon and apples and let simmer for another 5 minutes. In a separate bowl add self-rising flour and margarine and mix well. Add egg and mix well again. Press dough into a pie plate and add apples with the sugar and water mixture. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until apples are tender. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Preheat the oven to 375. Toss the fennel with the onion and garlic. Drizzle with the oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 45 minutes, tossing the vegetables every 15 minutes or so. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Add the hot stock and the wine and bring to a boil. Stir in the saffron and cook until the mixture is reduced to about 1/2 cup. Toss the fennel with the sauce and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Grease or spray 24 muffin cups. In a large skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, stir together Bisquick, cornmeal, eggs, milk, cheese, and saltstir in sausage. Fill muffin cups three-quarters full. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from the oven and let the muffins cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Line a baking pan with aluminum foil, and lightly oil the foil with the olive oil. Mix together the bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, garlic powder and italian seasoning in a small bowl. In a shallow bowl or plate, lightly beat the egg with a fork. Dip each of the chicken breasts in the egg, and then in the bread crumb mixture to coat well on all sides. Place the chicken breasts on the prepared baking pan. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until cooked through. Prepare the escarole while the chicken bakes. In a large skillet over medium high heat, bring the broth to a boil, and add the escarole. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until the escarole is wilted. Add the parmesan cheese and garlic powder, and mix well. Drain the excess liquid from the escarole if necessary. To serve, spoon the escarole

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garliccook and stir until fragrant. Add the pork chops and cook until browned. Transfer to a 5-quart crockpot. Add soy sauce, broth and brown sugar. Cover and cook for 6 hours on low. Mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Pour over porkstir to combine. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Serve over hot rice.

Rinse beans well in a colander with cold water. Place in a large pot. Cover with cold water by 2 inches. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer 1 hour or until tender. Drain beans, reserving liquid. Saute onion in butter until tender. Add dry mustard, black pepper, maple syrup and enough of the reserved liquid to make a thick sauce. Pour over beansstir gently to blend. Bake in a shallow 2-quart casserole in a 350-degree oven about 1 hour or until heated through. Uncover beans during the last 15 minutes of baking. Add salt pork to beans just before serving, if desired. Makes 6 servings (3 cups)

Combine cocoa powder and hot water in small microwaveable bowl and stir until smooth. Stir in sugar, salt and butter. Beat with electric mixer at low speed until smooth and creamy. Beat at high speed until very fluffy and spreadable. Stir in vanilla.

Bring broth to a boil. Stir in quinoa and return to a boil. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add bell peppers, onion and garlic. Cook for an additional 10 minutes or until tender. Stir in chicken and basil. Cover and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until chicken is done. Stir in lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350.Line 24 muffin cups with paper baking cups or spray with baking spray.Combine egg whites, cream of tartar, splenda granular, and salt in a large bowl.Beat with an electric mixer at high speed until foamy.Add cornstarch, one teaspoon at a time, beating well after each addition.Gradually beat in vanilla and cocoa powder.Drop batter by teaspoonfuls into prepared cups.Bake 15 minutes or until set.Cool 10 minutes.Remove from pans.Cool completely.Combine icing ingredients in a small bowl.Spread onto cooled cupcakes.

Heat the oil in a small pan over medium heat. Add the cinnamon sticks, ground cumin, salt and the dried apricots. Cook for a few minutes until the dried apricots are softened. Pour the boiling water over the couscous in a heat-proof bowl. Stir well to combine. Cover the couscous. Let it sit for 5 minutes. Uncover the couscous. Add the apricots and currants. Fold in the pistachios. Add a few sprigs of mint and serve immediately.
In a small bowl whisk together blue cheese, walnuts, and parsley. In another bowl, beat butter until softened. Add blue cheese mixturebeat until well blended.

Bake pizza crust according to directions on box. Spread half the alfredo sauce over the crust. Arrange the spinach over the alfredo sauce and sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese. Bake for 6 to 8 minutes or until the cheese is melted and lightly browned. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. Cut into 6 wedges.

In a large skillet, brown the chicken breasts in the oil and garlic and onion until golden brown on both sides. Remove from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet saute the vegetables until tender. Add the chicken broth and continue cooking until the vegetables are tender and the liquid is evaporated. Add the sour cream and stir until well blended. Add the chicken and heat through. In a medium bowl, combine the soup, mayonnaise and cheese and stir until smooth. Spread one half of the soup mixture in the bottom of a casserole dish. Place the chicken and vegetable mixture on top of the soup mixture, then spread the other half of the soup mixture on top of the chicken and vegetables. Bake at 425 for about 20 minutes or until the top is nicely browned. Garnish with fried onions.
Heat butter and green onions in pan. Scramble eggs in pan. Add bacon. Add eggs and bacon to tortillas. Roll tortillas and place in pan. Cook in pan until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges. Serve.

Wash potatoes well and wrap each potato with 1/2 cup of foil. Place potatoes on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour. Cool for a few minutes before removing foil. Slice potatoes lengthwise to within 1/4 inch of the bottom and scoop out the potato. Reserve potato pulp for another use. To assemble potato, put a spoonful of cheese and roquefort cheese at the bottom of the potato and sprinkle with a little mustard and mayonnaise. Add the garlic and a touch of tabasco sauce to the potato pulp and then spoon the potato pulp back into the potato skin and top with a spoonful of butter and a little black pepper. Top with mixed nuts and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Cut french bread into 1/2 inch slices. Spread butter over one side. Top with minced garlic. Sprinkle freshly chopped parsley evenly over top. Bake for 7 minutes or until lightly browned.

Prepare 9" square pan by lining bottom and sides with wax paper, leaving enough overhang for easy removal. In a small saucepan bring 1 cup boiling water to a boil. Add dates and baking soda and stir well. Remove from heat and stir in margarine until well blended. Cool. In a large bowl combine sugar, eggs and flour. Beat at medium speed for 2 minutes. Stir in nuts and chocolate chips. Spread about half of the mixture into prepared pan. Spread date mixture over. Spread remaining cake mixture over. Bake at 350f for 35 to 40 minutes or until done. Cool. Remove from pan using overhang. Cut into squares. Store in airtight container. Makes 24 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups. In a large bowl, mash bananas. Add sugar, and egg. Mix well. In a small bowl, combine flax seeds and milk. Let stand for 5 minutes. Add vanilla and baking soda. Mix well. Add banana mixture, and mix well. In a small bowl, combine flour and baking powder. Add to banana mixture. Add salt and mix well. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool muffins in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack.

In saucepan over low heat, combine crushed pineapple, sugar, nuts and milk until thickened. Remove from heat. Add cream cheesemix until creamy. Spread between two slices of white breadtop with thin slice of white bread. Cut sandwich into triangles. Makes 3 dozen.

Place chocolate wafer pie crust on serving plate. In medium bowl, combine chocolate pudding mix, sugar, milk and eggs until well blended. Spread into crust. Refrigerate 2 hours or until set. Just before serving, top with whipped topping and chocolate curls. Serves 8.
Boil potatoes until just tender. Peel and mash them. Add in curds, mint leaves, green chili and chat masala. Mix well. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve it with hot roti or parathas.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a casserole dish combine squash, onion, sour cream and 1/2 cup of cheese. In a small bowl combine cracker crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over squash mixture. Bake for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of cheese. Bake for 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Put 1/3 cup milk in a small bowl and sprinkle with gelatin. Let stand 1 minute to soften gelatin. Add remaining milk and boiling water and stir over medium heat until gelatin is dissolved. Remove from heat and add irish mist. Stir until blended. Set aside to cool to room temperature. Add egg yolks and sugar and beat until thick and lemon colored. Fold in cream. Pour into a shallow metal baking dish and bake in 350f oven 1 hour or until set. Cool. Dust with confectioners sugar and serve with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

Combine cream cheese, garlic powder, 1 cup Parmesan cheese, and Romano cheese in a medium bowlbeat with a mixer at medium speed until well blended. Spread into a 13x9x2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until bubbly and browned on top. Combine spinach, pepper, and onionspread over the baked cheese mixturesprinkle with remaining 1 cup Parmesan cheese and Cheddar cheese. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with crackers or tortilla chips. Makes 24 servings (1/2 cup each).

In a large pot, cover chicken with water and add green cardamoms. Bring to a boil over high heat and reduce the heat to simmer. Cook until chicken is tender. Drain the chicken. In another pot, bring rice with enough water to cover to a boil. Cover pot and let stand for 5 minutes. Drain rice. In a third pot, bring milk to a boil. Add chicken, rice and salt. Stir until rice is fully coated with milk. Add the ghee. Stir until mixture thickens. Add the cardamom powder. Stir in the gum arabic. Pour into serving plates. Garnish with pistachios.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine potatoes and water and boil until potatoes are tender. Drain and return to the pot. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and cook until light golden brown, stirring constantly to prevent burning. Gradually add milk and cook over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Add to potatoes and mix well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot in bowls and sprinkle with parsley if desired.

Clean mushroom caps well with a wet brush. Brush caps with olive oil and sprinkle lightly with balsamic vinegar. Place caps in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned and tender. Saute leeks and spinach in a skillet until tender and remove from heat. Top caps with leek-spinach mixture and sprinkle with goat cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a wok or large saut pan over medium high heat. Add garlic and ginger and stir fry until fragrant. Add the pineapple and stir fry for about 1 minute. Add the soy sauce and cook until the pineapple juice is absorbed. Add the cooked rice and stir fry until heated through. Season with the crushed red pepper flakes and stir fry until the pineapple is coated with the spices and the rice is heated through. Remove from heat. Top with the green onions. Serve hot.

Peel, core and slice apples. Toss with lemon juice, sugar and spices. Line pie crusts with apples and dot with butter. Lay second pie crust over apples and crimp edges. Brush top crust with milk. Sprinkle with sugar. Bake 40 minutes or until crust is golden. Cool. Cut and serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

Peel bananas, and cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Place in a 1 1/2-quart bowl. Top with cake cubes. In a 2-quart bowl, sprinkle gelatin over 1/4 cup boiling water. Let stand for 1 minute to soften gelatin. Add remaining 1/2 cup boiling waterstir until gelatin is completely dissolved. Cool gelatin for 3 minutes. Stir in cold water and remaining 3 tablespoons water. Pour gelatin mixture over cake cubes and bananas. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour or until set. Top with whipped topping. Garnish with strawberries. Serve immediately or refrigerate covered until ready to serve.
Mix all ingredients in a mug. Top with whipped cream.

Combine the eggs, flour, salt and milk in a large bowl. Beat until smooth. Heat butter in an ovenproof frying pan until very hot but not brown. Add about a quarter of the mixture into the pan and spread until thin. Cook for about 2 minutes on one side, then turn over and cook on the other side for about another minute or until puffed up. Serve with jam or honey or just butter.

In a shallow bowl, combine flour, salt and black pepper. Dip the chicken into the flour mixture to coat. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon oil. Add the chicken and brown for about 5 minutes. Add the onion and cook for about 5 more minutes. Add the remaining 3 tablespoons oil. Add the soy sauce, vinegar, ginger, garlic powder and cayenne pepper. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove cover and continue to cook until the liquid has thickened. Remove from heat. Makes 6 servings (serving size: about 2 ounces raw chicken). Each serving has 175 calories, 25 grams (g) protein, 4 g fat, 1 g carbohydrate, 101 milligrams sodium. Exchanges per serving: 1 lean meat, 1 starch.

Mix first 5 ingredients and cook in medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil and boils gently for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely. Beat with electric mixer on high speed 15 minutes until mixture is light and foamy. Fold in remaining ingredients. Refrigerate until ready to use. Yields 8 servings.

Cook asparagus in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain and rinse with cold water until cool. In a large bowl, toss together the breadcrumbs, prosciutto and cheese until well blended. In another large bowl, whisk together the eggs, mustard, salt and pepper until smooth. Add the asparagus and toss until evenly coated. Transfer the asparagus mixture to the breadcrumb mixture, tossing until evenly coated. Pour mixture into an 11 x 7-inch glass baking dish. Bake 20 minutes, or until browned and crusty on top. Serve hot or at room temperature.

In a heavy sauce pan, saut√© the tomato paste over medium heat for about 1 minute. Stir in the celery, onions, carrots and tomatoes, along with about 1/2 cup of the heavy cream. Add the basil, salt and white pepper and let cook for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. In a blender or food processor, puree the mixture until smooth. Return to the pan over medium heat. Stir in the heavy cream and let cook for 10 minutes more or until slightly thickened. Serve immediately or cool and refrigerate for up to one week. Makes about 4 servings.

Prepare pizza sauce according to package instructions. In a medium bowl combine the ground beef, pizza sauce and mozzarella cheese. Spray a 13x9 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray and spread the bisquick batter evenly on the bottom of the pan. Spread the meat mixture evenly over the bisquick crust. Bake for 25 minutes or until the bisquick is golden brown and the meat is hot and bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a food processor combine the peanuts, garlic and olive oil. Pulse until the peanuts are coarsely chopped. Add the red hot pepper, cumin, chili powder and coarse salt. Pulse until the flavors are blended. Spread the mixture on a small plate or in a shallow bowl. Serve at room temperature.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat until hot and shimmery. Add onions. Stir fry 1 minute. Add steaks. Stir fry 5 minutes. Add cumin, salt and pepper. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Turn over and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Pour yogurt into shallow bowl. Stir in hot sauce. Add steaks and onions. Toss to coat. Garnish with parsley. Serve over rice or noodles.

Cut potatoes into quarters and place in a large saucepan with 4 cups water. Cover, bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to low and cook about 15 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender. Drain potatoes in a colander and return to saucepan. Add 2 tablespoons of bacon grease or butter, salt and pepper to taste and stir to coat potatoes. Mash potatoes with a potato masher until smooth or leave a little chunky for mashed potatoes. Serve immediately. Serves 4 to 6.

Cook macaroni in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or until tenderdrain. In small bowl, combine mayonnaise, chili powder and marinara saucestir until well mixed. In large bowl, combine macaroni, celery, onion, olives and sweet pickle relishstir in mayonnaise mixture. Cover and refrigerate until serving time. Garnish with parsley just before serving. Yield 12 servings.

Heat a wok or large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the oil. Add the garlic and stir-fry until it is lightly browned and fragrant. Add the bok choy and stir-fry until it is just wilted and bright green. Add the mushrooms and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the sugar and stir-fry until the sugar begins to melt and the bok choy is completely wilted. Add the chicken stock and fish sauce. Continue to stir-fry until the bok choy is soft and the liquid has evaporated. Serve hot.

Preheat a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Season the shrimp with salt and pepper. Add the olive oil to the pan. When the oil is hot, add the shrimp. Sear for 2-3 minutes on each side. Remove the shrimp from the pan. Squeeze the juice of two lemon wedges into the pan. Add the remaining lemon wedges. Let the pan sit for 1 minute to pick up the lemon flavor. Serve the shrimp with the lemon-infused pan juices. Garnish with fresh lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine carrots and 1 tsp tarragon. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add carrots, crushed pineapple, brown sugar, honey, remaining tarragon and salt. Cover. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix dry cornbread mix, milk and eggs together in a medium bowl. Stir in onion and cream-style corn. Fold in cheddar cheese, green chilies and pimientos. Spray 9-inch square pan with salad oil. Pour in batter. Bake 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cut into 4 squares. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Place evaporated milk and sugar in a heavy bottom saucepan. Stir over medium-high heat until boiling. Boil gently for 5 minutes without stirring. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Let cool to lukewarm. Beat in water until smooth and thickened. Stir in golden syrup, butter and glucose until blended. Pour into a greased 12 x 15 x 1 inch baking pan. Chill until firm. Cut into 24 squares. Store in an airtight container in refrigerator.

Add all ingredients except the shrimp into a large pot over high heat. Bring the mixture up to a boil and then reduce the heat to medium low for about 10 minutes until the shrimp are pink and firm when poked in the center. Remove the pot from the heat and let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serve the shrimp on a bed of rice or in a corn tortilla taco.

In a soup pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add garlic and cook until soft. Stir in carrots, celery and bouillon granules. Cook for 10 minutes or until vegetables are soft. Stir in cumin and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Cool slightly. Puree soup until smooth. Stir in ground almonds. Season with pepper. Serve hot with a sprinkle of fresh parsley. Serves 4.

Combine scallions, garlic, paprika, salt and pepper. Melt the butter. Place scallops in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Top with the garlic mixture. Broil 3 minutes per side or until scallops are cooked through. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Broil until lightly browned.

In a large bowl, combine whole wheat flour, baking powder and saltwhisk together egg whites, milk and honey. Combine all ingredients and stir until smooth. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full and bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes or until done. Makes 12 muffins.

In a saucepan melt butter and saute the onion until translucent. Stir in flour and cook for a few seconds. Add the milk slowly and stir until thickened. Add the crushed tomatoes and cook for a few minutes. Add the herbs and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot garnished with fresh basil leaves.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Cut the tortillas into wedges. Combine the salt, chili powder and lime juice in a plastic bag. Add the tortilla wedges and shake until they are well coated. Spread the tortilla wedges out on the baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve with salsa.

Beat eggs and sugar together in a bowl until fluffy. Beat in the mascarpone and rum. In another bowl, beat the cream until stiff. Fold the mascarpone mixture into the cream. Place about one third of the cream mixture in the bottom of a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish. Place a layer of soaked ladyfingers on top. Sprinkle with about half the cocoa. Repeat the layering. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Before serving, sprinkle the top lightly with cocoa and dust with cocoa. Serves 10-12.

Heat oil in a medium size soup pot. Saute onions and garlic over medium heat until onions are soft. Add carrots and cook for 2 minutes. Add lentils and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly to prevent lentils from sticking together. Add V-8 juice and water and bring the mixture to a boil. Lower heat and let simmer for 30 minutes or until lentils are soft. Season with chili powder and cumin. Add oregano and let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with fresh cornbread or whole wheat crackers and a side of sour cream and sliced avocado.

Preheat oven to 375. Place 1/2 cup cereal in a shallow bowl. Beat egg whites until stiff. Beat egg yolks. Dip chicken pieces in egg whites, then in cereal. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in skillet. Brown chicken on both sides. Place in baking dish. Combine 2 tablespoons butter and garlic salt. Spread over chicken. Bake 35 minutes. Meanwhile mix 1 cup cereal with 1/2 cup water. Stir in 1/2 cup of the sauce. Spread over chicken. Bake 10 minutes more.

In a 1 1/2-quart casserole, combine the rice, vermicelli, butter, chicken broth, salt and pepper. Cover with lid and simmer about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vermicelli is tender. Serves 6 to 8.

Bring stock to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in millet and cook, stirring frequently, 30 minutes or until millet is tender. Add scallions and onioncook 1 minute. Stir in tomato pastecook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Stir in frozen vegetablescook 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Melt marshmallows and butter in a double boiler or in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat. Stir in sugar and water until well blended. Beat in vanilla. Pour mixture onto wax paper or a silicon mat. Let set for 2 hours or until firm. Remove from mat or paper. Break into small pieces. Roll into balls. Roll in pecans. Store in an airtight container.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. In a large saucepan, melt Velveeta over low heat. Add milk and old cheddar cheese. Stir until well blended. Add macaroni noodles and cream cheese. Stir until well blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour into greased casserole dish and bake at 350 for one hour. Cool for five minutes before serving.

Heat oil in large saute pan over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook 1 minute. Add potato wedges. Toss to coat. Cook 5 minutes or until browned. Sprinkle with kosher salt. Serve immediately.

In large bowl combine sour cream and cream cheese. Beat until smooth. Blend in worcestershire sauce. Add garlic and mix well. Stir in dry onion soup mix. Spread evenly into 1-quart freezer container. Cover and freeze. Remove from freezer 15 minutes before serving. Thaw. Spread onto crackers or vegetables. Garnish with cheddar cheese and tabasco sauce. Makes 8 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook onion, ginger and garlic until tender, about 10 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook until softened. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Season with salt and pepper. Serve on warm toast.

Place ground beef in a bowl. Add onion. Mix well. Add eggs. Combine well. Add remaining ingredients. Combine well. Divide into 4 equal portions. Pat into 7-inch round patties. Place patties onto ungreased shallow 13-inch by 9-inch baking pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Turn loaves over. Bake 40 minutes longer or until meat loaf is no longer pink. Remove from pan.

Mix the sugar and cocoa in a bowl. Add the milk and butter. Stir until smooth and well blended. Add the light corn syrup and vanilla. Cook over low heat until thickened. Remove from the heat and beat in the peanut butter. Stir in the coconut and oats. Drop by spoonfuls on to wax paper. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and squash. Saute until tender and lightly browned. Add corn. Cook, stirring for 1 minute. Add green chilies and season with pepper. Cook and stir 1 minute longer. Spread in 1-1/2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered in 350 degree oven 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Melt margarine in crock pot. Stir in chicken broth and hot water. Add the bread cubes, celery, onions and seasonings. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours. Stir. Cover and cook on low for 30 minutes longer. Uncover and stir. Serve.

Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft and golden, about 5 minutes. Add the bell pepper and cook until tender, about 3 minutes. Add the chicken and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes. Stir in the barbecue sauce and cook until thickened and bubbly. Set aside. Preheat a grill pan over medium-low heat. Spread each tortilla with butter. Divide the chicken mixture evenly over half of each tortilla. Top with cheese slices. Cook until the cheese has melted and the tortillas are lightly browned on one side, about 2 minutes. Fold the tortillas in half and press gently to seal. Cook until the other side is lightly browned and the cheese has melted through, about 1 minute. Transfer to a cutting board and cut into quarters. Top with cilantro and serve.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Sprinkle the tenderloin medallions with the salt and pepper. In a skillet, heat the olive oil over high heat until it just begins to smoke. Add the medallions and brown on all sides until cooked through, about 6 minutes in all. Transfer the medallions to an ovenproof platter or a broiler pan. Add the figs and wine to the skillet, bring to a boil, scraping any brown bits from the bottom of the skillet. Pour the wine mixture over the medallions in the platter or panroast until the wine has reduced slightly and is syrupy, about 5 minutes. Serves 4 (serving size: about 2 medallions each with a fig).

Toss chicken with salt and pepper. In a wok or large saute pan over medium-high heat add oil and sear chicken until browned on both sides. Transfer to plate, add lemongrass to pan and stir-fry until aromatic. Stir in soy sauce until well blended and add chicken back to pan. Bring to a boil and simmer 10 minutes until done. Top with lime wedge and sprinkle with cilantro before serving.

In a large bowl combine couscous, oil, lemon juice and cilantro. Add tomatoes, bell pepper, and onion. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours. Garnish with fresh mint before serving.

Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil, stirring frequently until mixture thickens slightly. Serve over bratwurst or frankfurters. Makes about 4 cups. Fine cooking.

Soak the cinnamon sticks in the white wine for several hours before using them in this recipe. Soak the raspberries in cold water for about an hour before making the soup. In a blender combine the water, raspberries, cranberry juice, sugar and cinnamon sticks. Process until smooth and frothy. Strain through a fine sieve and discard the solids. Pour the raspberry mixture through a fine strainer into a saucepan and add the yogurt and lemon juice. Add the whole cloves and refrigerate. When ready to serve, pour the soup into bowls and sprinkle with fresh mint. Serve immediately.
Sift together the dry ingredients. Make a well in the center. Add milk. Add egg. Knead for 5 minutes. Drop dough by tablespoon full onto boiling water. Cook 10-15 minutes.

Melt butter in a small saucepan. Blend in flour. Add chicken broth and water, stirring constantly. Cook over low heat until thickened. Add cream of chicken soup, worcestershire sauce. Heat through. Serve over chicken, noodles or mashed potatoes.

In a heavy saucepan over medium heat combine cream, sugar and gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Add vanilla and almond extracts. Heat until small bubbles form on the sides of pan. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Beat until thickened. Fold in sour cream and raspberries. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Cover with plastic wrap directly on the custard surface. Refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Garnish with raspberries before serving.
Combine all ingredients, except walnuts in a large bowl. Chill 1 hour. Roll into balls and roll in walnuts. Chill again 1 hour before serving.

Place apples in a saucepan with water and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until apples are tender. Meanwhile, prepare the topping by combining flour, salt and Splenda. Cut butter into small pieces and add to flour mixture. Use your fingers to blend butter and flour together until the mixture resembles course crumbs. Mix in cinnamon. Place the apples in a 9 inch square baking dish and top with the topping. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Serves 8.

In a medium bowl, whisk together sour cream, shallots, tarragon and vinegar. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mash egg yolks into egg mixture. Mix well. Mash egg yolks into egg mixture. Mix well. In a medium bowl, whisk together sour cream, shallots, tarragon and vinegar. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mash egg yolks into egg mixture. Mix well. Add mashed eggs and mix until blended. Cover and refrigerate 1-2 hours. Meanwhile slice bread and spread bottom half of bread with butter. Place baby spinach leaves and top with tomatoes. Spread egg salad on top half of bread. Place sandwich together and slice in half.

Heat a skillet over medium-high heat, add the bacon grease and let it melt and bubble. Add the sauerkraut and stir it around to coat evenly with the grease and flavor. Remove from heat and let it cool to room temperature. In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise and the horseradish. Add the mayonnaise mixture to the sauerkraut and stir thoroughly. Add the Swiss cheese and stir until it is evenly distributed throughout the sauerkraut mixture. Serve in a hot dog bun and top it off with a dash of paprika and a sprinkling of parsley or chives for a garnish. Serve with extra sauerkraut on the side and a tall cold glass of milk.

Mix marinade together. Add steak and turn to coat both sides. Marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Grill steaks on a hot grill for 2 minutes on each side. Baste with the marinade and cook for 5 minutes per side. Remove to a warm platter and garnish with blackberry sauce. Prepare blackberry sauce by sauteing blackberries with sugar and water in a saucepan over medium heat until thickened. Stir in butter. Add herbes de provence and cognac. Simmer for a couple minutes. Serve hot over filet.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease an 8-inch square baking dish with butterset aside. Cut the bread into 1-inch cubesplace the cubes in the prepared baking dish.In a large bowl, beat the eggs with the sugar and vanilla until lightenedmix in the amaretto and eggnog until smooth. Pour the mixture over the bread cubestoss well to combine. Sprinkle with cinnamon and raisins. Bake for 50 minutes or until set in the middle. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

Heat oven to 400. Cook pancetta in skillet over medium heat until crisp and golden. Remove pancetta from skillet and set aside on paper towels to drain. Cook garlic and pancetta drippings in same skillet over medium heat until garlic is golden brown. Add tomatoes and wine. Simmer until thickened. Add cream and basil. Heat through. Add fettuccini and cook until heated through. Serve with parmesan cheese on top.

In a small bowl combine peanut butter, milk and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add powdered sugar and beat until smooth. Fold in kisses. Set aside. Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Unroll dough. Spread condensed milk mixture on dough to within 1/4-inch of edges. Starting at 1 corner roll up tightly. Place seam side down on greased cookie sheet. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 5 minutesremove from cookie sheet. Cool completely on wire racks. Makes 20.

Season chicken with hot pepper sauce. Add chicken broth, squash, potatoes, corn and carrots. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 40 minutes. Add cooked rice and cook an additional 10 minutes until rice is heated through. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

Wash elderberriespick out any unripe berries, stems, or leaves. Put the berries in a large saucepan with 1 cup water. Bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat, cover, and cook for 15 minutes or until berries are very soft. Pour berries with liquid into a food processor or blenderprocess until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Add sugar, lemon juice, flour, and cinnamonmix well. Roll out pastry to fit a 9-inch pie pan with a 1 1/2-inch rimtransfer to pie pan. Pour in berry mixturedot with butter. Roll out top pastryplace on top of filling. Seal and flute edgescut vents in top crust to let steam escape. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutesreduce heat to 350 degrees (do not cover). Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until crust is browned and filling is set. Remove from ovencool on wire rack for 1 hour before cutting. Serve warm or cold with wh

Cook potatoes in boiling salted water until tender but not falling apart, about 20 minutes or until a paring knife can easily pierce the center of the potato. Drain potatoescut them into quarters and return them to the pan. Cover with a lid or foil and allow to steam until cool enough to handle. Squeeze the potato pieces to remove as much of the potato starch as possible, then mash with a potato masher or fork until smooth. Season the potatoes with the cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper to taste. Set aside to cool. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and melt the butter with the onions until softened, about 4-5 minutes. Add the mashed potatoes and mix well to combine. Add the parmesan cheese and mix well to combine. Taste for seasoning. Set aside to cool. Fill the shells with the potato mixture and place them on a parchment lined baking sheet. Place the shells in the refrigerator to firm up while you make the cheese

Line a 20cm square pan with non-stick baking paper. Preheat oven to 180c. In a saucepan, melt the butter together with the chocolate and golden syrup. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat. Add the sugar. Stir until sugar has dissolved. Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each. Sieve the flour into the chocolate mixture. Add the cocoa and salt. Stir to combine. Fold in the nuts. Pour mixture into pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Let cool before cutting. Cut into 16 bars.

Pound fillets to an even thickness. Place in a bowl and mix together with thyme and milk. Allow to marinate for 10 minutes. Mix breadcrumbs with paprika and parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Drain fish, then coat with breadcrumbs. Place in a hot oven and roast for 10 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Melt butter in a heavy frying pan. Add the dry mustard, Worcestershire sauce and season to taste. Cook over a very low heat for 5 minutes. Add the cheese by handfuls, stirring until it is almost melted. Take off the heat. Lay thick slices of bread in a dish. Pour the Welsh rarebit over the bread slices. Sprinkle with some chutney. Bake in a moderate oven for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Place a small saute pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds to the pan and toast them until they begin to pop. Be careful not to burn them. Turn off the heat. Let the seeds cool for a few minutes. Add the oil to the pan and turn the heat back to medium. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the cauliflower to the pan and saute for 5 minutes. Add the salt and pepper and toss. Sprinkle with the cumin seeds. Serve immediately.

Cook chicken breasts in chicken broth until tender, about 20 minutes. Let cool enough to handle. Remove skin from chicken and shred meat with your fingers. Mix chicken with remaining ingredients. Serve on your favorite sandwich bread.

Slice the liver into bite size pieces. Dust each piece with flour, sprinkle with pepper and salt, then set aside. In a large saucepan melt the olive oil. Add onions and saute until golden brown and translucent. Add the liver pieces, turning the onions so that the onions cover the liver. Add the beef broth. Cover the pan. Cook on low heat for 1/2 hour or until the liver is tender when pierced with a fork. Add the flour and water mixture, continue cooking for 2 minutes or until gravy is thickened. Serve hot.

In saucepan combine tuna with water. Add creamed corn and onion. Cook for 2 minutes or until hot and onion is tender. Stir in broccoli and cook for an additional minute. In small bowl, combine flour and water until smooth. Add flour mixture to soup. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Stir in milk. Heat until hot. Stir in salt and pepper and cayenne pepper.

Make dressing by mixing together olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic, shallot and mustard. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook shrimp in boiling water for 4 minutes. Remove from water and cool in ice water bath for about 5 minutes. Remove shrimp from bath. Peel shells from shrimp, discard shells. Toss lettuce, radicchio, tomatoes and shrimp with dressing in serving bowl. Serve immediately.

Place the frozen raspberries in a large bowl. Add the water and stir. Add the sugar and flour and stir to combine. Cook over low heat for about 30 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and let cool. This mixture can be used in pies and cakes.

Heat oil in large pan. Saute onion and ginger until tender. Stir in garlic and spices and saute 1 minute longer. Add carrots and parsnips and saute 5 minutes. Stir in stock and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 20 minutes until vegetables are tender. Cool slightly and puree in blender. Return puree to pan and stir in sour cream. Heat through and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Place ham in 4 quart crock pot. Add cloves and juices. Mix brown sugar with cornstarch in a small bowl to make a paste. Stir into juices in crock pot. Cover and cook on low heat for 8-10 hours or high heat for 4-5 hours. Remove ham from crock pot. Strain juices into a saucepan. Add mustard to taste. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sauce is thickened. Pour sauce over ham and serve.

Cut off the woody ends of the asparagus spears and cook them in boiling water for 2 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain. In a small bowl, whisk together the wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, shallots, parsley, and peanut oil. Pour the vinaigrette over the asparagus spears, tossing to coat well. Season with salt to taste. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine first four ingredients and mix well with hands. Shape mixture into 4 patties and place onto a baking sheet lined with foil. Bake for 20 minutes or until browned.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook the orzo until al dente according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. Heat the oil in a medium non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shallot and garlic and saute until they begin to soften, about 1-2 minutes. Stir in the ham and cook until it is heated through. Add the half-and-half and cook until the half-and-half is warm. Add the orzo and peas and mix to combine. Add the parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Transfer to a large serving bowl. Serve at once. Serves 8.

Trim the excess fat from the lamb leg. Wash the lamb thoroughly and pat dry. Rub the lamb with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook until the onions are translucent. Add the lamb and brown on all sides. Add the thyme and sprinkle with the flour. Add the wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add enough water so that the lamb is covered by 2 inches. Add the parsley. Cover and simmer on low for 3 hours. Remove the lamb from the broth and allow it to rest for 30 minutes. Strain the broth and reduce by half. Strain the broth again through cheesecloth. Serve the lamb sliced with the broth on the side. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serves 4-6.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring frequently until softened about 8 minutes. Add tomatoes, sugar, vinegar, molasses, garlic, cumin, paprika and allspice. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add cranberries, reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally until cranberries burst about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Transfer to a bowl. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve as a side dish with roast chicken or turkey.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter and saute onion until tender. Add flour and stir until blended. Gradually add broth and mix well. Add cream of chicken soup and stir until smooth and well blended. Add half-and-half cream and mix well. Add ham and cauliflower and continue cooking until vegetables are tender. Stir in cornstarch mixed with cold water and bring to a boil, stirring constantly until thickened. Add chives and pepper and stir well. Serve in individual bowls and sprinkle with parsley if desired.

In a medium sized sauce pan, combine sugar, minute tapioca and milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolks. Return to medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add vanilla and salt. Pour into a greased 9 x 9 x 3 inch baking pan or 3 individual baking dishes. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes at 350 degrees f or until set. Cool. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine biscuit mix, cheddar cheese, sesame seeds and half-and-half or milk with a pastry blender or two knives until well-blended. Add butter and work into the mixture with your hands just until well-blended. On a lightly-floured surface, roll dough into a 1/2-inch-thick rectangle. Cut into rounds with a 2-inch cutter or glass. Place biscuits on ungreased baking sheets. Bake in a preheated 400 degree F oven for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 2 dozen.

Beat the cake mix, eggs and vegetable oil in a mixing bowl. Stir in the chocolate chips. Form into small balls and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for about 2 minutes before removing from the baking sheet. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 3 months.

Brown chicken breasts in butter or margarine. In a small bowl combine soup and rotel tomatoes. Set aside. In a greased casserole dish, layer 1/2 of the chicken, then 1/2 of the soup mixture, then 1/2 of the corn, then 1/2 of the pepper cheese. Repeat layering process ending with pepper cheese on top. Sprinkle with green onions. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until heated through and browned on top. Remove from oven and sprinkle with doritos. Return to oven for another five minutes.

Boil the potatoes until they are done. Cut the leeks and saute them in butter for about ten minutes until tender. In the meantime mix the flour and nutmeg with the milk. When the potatoes are done add them to the leeks and mix well. Add the milk mixture and cook until thickened. Add the salt and pepper and pour into a pie dish. Bake at 375¬∞ for about 30 minutes or until the pie is lightly browned.

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9-inch square baking pan.2. In a large saucepan combine brown sugar, flour, vanilla, butter, sugar, milk, salt and baking powder. Mix well.3. Pour into baking pan. Bake 25 to 35 minutes.4. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.5. Serves 10.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Season the roast with salt, pepper, thyme, rosemary and vinegar. Rub the olive oil over the roast. Roast in the preheated oven for about 1 hour. Check for doneness after 1 hour of cooking by inserting a meat thermometer into thickest part of roast. It should read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C). Allow to rest for 10 minutes before carving.

Puree onions and garlic in blender until smooth. Strain through a sieve and discard solids. Add orange, lemon and lime juices and water. Add oregano and cumin. Chill for at least an hour. Season with salt.

Heat a large heavy skillet over medium high heat and add butter. Place chicken in skillet and brown both sides. Sprinkle with parmesan and garlic and pepper to taste. In a separate bowl, combine cornflakes and ranch dressing mix and sprinkle over chicken. Drizzle with additional butter and serve. Serves 3 - 4.

Place the tilapia fillets into a greased baking dish. In a bowl combine the onion, tomatoes, garlic and basil. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper and pour the mixture over the tilapia fillets. Bake at 450 for 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with rice and steamed vegetables.

In a medium bowl, toss together the walnuts, shallot, vinegar, walnut oil, extra-virgin olive oil, salt, and pepper. Add celery and dates. Add cheese, tossing gently to combine. Let stand for at least 30 minutes.

Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add the sprouts and garlic clove. Saute until sprouts are bright green and garlic is golden. Add the vinegar and water and stir until the liquid is reduced by half and the sprouts are tender crisp. Remove from heat and stir in the parmesan cheese and the salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately while still hot.

Mix herbs with crumbs in shallow dish. Press fillets in herb crumbs on both sides. Beat egg yolks in shallow bowl until frothybeat in flourstir in enough milk to make a smooth batter. Dip fish in battercoat with breadcrumbs. Heat oil in heavy skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add fishfry 3 minutes or until golden on both sides. Remove fishdrain on paper towels. Yield 4 servings

In a microwaveable bowl, melt peanut butter on high for 30 seconds. Stir in banana pieces. In a glass bowl, combine peanut butter mixture with ice cream. Top with chocolate syrup, caramel sauce and whipped topping.

Heat broth to a simmer in a medium saucepan. Add red cabbage and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes. Drain cabbage and puree in a blender until smooth. Return puree to pan. Stir in lemon juice and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serves 4

Heat vegetable oil in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add scallions and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add eggs. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook until eggs are just set, about 3 minutes. Transfer eggs to a plate. Dip tortillas into egg mixture, then coat both sides with flour. Add tortillas to hot skillet. Cook until crisp on both sides, about 1 minute per side. Spread tortilla with salsa. Top with eggs. Roll up. Cut into quarters.

Preheat oven to 180 c. Wash beets and slice thinly. Place in an ovenproof dish. Drizzle with 2 tbsp of the oil, season with salt, pepper and garlic. Roast for 30 minutes. Place salad leaves in serving bowl. Drizzle over 2 tbsp of oil. Scatter onions and beetroots. Toss well. Drizzle over remaining oil. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Serve.
Melt cream cheese in microwave. Mix together all ingredients. Add ice cubes. Blend in mixer. Makes 2 servings.
In a shaker, combine ginger ale and orange wedges. Pour into a glass. Add coffee liqueur. Add ice cubes. Top with vanilla vodka. Stir. Serve.

Place the chicken breast halves in the crock pot and add the red peppers. Sprinkle with the garlic powder and dried rosemary. Add the olive oil. Add 1 cup of water to the crock pot. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cook on low for 6 to 7 hours.

Soak 3 to 4 onions in warm water for 10 minutes to reduce tearing. In pressure cooker, saute the onions and green peppers in cooking oil until tender. Add tomato juice and bring to a boil. Place steaks in cooking pot and cover with tomato juice mixture. Sprinkle steaks with salt and pepper. Place lid on cooker and bring to high pressure. Cook for 15 minutesreduce heat to low and cook for 10 minutes more. Remove lid from cooker and drain off liquid. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes.

Rub both sides of lamb chops with apricot jam. Combine ketchup and garlic powderspread on both sides of chops. Combine ketchup and garlic powderspread on both sides of chops. Let stand at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours. Place lamb chops on a broiler panspray with cooking spray. Broil about 4 inches from heat for 3 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. Serve with desired amount of ketchup-garlic powder mixture and remaining apricot jam.

Puree mangoes in food processor. Add ice and puree again. Strain through cheesecloth to remove seeds. Combine lime juice, lemongrass and sugar. Pour over mango puree. Refrigerate at least one hour before serving. Serve with a scoop of ice cream or sorbet. Garnish with mint.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and put in a large salad bowl. In a separate bowl combine dijon mustard, white wine vinegar, and olive oil. Stir to mix well and add to potatoes. Add parsley to top before serving.

Wash & dry berries. Mash berries in a large bowl with a potato masher until juice flows. Add sugar, lemon juice & water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally until sugar dissolves (about 5 minutes). Add pectin & bring back to a boil. Stir constantly for 1 minute until thickened & clear. Ladle into warm sterilized jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Wipe jar rims with damp paper towels & cover with lids & bands. Process in a boiling water bath canner for 5 minutes. Makes 4 pints.

In skillet brown beef and onion over medium-high heat for 5 minutes or until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in seasoning mix and water. Bring to boilreduce heat. Coversimmer for 5 minutes or until beef is tender. Serve taco filling with taco shells. Top with lettuce, tomatoes and cheese.

Preheat oven to 220C/Gas 7. Pull out the basil leaves from their stalks and chop finely. Put them into a bowl with the garlic, olive oil and some seasoning (salt and black pepper) and mix. Take the tomatoes and cut them into quarters. Put them into a roasting tray and add the olive oil and seasoning. Roast for 20 minutes or until they begin to soften. Once they are cool enough to handle, place them in a food processor with the horseradish. Blitz until smooth. Add the vodka and blitz again. Add the vinegar and blitz again. Pour into a bowl and add the basil mixture and mix well. Serve with cold beetroot.
Blend strawberries, banana and tangelo in blender until smooth. Add splenda sugar substitute and ice cubes and blend until smooth again. Serve immediately.

Wash tomatoes and remove core from each tomato. Salt tomatoes and leave in fridge for half hour. Fry bacon until crisp. Chop bacon into small pieces. Chop onion into small pieces. Place breadcrumbs in a bowl. Mix together tomato pulp and breadcrumbs. Add bacon, onion and parsley. Season. Place mixture into each tomato and cook in oven for 20 minutes.

In a large bowl beat together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla essence. In a separate bowl sift together flour and salt. Add flour mixture to butter mixture and combine until dough forms. Divide dough in half and wrap each half in cling film. Refrigerate for at least one hour or overnight. Preheat oven to 180C/350F/Gas Mark 4. Remove one half of the dough from fridge and roll out on a floured surface about a quarter of an inch thick. Using a floured cookie cutter cut out cookies and place on a lined baking tray. Repeat with remaining dough. Bake for about 12 minutes or until golden. Cool on a wire rack. Store in an airtight container.

Slice zucchini into 1/4-inch thick pieces, and place in a large bowl. Toss with 2 tablespoons of basil-garlic-oregano seasoning and 1 teaspoon garlic salt. Heat cooking spray in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook 2 minutes or until golden brown. Add zucchini mixture and remaining 2 tablespoons basil-garlic-oregano seasoning and 1 teaspoon garlic saltcook and stir 3 minutes or until zucchini is tender and onion is golden brown. Divide evenly among 4 serving platessprinkle each serving with 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese and basil.

Combine first three ingredients. Mix well with ham and marinate for a day. Remove ham from marinade. Bake at 375 for 35-45 minutes. Baste with marinade every 15 minutes. Cook until done (155 internal temperature).

Mix all ingredients except onion soup mix together with your hands. Add the soup mix to the meat mix and mix with your hands until combined. Form into a loaf shape and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cook to an internal temperature of 160 degrees with a meat thermometer.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix flour, margarine and milk. Crumble mixture over fish. Sprinkle with frozen peas. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve on toast.

Put honey snap biscuits into a food processor with the butter. Process until the biscuits are finely crushed. Remove about a third of the crushed biscuits. Mix the gelatin with the water. Heat the cream cheese and the caster sugar in a saucepan until the cheese is melted. Stir over a low heat. Remove from the heat and stir in the gelatin mixture. Stir in the remaining crushed biscuits. Pour into a 22cm round springform tin. Refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight. Meanwhile make the chocolate mixture. Put the chocolate candy bars into a bowl. Heat the cream until boiling. Pour over the chocolate candy bars. Stir until the candy bars have melted. Leave the mixture for 1 minute until it thickens. Pour over the set cheesecake. Refrigerate for a further 4 hours. Remove the sides of the springform tin and transfer the cheesecake onto a cake board. Decorate with a few extra chocolate candy bars.
Mix cream cheese and cheddar cheese together until smooth. Stir in imitation crabmeat. Spread over tortilla and roll up burrito style. Top with salsa and enjoy.
Add all ingredients together. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese on top. Bake at 350f degrees for 20 minutes.

Bring water to boil and cook the noodles for 3 minutes. Rinse with cold water. Combine soy sauce and mirin in a small bowl. Combine ginger and leeks in another small bowl. Divide noodles into two bowls. Divide soy sauce mixture and ginger mixture evenly. Top each serving with nori and wasabi.
Mix spices together. Dip chicken tenders in egg then roll in spices. Fry chicken in butter and cream for 15 minutes. Serve with rice.

Combine achiote seeds with salt to taste in a dry skillet. Heat until aroma develops. Remove from heat. Combine rice with 2 cups water in a pot to soak overnight (can leave out on counter). The next day, heat oil in a separate pot. Add onion, cooking until translucent. Add rice, bacon, 3 cups water, achiote mixture and salt to taste. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until all liquid is absorbed (about 45 minutes). Do not stir once rice starts to boil. Remove from heat. Fluff rice with a fork before serving. Serves 4-6.

Heat 2 tbs canola oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic, carrot and rice and cook until rice is golden, about 10 minutes. Add chicken stock, cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat, cover and simmer until rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Add green chiles and lime juice. Season with salt. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In saucepan cook onion in 1 TBS butter until tender. Add soup and milk. Heat to boiling. Stir in mustard. Add sauerkraut and noodles. Cook 1 minute. Stir in sausage and cheese. Pour into greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Topping: In saucepan melt remaining butter. Stir in breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over top of mixture. Bake 30 minutes or until golden. Serve with coleslaw or potato salad.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat 1 tbs. butter in a skillet. Add the salad dressing, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and garlic. Cook until heated through. Dip both sides of the chicken in the mixture. Place chicken in a lightly greased 11x7 inch baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until juices run clear when the thickest part of the chicken is cut. Sprinkle the top with parsley.

Peel and wash the potatoes. Cut them into halves or quarters. Cook them in the boiling water until the potatoes are tender. Drain and set aside. In a small nonstick skillet over medium high heat, crumble the bacon into the skillet. Cook the bacon until the fat is rendered and the bacon is crisp. Drain the bacon onto paper towel. Remove all but 2 tablespoons of the bacon grease. Add the onions. Cook over medium heat until the onions are tender and golden. Add the potatoes to the skillet. Add the chicken stock. Mix well. Add the bacon and salt and pepper to taste. Stir well. Serve hot.

Place the chicken breasts in a plastic bag. Mix the yogurt and mustard together and pour over the chicken. Refrigerate for several hours. Preheat the oven to 400f. Grease a shallow baking dish with butter or cooking spray. Slice the muffins in half and lay them cut side up in the pan. Add the chicken and spread it out to cover the muffins. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the chicken. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Prick sweet potatoes with a fork a few times. Place on a foil lined baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for about 1 hour or until very soft when poked with a fork. Remove from oven and let cool for about 5 minutes. While sweet potatoes are cooking, place sour cream in a bowl. Whisk in maple syrup. Add salt and cinnamon. Spread evenly over top of sweet potatoes. Sprinkle with pecans and drizzle with melted butter. Place back in the oven for about 10 minutes until potatoes are heated through and the sour cream mixture is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 6 x 8 inch glass or ceramic baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Break potatoes into small pieces and place in dish. Melt butter. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredients and toss with potatoes. Pour over the potatoes. Bake for 45 minutes. To serve, place on a platter and sprinkle with extra cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Combine eggs and buttermilk. Add buttermilk and mix well. Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix well. Heat a skillet or griddle over medium low heat. Add a little butter or oil. Using a 1/4 cup measuring cup, drop batter by the scoop onto the griddle. Cook until the edges are set and the bottoms are browned, then flip and cook the other side. Serve with butter and real maple syrup.

In a bowl combine romaine lettuce, corn, black beans, tomatoes, and green onionsset aside. In another bowl add the cheddar cheese and ranch dressing and stir together. Serve the salad on a plate or bowl and top with the ranch dressing/cheddar mixture and salsa.

Grease baking sheets. Sift flour into medium bowl. In another bowl combine butter, sugar, milk, baking soda and vanilla. Stir well. Add flour mixture to wet mixture. Stir well. Shape into rounds. Bake in preheated 350 degree F. oven for about 10 minutes. Cool. Dust with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease 9x13 inch baking pan. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup sugar and 1/4 cup cinnamon. In a large bowl combine 2 cups all purpose flour, 1 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Mix well. In another bowl combine egg and milk. Add to flour mixture and beat with electric mixer on low speed just till moistened. In another bowl combine 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons cinnamon. In another bowl combine blueberries and 1/4 cup flour. Spoon half of batter into prepared baking pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 of sugar/cinnamon mixture. Top with half of blueberries. Repeat layers. Bake 40-45 minutes or till golden brown. Cool 10 minutes on wire rack. Serve warm.

In a 12-inch skillet or frying pan, melt the bacon grease. Add the onion and fry until golden brown. Add the garlic and fry until fragrant. Add the whole tomatoes and their juice and the water. Add the salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 40 minutes. Add the ancho chili and chili powder and stir. Stir in the sugar and simmer for 30 minutes. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

In a large Dutch oven or other heavy pot combine the chicken broth and butter and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the onion and cook until tender but not browned, about 15 minutes. Stir in the honey and the lemon zest and juice and bring the mixture back to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer uncovered for about 20 minutes or until the onion is soft and the liquid is reduced by half. Transfer the onions into the baking dish and top with the paprika and cheese.
