Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and browned on top, about 15 minutes. Garnish with parsley before serving.

Soak dates in wine overnight. Next day, place in a heavy skillet and add almonds, walnuts & honey. Cook over medium heat until dates are soft. Add lemon juice & lemon rind. Stir. Cook for another minute. Serve with cheese & sea salt.

Place the beans and broth in a saucepan over high heat and bring to a boil. Cover the pot and simmer for 30 minutes or until the beans are very tender. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for another 10 minutes or until thickened. Garnish each serving with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkling of green onion.

Heat a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of the oil, the garlic and gingerroot and saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the green beans and cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Season with the salt and pepper. Remove from the heat. Transfer to a plate. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil in the frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the black bean sauce and stir until smooth. Add the green beans and saute until the sauce coats the green beans but is not too thick, about 30 seconds. Transfer to a platter. Sprinkle the white sesame seeds on top. Makes 2 servings.

On a pizza pan, arrange the pizza crust as desired. Sprinkle with the barbecue beef and top with the red onions. Sprinkle with the smoked cheddar cheese. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted.

Slice off the crust from the bread. Spread the inside of each slice with Miracle Whip. Spread one slice of bread with ham and the other slice with cheese. Place the cheese on the bottom half of the bread and the ham on the top half. Place the lettuce leaf in the middle. Press the two halves of bread together. Wrap the sandwich in plastic wrap and refrigerate. To serve, cut the sandwich into 10 bite-sized pieces. Arrange the pieces in the shape of a coffin.

Soak 125g (4¬Ωoz) of couscous in 1 litre (1¬æ pints) of boiling water for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Drain excess liquid, reserving 3 tablespoons of water. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large frying pan with 1 medium onion, peeled and sliced. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until softened then add 2 cloves of garlic, finely chopped. Cook for another minute or two until golden then add 1 bunch of fresh coriander, chopped, 100g (3¬Ωoz) of cherry tomatoes, halved, 12 medium prawns (shells on) and 3 avocadoes, diced into 1cm chunks. Cook for a further 2-3 minutes before adding 1 lime, zested and juiced. Stir in 1 teaspoon of honey, 2 tablespoons of fresh coriander leaves and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Fold in drained couscous and drizz

Dissolve cornstarch in broth. Place chicken in broth and cook for 10 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 10 more minutes. Add soy sauce and brown sugar and cook for 10 more minutes. Add broccoli, carrots and peas and cook for another 5 minutes. Thicken sauce with cornstarch and broth. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat the oven to 200c/400f/gas mark 6. Cut the fish fillets into pieces about 2cm thick, then put them on a baking tray with the breadcrumbs, garlic, parsley, lemon zest and lemon juice. Pour over the olive oil and season well with coarse salt and black pepper, then mix well. Bake the fish for 15-20 minutes or until browned and cooked through. Serve hot with potatoes or rice, or with salad leaves.
Trim asparagus and peel strawberries. Combine asparagus, strawberries, lemon juice and vegetable oil in salad bowl. Toss lightly. Sprinkle with honey. Serve on lettuce leaves.

In a medium bowl combine the egg and sugar. Stir to combine. Add the corn, flour, baking powder, milk and butter and mix together. Heat the oil to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Drop batter by tablespoons into the hot oil and fry 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown. Remove with slotted spoon to paper towels to drain.

Chop carrot and cabbage very fine. Grate apple. In a large bowl toss cabbage, carrot, and apple together. In a medium bowl combine mayonnaise and yogurt. Stir in lemon juice and sugar. Season with salt and pepper. Add the dressing to the cabbage mixture and toss to coat evenly. Chill until serving time.

Preheat oven to 325f. Combine sugar, paprika, chili powder, garlic powder and salt in a bowl. In another bowl, mix together the ground allspice and ground black pepper. Rub 1/2 of the spice mixture onto both sides of ribs. Place ribs in shallow dish. Drizzle with vinegar and turn ribs to coat with vinegarrub the remaining 1/2 spice mixture onto both sides of the ribs. Place in a shallow dish and roast until meat is tender and easily falls off the bone, about 2 hours. Serve with the barbecue sauce.

Preheat oven to 375F. Combine flour, baking soda and salt. In another bowl combine the butter, peanut butter and sugars until smooth. Add the egg and vanilla. Mix until blended. Gradually beat in the flour mixture. Fold in the chocolate chips and oats. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool for 1 minute before removing from the baking sheets to wire racks. Cool completely. Makes about 3 dozen.
Wash potatoes well. Cut into wedges. Put in bowl with 1 tbs. olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic powder, salt, and red pepper. Toss gently. Bake in preheated 400 f. oven for 45 minutes. Turn once.

In large bowl, beat cream cheese and sour cream until light and fluffy. Add sugar, vanilla and eggs. Beat well. Stir in melted butter. Pour mixture into 9-inch pie plate. Bake 15 minutes. Spread with Cinnamon Spread. Cut rolls in half and arrange over Cinnamon Spread. Bake 15 minutes longer.

Heat olive oil in large frying pan. Add onions and saut until they are translucent. Add herbs and saut another 30 seconds. Beat eggs together, season with salt and pepper and pour over onions. Cook until eggs are just set in the middle. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel potatoes and cut into 1/4 inch cubes. Add orange juice, butter, brown sugar, cranberries, orange zest and salt to a bowl. Toss together. Place into a baking dish. Sprinkle with slivered almonds. Bake for 45 minutes, or until potatoes are cooked through. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In large bowl, stir together brown sugar and flour. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. In separate bowl, beat eggs and half-and-half cream with electric mixer until blended. Stir into flour mixture until just moistened. Pour into 10 inch pie plate coated with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. Drizzle with maple syrup and sprinkle with cinnamon-nutmeg. Serve immediately.

Fry bacon until crisp. Cut pork chops into 1 1/2-inch strips. Cook pork until no longer pink. Add onion, garlic, sauerkraut, paprika, sugar and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until sauerkraut is tender-crisp about 5 minutes. Pour in beerstirring until well blended. Cook until liquid is reduced by half about 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Sift together the flours and baking soda. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add the sugar and salt. Add the buttermilk gradually until the mixture comes together in a soft dough. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead gently for about 5 minutes. Add more flour if the dough is too sticky. Roll out into a circle about half an inch thick. Cut into triangular wedges with a sharp knife and put on a greased baking sheet. Brush with a little milk. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 C / Gas 4 for about 35 minutes until golden brown and sounding hollow when tapped. Serve warm with butter.

Mix dry ingredients together. Add bananas and nuts. Mix well. Add margarine and mix until crumbly. Add eggs one at a time. Beat until smooth. Pour into greased and floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour. Check after 50 minutes. If done, take out and cool. If not done, bake at 325 degrees until done.

Crack 1 egg into a small bowl and beat. Coat a 10-inch skillet with cooking spray and place over medium heat. Place a 4x4 piece of matzoh in the skillet and spoon the egg over it. Top with 1 tablespoon of grated yellow cheese. Cook until the egg is set and the matzoh is golden brown. Repeat with the remaining matzoh and egg. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut tomatoes in half lengthwise and sprinkle with basil and pepper. Place in a glass baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until softened and slightly browned. Serve over pasta or rice, or use as a topping for bruschetta or pizza.
Beat together cheese, mayonnaise, ketchup, and worcestershire sauce. Add 2 tablespoons of tabasco sauce. Chill. Combine all ingredients and spread in a 10-inch pie plate. Chill. Serves 4-6.

In a small saucepan over low heat, combine cocoa and cornstarch. Stir until smooth. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine milk and sugar. Stir until boiling and thick. Add cocoa and stir until thick. Add vanilla and stir until blended. Remove from heat and stir in nonfat milk. Stir in frozen whipped topping. Cool to room temperature. Pour into chocolate mold or 12 paper cups. Place in refrigerator to chill overnight. Unmold. Garnish with chocolate shavings. Serve chilled.

Heat olive oil in medium saute pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add mushrooms and cook 4 minutes or until tender. Add spinach and cook 2 minutes. Add blue cheese and garlic and stir to combine. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. Spoon mixture into mushroom caps and serve.

Melt butter in large pot. Add onion and garlic and cook over medium heat until onions are soft. Stir in ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Add pork and beans. Stir in tomato sauce. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add mustard and brown sugar. Cook an additional 5 minutes. Serve with hot dog buns.
Place potatoes and juice in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Add sugar and cranberries and mash. Season with salt and pepper.

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken, fish sauce, lime juice and green onions. Stir-fry until chicken is cooked through and green onions are soft. Add red onions. Stir-fry a few more minutes until red onions are soft. Transfer mixture to a plate. Prepare rice powder by mixing it with 1 tsp of fish sauce. Set aside. Add remaining fish sauce to a bowl with green chilies. Set aside. Add lettuce to a plate. Serve larb over rice powder in a lettuce cup. Garnish with mint leaf and chili.

Combine sugar, salt and eggs in a bowl. Beat with electric mixer until well blended. Beat in coconut milk, pineapple juice and rum. Divide into glasses. Top with whipped topping and garnish with cherries.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the cabbage and cook until wilted and slightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the carrots and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the onion and cook for another minute or two. Add the brown sugar, reduced sodium soy sauce and cider vinegar and cook for another minute or two, until the mixture is slightly thickened. Add the pepper and salt to taste and serve.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Boil until tender. Mash and add remaining ingredients. Shape into cakes. Dip in flour then egg and finally breadcrumbs. Fry in hot oil until brown and crisp.

Preheat the oven to 400F. Coat a large skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium high heat. Combine the mustard, lemon juice and oregano in a shallow bowl. Dip the chicken pieces in the mustard mixture and place in the skillet. Fry until golden brown. Remove the chicken from the skillet and place in a greased 3-qt. baking dish. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of the fat from the skillet. Stir in the lemon pepper seasoning. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Bake for 35 minutes, or until a thermometer registers 170F. Serve.

In a small bowl combine 2 Tbsp. broth with 2 Tbsp. flourcook over low heat for 1 minute. Add light cream cheese and milkcook over low heat until well blended, stirring occasionally. Add 1/2 cup broth and nutmegcook for 1 more minute. Add remaining broth and 1/4 cup parsley. In a large skillet cook 4 oz. fettuccini according to package directions. Drain and place in a serving bowl. Add chicken broth mixturetoss gently. Sprinkle with 1 Tbsp. parsley and 1/4 cup Parmesan. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Cook noodles in boiling salted water for 8 minutes or until tenderdrain and rinse with cold waterdrain well. In a large skillet, cook onion and green pepper in butter until tender. Add beef and cook for 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute longer or until beef is browned. Add tomato sauce and cottage cheesecook over low heat for 5 minutes. Add noodlestoss lightly and heat through. Serve with cream cheese and sour cream. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl combine butter, sugar and milk. Place 1/2 cup sugar in small bowl. Place strawberries in another bowl. Beat egg whites in another large bowl until foamy. Beat sugar into egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold in vanilla wafers. Add 1/3 of the cream mixture to strawberries. Spoon 1/3 of strawberry mixture into crust. Sprinkle 1/3 of vanilla wafer mixture over strawberries. Repeat layering twice. Top with remaining vanilla wafer mixture. Chill overnight. To serve garnish with fresh strawberries and chopped pecans.

Preheat the oven to 375. Coat a 13-by-9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine spaghetti sauce with 1/2 cup mozzarella cheesespread half in baking dish. Spread half of eggplant on top. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake until heated through, 30 minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat the oven to 450. Arrange fish fillets in a shallow baking pan. Combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over the fish. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350. Bake 30 minutes longer.
Cook sausage and ground beef over medium-high heat until browneddrain fat. Stir in salsa, soup, tomatoes, green chiles, garlic powder, oregano and pepper. Heat throughly. Serve with crackers.

Place green beans in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain green beans and place in serving dish. Toss with olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Sprinkle with cheese. May serve hot or cold. Serves 4 as side dish.

Soak jalapenos in water to remove heat. Combine ground beef, garlic, jalapenos, onion and breadcrumbs. Divide into 4 patties and press a slice of pepper jack cheese into center of each patty. Grill over hot coals. Grill buns. Assemble burgers. Serve with lettuce, tomato or pickles.

In a medium bowl combine tuna with curry powder and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and then add onion and ginger. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise with rice vinegar and Dijon mustard. Fold into the tuna mixture and then chill for at least an hour before serving. Serve the tuna salad on lettuce leaves with pecans and cayenne pepper to taste.

Heat oil in skillet over med high heat. Add onion and garlic and saute 2 minutes. Add honey and spices and simmer 1 minute. Add lemon juice and pineapple and simmer 2 minutes longer. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes longer or until done. Serve over rice or pasta.

Cook ground turkey until no longer pink. Drain off excess fat. Add onions and cook until onions are transparent. Add rice, tomato soup, water. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Add stewed tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Add cabbage, stirring well. Bake covered in a casserole dish at 350f for 30 minutes. Uncover for last 5 minutes of cooking to allow the cabbage to get browned. Serve with green salad.

Brown chicken in 2 tablespoons of the water until no longer pink. Add the rest of the water, taco seasoning and salsacook an additional 3 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Heat tortillas in microwave for 20 -30 seconds to soften. Spread sour cream over each tortillatop each with chicken, cheese and lettuce and tomatoes. Roll up and serve immediately.
In a frying pan over medium heat saute zucchini 2 minutes. Add eggs beating until almost set. Sprinkle with parsley, thyme, parmesan cheese. Salt and pepper.

Mix cream cheese with mushrooms and dried beef until well blended. Form into a ball. Chill for one hour. Combine accent and water to make a glaze. Brush on ball. Roll in pecans. Chill 1 hour more. Serve with crackers.
Place wine, juice, lemon slices and ginger in a saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour. Strain into a pitcher or large punch bowl. Add honey to taste. Serve hot or cold.

In a saucepan combine cranberries, green onion, orange juice, honey, water and bring to a boil. Lower heat and let simmer until thick. Add in green pepper and cilantro, cook for 1 minute. Add jalapeno pepper and cook for another minute or until the salsa is your desired consistency. Season with salt to taste. Serve warm with chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine 2/3 cup flour, sugar and corn syrup in a large bowl and beat until well mixed. Add melted butter and egg yolks and beat until smooth. Stir in vanilla and nuts. Spread in a greased 13x9 inch baking pan. Beat remaining 1/3 cup flour and baking powder. Cut in butter and stir in pecans. Sprinkle over bar mixture. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 10 minutes then cut into squares.

In large pot over medium heat, dissolve sugar and alum in water. Bring to boil and boil for 3 minutes. Add blossoms and simmer for 15 minutes or more. Stir frequently to prevent sticking to bottom of pan. After 15 minutes or more, remove from heat and let cool in pot. Strain blossoms from liquid and discard blossoms. Pour into containers and allow to cool completely before putting into refrigerator. Label with date and keep in refrigerator for 3-4 weeks or freeze for up to a year.

Place the lobster tails on a broiler pan. Season with butter, garlic salt, pepper, paprika. Broil about 5 inches from the heat for about 3 minutes on each side. Remove from pan. Place on serving platter. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Put the lamb in a large baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with the olive oil. Rub with the mustard. Sprinkle with the garlic. Tuck the rosemary sprigs among the lamb. Cover the dish and let stand for 1 hour. After the lamb has marinated, mix together the bread crumbs, parmesan cheese and butter. Spread the mixture evenly over the lamb. Bake the lamb uncovered for 20 minutes. Turn the meat over. Bake 10 to 15 minutes longer or until the lamb is done to your liking. Let the meat stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add beefcook, breaking up into crumbles, until no longer pink. Drain. Add remaining ingredients except cheese, heat to boilingreduce heat to medium-low. Heat throughstirring occasionally. Sprinkle with cheese.

In a medium bowl mix lime juice and zest, cumin, red pepper flakes, garlic, shallots and shrimp. Let stand for about 10 minutes. Preheat grill or broiler. Place shrimp mixture on grill or broiler and cook until shrimp are cooked through and the mixture is reduced, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer to a serving dish. Sprinkle with Old Bay seasoning and serve with lemon wedges.

Combine the first five ingredients in a small bowl. Add the chicken and marinate overnight. Thread chicken on skewers. Grill until done or broil for 8 to 10 minutes in the oven. Serve immediately with sliced cucumbers sprinkled with lime juice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all ingredients in large bowl. Spoon into greased loaf pan. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. Check with a meat thermometer. It should read 165 degrees. Remove from oven. Cool 10 minutes. Slice and serve.

Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Add water slowly. Stir to combine. Fold in pumpkin and raisins. Fill paper muffin cups half full with batter. Bake at 350 degrees F until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from pancool completely on wire rack. Makes 24 muffins.

Spray a 13 x 9 baking dish with nonstick spray coating. In a large bowl combine the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, and paprika. Drain vegetables well and place in a colander to drain off any excess liquid. Dip vegetables in the breadcrumb mixture one at a time, turning to coat completely on both sides. Place in the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle vegetables with additional paprika, if desired. Drizzle with dressing. Bake in a 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender and crisp. Serve warm or at room temperature with additional dressing if desired.

Prepare Jell-O as directed on box. Add the pudding mix and stir until mixed well. Fold in Cool Whip. Chill in the refrigerator until firm. In a tall glass place ice cubes. Pour 1/2 can of Mountain Dew over ice cubes. Pour Jell-O mixture over ice cubes. Garnish with lime slices.

Beat together cream cheese and preserves until smooth and creamy. Beat in powdered sugar and vanilla extract until combined and spreadable. Place one wafer on your work surface and spread one teaspoon of the strawberry cream cheese on top. Place another wafer on top and press down gently to spread the cream cheese and hold together the sandwiches. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the cream cheese mixture has been used. Place the trays in the freezer until firmly frozen, at least 3 hours, or preferably overnight. Makes approximately 48 cookies.

Mix together cola and barbecue sauce in a small bowl. In a shallow dish, combine soy sauce and brown sugar. In a large sealable bag, combine the cola mixture with the rest of the ingredients, except ribs. Add ribs and coat well. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Heat grill. Grill ribs over medium-high heat until browned on both sides. Baste with cola mixture during grilling. Cook for about 20 minutes. Turn and baste with cola mixture. Cook for another 20 minutes. Turn and baste again. Continue basting and turning until meat is tender and falls off the bone. Serve with additional cola sauce.

Bring cider to boil in large saucepan. Add brown sugar. Stir until sugar is completely dissolved. Add allspice and cloves. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove cinnamon sticks and orange wedge. Serve hot.

Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add cocoa and milk and stir until smooth. Bring to a boil over medium heat and boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto wax paper. Let stand until firm enough to lift by paper edges and remove paper. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 1-1/4 cups.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 12x8 inch baking dish. Layer 2 cups pasta sauce in the bottom of the prepared dish. Arrange the chicken breast halves over the pasta sauce. Sprinkle with half the Parmesan cheese. Spread with 1 cup pasta sauce. Sprinkle with half the mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes more. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 2 loaf pans. In a large bowl combine the flour, cinnamon and baking soda. In a medium bowl beat eggs and add sugar, oil and vanilla. Mix well. Stir in the strawberries. Add to the flour mixture alternately with the sour cream. Beat on low until just blended. Pour into pans. Bake 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the pans immediately and allow to cool. Spread frosting on top and sprinkle pecans on top.

Place garlic butter crescent rolls on foil lined baking sheet. Brush each roll with garlic butter. Bake at 350F for 10 minutes or until rolls are golden brown. In a medium bowl beat eggs with milk and water until blended. Add onion, frozen spinach, salt and pepper. Spoon filling evenly into garlic butter crescent rolls, leaving 1/2-inch border on edges. Bake 30-35 minutes or until filling is set. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese, and bake 1-2 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Cool slightly before serving.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Bake in a 9x13 baking dish at 350 degrees until bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Sift together the flour and suet. Add the sugar and mix. Add the currants and citrus peels. Make a well in the center of the mixture and add the egg. Stir well to combine. Add a little milk and stir until you can roll into a soft dough. Divide the dough into two equal pieces and place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Flatten into a 1/2 inch thickness. Bake in a preheated oven (400 degrees) for 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Cut into squares. Serve with sweetened whipping cream or ice cream.

Scrub mussels, keeping them intact. Put shallot and garlic clove into a 2-quart saucepan with 1/4 cup water and 1/4 cup white winebring to a simmer over high heat. Cover saucepan and steam mussels until they open, about 5 minutes. Transfer mussels to a plate with tongsset aside. Drain liquid from saucepan into a bowl through a sieve set over another bowl (discard any shells that do not open). Return liquid to saucepan. Increase heat to medium-highcook until liquid is reduced by half, about 4 minutes. Meanwhile, toast baguette slices under broiler until lightly browned. Serve mussels with baguette slicesdrizzle with vinegar-infused oil. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve immediately with mixed greens.

In a food processor, blend together graham cracker crumbs, sugar & margarine until crumbs are moistened. Press into the bottom of a 9 inch pie plate. Cover & refrigerate until firm. Beat together cream cheese, cool whip & pineapple until blended. Spread over crust. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into wedges.

Slice pork ears into 2-inch pieces. Mix soy sauce, sugar, and vinegar and marinade the meat for 5 minutes. Drain and heat oil in wok or large saute pan over medium heat. Add the pork and cook for 4 minutes or until lightly browned and cooked through. Add the toasted sesame seeds and toss to combine. Serve at room temperature or warm.

Preheat oven to 350. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Add the popcorn to a large bowl and drizzle with butter. In a medium saucepan combine soy sauce, red pepper flakes and garlic powder. Stir until smooth and bring to a boil. Boil 2 minutes. Stir in peanut butter until completely melted. Pour over popcorn. Toss to coat. Bake 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Transfer to serving dish and serve.

Prepare barbecue for direct cooking over medium heat (350¬∞ to 450¬∞F). Brush drumettes with apricot preserves. Thread 4 drumettes onto each of 6 (16-inch) skewers. Place drumette skewers in shallow dishbrush with chili garlic sauce. Let stand 30 minutes. Place 3 skewers in prepared grillbrush with preserves mixture. Grill 15 minutes or until drumettes are done, turning skewers over every 5 minutes. Remove from grill. Brush with remaining preserves mixture. Repeat with remaining skewers. Baste drumettes with Dijon mustard. Grill 3 to 5 minutes or until glaze is bubbly. Remove from grilllet stand 5 minutes. Place 3 drumettes in each of 6 shallow bowls. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Serve with rosemary sprigs.

Soak red gram overnight. Pressure cook red gram and cook for 4 whistles. Cool. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds and curry leaves. Fry well. Add onion, coriander leaves. Fry well. Add red gram. Fry well. Add achar. Mix well.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Mix together cheese, turkey, apple and onion. Divide the filling evenly among the tart shells. Brush the edges of the shells with the beaten egg. Bake about 15 minutes until the filling is heated through and the crust is golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parsley and coarse salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine flour and cornmeal in a large bowl. Stir in egg and water. Knead until well blended and smooth. Divide into 12 equal pieces and roll into balls. Place each ball between two sheets of wax paper. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cook over medium high heat on a hot griddle or cast iron skillet. Cook for 1 minute. Flip and cook for an additional minute. Flip again and cook for 10 to 20 seconds. Remove to a paper towel lined plate. Serve with your favorite filling.

In a medium bowl, combine the beef with the V8 juice. In a large bowl, combine the beef mixture, corn, beans, tomatoes, onion powder and taco seasoning. Transfer mixture to a 4-quart slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours. Remove lid from slow cooker, sprinkle cheese over top and cover. Cook on high for 30 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Stir well and serve.
Mix pudding and milk. Fold in cool whip until blended. Fold in fruit. Spoon into glasses. Top with crushed pineapple, fruit cocktail and cherry.

In a small saucepan combine brown sugar, margarine and corn syrupcook over low heat until mixture is melted and smooth. Set aside to cool. Separate crescent rolls along perforations into individual triangles. Brush each triangle with melted mixture. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Roll each triangle tightlyplace seam side down on greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightlyplace 1 pecan on each roll. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. While noodles are cooking fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. Beat egg and pour into pan with bacon fat. Add heavy cream and stir well. Add cooked noodles and cottage cheese stirring to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Put in casserole dish and sprinkle top with buttered bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

In a large saute pan, add olive oil and 1 tablespoon of minced garlic and cook over medium heat until garlic is translucent. Add red potatoes and onion and cook 1-2 minutes until softened but not browned, add 1 more tablespoon of minced garlic and cook 1 minute more. Add seasonings and stir well until thoroughly combined. Add spinach and stir well until wilted and spinach is bright green. Add chicken and stir well until chicken is evenly coated with garlic and seasonings. Continue cooking until chicken is no longer pink inside and vegetables are heated through. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, toss together pineapple chunks, green onions, cilantro leaves, lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon cumin until evenly coated. Set aside. Coat a medium skillet with cooking sprayheat over medium-high heat. Season chicken with 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Cook in skillet 5 to 6 minutes per side or until browned. Remove from panlet stand 5 minutes. Serve chicken with pineapple salsa.

Cut cauliflower into florets. Melt butter and garlic in heavy skillet. Add cauliflower florets and stir to coat with butter garlic mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add nutmeg to taste and stir in dry breadcrumbs. Add cheese to taste and serve.

Place chicken breasts in the bottom of a crockpot. Combine cream cheese, salsa and taco seasoning in a saucepan. Heat over medium heat until cheese melts and mixes well. Pour over chicken. Cover and cook on low 6-8 hours or high 4 hours. Serve on a bed of rice topped with a can of fat free refried beans.

Cut english muffins in half. Brown sausage and drain well. Beat together eggs and milk with seasonings and spices. Add sausage and saute till hot. Put sausage mixture on the english muffin halves and sprinkle with cheese and chilies. Bake in 400 degree oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until done. Melt sour cream and drizzle over the top of the breakfast.
Mix all ingredients together and marinade turkey overnight. This will give you a moist turkey.

Bring water to a boil. Add peppermint and orange pekoe tea bags. Cover and steep 20 minutes. Strain tea into a large pitcher. Add orange zest, mint leaves and cloves. Chill overnight. To serve, pour over ice. Garnish with mint sprig.
Combine mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar and onion. Fold in broccoli. Refrigerate. When ready to serve, drain pasta and add to salad. Sprinkle with bacon and sunflower seeds. Toss to coat. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix cake mix, pudding and eggs. Pour into greased 9 x 13 baking pan. Bake 15 minutes. Remove from oven and add canned corn. Bake another 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with topping. Cool. Beat vanilla and margarine. Spread over cooled cake. Refrigerate.

Brown meat in skillet with onion. Add celery and cook for 2 minutes more. Add bean sprouts, chow mein noodles and water chestnuts. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain off liquid into container. Mix soy sauce and soup together in container. Add this mixture to meat mixture and cook 2-3 minutes more. Pour into baking dish. Bake at 425 for 10-15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl, combine sugar, cinnamon and baking mix. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add milk, stirring just until moisteneddo not overmix. Divide dough into four equal portionswrap each in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour or until easy to handle. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion of dough into a 6-inch circle. Cut each circle into 4 wedgesplace 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove to wire racks to cool for 10 minutesserve warm.

Rinse fruit in cold water and drain. Combine water and sugar in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Add fruit and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until fruit is tender. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Stir in potato starch and vanilla essence. Pour into a serving dish and cool completely. Pour cream into a bowl and sprinkle with slivered almonds. Serve with fruit compote.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl combine chicken with crumbs, cheese, thyme, basil, salt, pepper, and lemon wedge. Form mixture into small patties and place on greased baking sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes per side, turning once. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 13 x 9 pan. Mix cake and pudding mixes and eggs together. Stir in mashed banana and milk. Add nuts and mix well. Pour into greased pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Spread frosting on top and sides. Refrigerate over night. Cut into squares and serve.

In a large bowl, combine beef, worcestershire sauce, seasoning and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Form into 4 patties. Spray the grill rack with cooking spray. Grill the patties over medium high heat until well done (160 degrees on an instant read thermometer), 8 to 10 minutes on each side. Meanwhile, in a small skillet over medium heat, cook onion and mushrooms until tender, about 5 minutes. Add ham and cook until heated through. Season with 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Divide the meat mixture among the buns. Top each with a slice of cheddar. Serve with ham and onion mixture.

Preheat oven to 450f. Steam asparagus until crisp-tender and cool. Toss in bowl with oil and sprinkle with pepper and ginger. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 4 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven and sprinkle with soy sauce and almonds. Serve warm.

Put flour in mixing bowl. Add water slowly to make dough. Mix with spoon or spatula. Add oil, mashed potatoes, salt and knead to make dough. Knead for about five minutes. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for half an hour. Divide dough in half. Roll out on lightly floured surface into rectangles about 1/4 inch thick. Fold over two thirds way to make rectangle. Cut out circles with round glass or bottle to cut out circles. Cut circles in half and put filling in one half. Moisten edge with water and fold over to make half moon shape. Brush with beaten egg and fry in canola oil on medium heat or steam in large pot with water to cover perogies half way. Add salt to water if you prefer salted water. Add perogies to boiling water and cook for about ten minutes or until floats to surface. Take out with slotted spoon or perogy lifter and drain on paper towel or cloth napkin. Serve with sour cream and bacon or sausage gravy or ketchup or perogy sau

Cut cucumber in half lengthwise. Using a large spoon or melon baller, scoop out seeds from center of each half. In a medium bowl, combine shrimp, celery, red onion, mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, dill, 1/4 teaspoon each salt & pepper. Divide mixture between 2 halves of cucumber. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 1 day.

In a medium bowl combine the shrimp, chilies, green onions and olives. In a separate bowl combine the mayonnaise and cuminstir well. Spread the mixture over the tortilla chips. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese and top with the chopped green onions. Bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

Put the water in a large pot. Add the Guinness stout, dark brown sugar, light molasses, salt, garlic cloves, pepper, sage leaves. Bring to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the pork chops. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer for 1 hour. Remove the pork chops from the pot with tongs. Remove the sage leaves. Cool. Store the chops covered in the refrigerator overnight. Remove the chops from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Put the pork chops on a baking dish. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan, over low heat, warm the maple syrup and mustard together for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally to combine. Add in the garlic cloves and thyme and simmer for an additional 5 minutes. Cool to room temperature and pour into a serving dish. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a shallow dish, combine the olive oil and black pepper and add the salmon fillets to coat both sides of the fish. Bake the salmon for about 8 to 10 minutes or until the fish is just opaque. Serve the salmon on baby spinach leaves topped with the maple thyme mustard sauce. Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs and serve immediately.

Mix together beef, onion, green pepper and mushrooms and cook in a large non-stick skillet until no longer pink. Drain. Add tomato sauce and italian seasoning. Bring to a boil. Add noodles. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until noodles are tender. Stir in cheeses. Makes 6 servings.

Wash rice through sieve and place in rice cooker bowl. Add beef stock to rice cooker bowl. Set rice cooker on high setting for 25 minutes. While rice is cooking, chop bacon and saute in skillet until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet with slotted spoon and set aside. Drain off excess fat from skillet, leaving about 1 tablespoon in the pan. Add onion and garlic to skillet and saute over medium heat until onion is clear. Add rice to skillet with vegetables. Heat for about 3 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender. Season with soy sauce to taste. Transfer rice to serving dish and garnish with crumbled bacon.

Preheat a griddle or large frying pan over medium heat. Combine the cornmeal, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs. Add the milk, melted butter, corn, and bacon. Stir into the dry mixture until just combined. Drop about 1/4 cupful of batter onto the griddle for each pancake. Cook until bubbles appear on top of each pancake. Turn the pancakes over. Cook for another minute or so until the other side is lightly browned. Serve the pancakes with syrup or jam. Serves 2.

In a small bowl, combine the onions & apples, sprinkle the pork chops with seasoning and lay in the bottom of your crockpot. Pour the cider over the top of the pork and onions. Cover and cook on low for about 6 hours. Remove the pork and add the butter, stirring until melted. Add the sage and cook for another 30 minutes or so. Pour over the pork and serve over rice or mashed potatoes.

Make a starter (use recipe below) to use in this bread. Prepare a 9x5 loaf pan by spraying with baking spray. In a bowl combine starter, butter, milk, salt and honey. Stir well. Add flours. Stir well. Pour into pan. Sprinkle sunflower seeds on top. Bake at 350f for 50 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.

In a small bowl combine the brown sugar, dry mustard and prepared horseradishset aside. Place ham in slow cookersprinkle with mustard mixture. Pour cola over hamcover and cook on low setting for 4-6 hours or until heated through. Remove ham from slow cooker and serve on a serving plattergarnish with parsley if desired.

Saute shrimp and oysters in oil until shrimp turns pink. Add soup, milk and rice to sauteed mixture and bring to a boil, reduce to simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Add seasonings, shrimp and oysters and stir over medium heat until heated through. Serve with Parmesan cheese sprinkled over the top and fresh chopped parsley for garnish.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Wash the potatoes and pat them dry. Slice potatoes in half lengthwise. Scoop out the inside of the potatoes. Mash the potato in a bowl with the butter and the low sodium broth. Salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the potato back into the hollowed out potato skins. Drizzle each potato with sour cream and sprinkle with cheese and paprika. Bake the potatoes for 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
In a large bowl, combine all of the ingredients except for the currants. Add the currants and mix together well. Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with extra currants. Serve with crackers.

Heat the cream over a low heat until the temperature reaches 38C, stirring all the time until it is smooth. Remove from the heat and add the chopped chocolate. Beat the egg yolks with the icing sugar until very thick. Pour the hot cream slowly into the egg mixture while mixing continuously with a whisk. Beat the egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff, then fold them gently into the chocolate mixture. Pour into a 1 litre (1 3/4-pint) serving dish and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Serve with crushed biscuits or meringues.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine ground beef, eggs and onion. Stir together oatmeal and seasoning. Mix into meat. Divide into two loaves. Place into greased baking pan. Bake 1 1/2 to 2 hours. To serve, slice and top with tomato sauce.

Cook the rice as per the package directions. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the onion and mushrooms until the mushrooms begin to brown. Add the green pepper and peas and saute until tender. Add the soup and mix well. Stir in the cooked rice and mix well. Stir in the tuna and mix well. Heat through for another 3 to 4 minutes. Serve immediately garnished with parsley or cilantro and lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 350. Melt the butter in a 9x13 pan. Stir in the oats and cinnamon. Add the flour and baking soda and mix well. Spread half the mixture evenly in the pan. Spread with the jam. Spread the remaining mixture evenly over the jam. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into 4 squares.

Cut bottom off of celery. Remove ribs from celery. Cut each rib into small pieces. In a small bowl mix together the celery pieces, cream cheese, pimento stuffed olives, black olives and mayonnaise. Sprinkle with paprika. Stuff celery with mixture. Place stuffed celery into a small glass container. Serve with crackers.

Place roast in 8x12x2-inch baking dish. Combine all remaining ingredients in a bowl and pour over roast. Bake covered in 325f oven for 2 1/2 hours. Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes. Slice and serve with hot cooking juices.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion and zucchini until tender. Add chickpeas and cook about 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add roasted peppers. Stir in couscous and lemon juice. Season with basil and olives.

Prepare the ribs by rinsing them and patting them dry. In a large bowl combine the kosher salt and black pepper. Toss the ribs in the bowl and coat them evenly. Add 2 cups of water to the instant pot and place the ribs in the pot. Seal and cook for 12 minutes at high pressure. Let the instant pot naturally release the pressure for 10 minutes. Remove the ribs and brush on the apple cider vinegar. Add the barbecue sauce and toss the ribs to coat them. Serve the ribs with the sauce on top.

Combine balsamic vinegar and brown sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool completely. Arrange tomato slices in a single layer in a shallow dish. Pour balsamic mixture over the tomato slices and refrigerate for 1 hour. Arrange tomato slices and basil leaves on a serving platter. Sprinkle feta and balsamic mixture evenly over the top. Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with basil leaves. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper. Using an electric mixer, beat egg whites until they form soft peaks. Add salt and beat until the mixture holds soft peaks. Add the sugar 1 teaspoon at a time, beating well after each addition. Continue beating until the mixture holds stiff peaks. Beat in vanilla. Fold in almonds. Drop mixture by heaping teaspoons onto baking sheets, spacing the macaroons about 2 inches apart. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the macaroons are lightly browned. Cool completely on wire racks. Melt chocolate chips in the microwave or in a double boiler. Dip each macaroon in the chocolatereturn to wire racks and let stand until the chocolate is set. Store in airtight container in a cool dry place.

Prepare orange jell-o. Let stand for 1 minute. Add boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Chill until set. Fold in fruit. Fold in sherbet and marshmallows. Chill. Fold in whipped topping. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 375. Line baking sheet with aluminum foil. Spread shrimp on foil. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle shrimp with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Roast for 10 minutes or until shrimp are pink and opaque. In small bowl combine ketchup, horseradish and lemon juice. Season sauce to taste with kosher salt and black pepper. Pour sauce into small bowl. Serve shrimp immediately with sauce.

Mix together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar in a large bowl. Cut in butter with a pastry cutter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in blueberries. Add sour cream and mix until just combined. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and pat into a 6 inch circle. Cut into wedges. Bake 12-15 minutes. Cool slightly. Serve warm.
In a blender combine dry mustard, sugar, vinegar and salt. Add the egg and blend again. Add the miracle whip and blend just until smooth. Makes about 2 cups.

Prepare crescent roll dough. Roll each triangle of dough into a 6 inch square. Fold dough diagonally and pinch edges to seal. Place into 9 inch pie pan. Cut each square into 4 triangles. Combine dill weed and butter. Brush dill weed mixture onto each triangle. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

In a small pan, melt 2 teaspoons butter over low heat. Add 2 eggs and 1/4 cup water. Beat until smooth. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon black pepper and 2 tablespoons green apple. Heat in pan until eggs are set and no longer runny. Arrange blue cheese on top and garnish with fresh chives. Serve.

Bring water to a boil in a large skillet with a lid. Add elbow macaroni and stir well to coat with water. Reduce heat to low and cook uncovered for 8 minutes or until al dente tender. Meanwhile, combine pasta sauce and meatballs in a small bowl and stir well to coat meatballs with sauce. Layer cooked macaroni and meatballs in skillet and top with olives and Parmesan cheese. Cover and cook over low heat for an additional 5 minutes. Serve immediately.
In pitcher with spout, stir honey and lemon juice until dissolved. Add sparkling water and lemon zest. Pour into 4 tall glasses filled with ice. Sprinkle each glass with salt and garnish with lemon.

Boil eggs in large saucepan of boiling water 13 minutestransfer to ice-water bathpeel and halve eggs. In small bowl, mix together sun-dried tomato paste, shallots, dijon mustard, hot pepper sauce, mayonnaise, sour cream and egg yolks. Fill egg halves with sun-dried tomato mixturesprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Mix cream of mushroom soup, sauerkraut, and water in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and ground pepper. Beat egg in a small bowl. Place half of the mixture in a greased 3-quart casserole dish. Place pork chops on top of mixture. Pour remaining sauerkraut mixture over chops. Top with dumplings. Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes. Serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add corn and peppers. Cook until tender. In a large bowl combine potatoes, corn mixture and chicken broth. Cook in crock pot on high for 4 to 6 hours or on low for 6 to 8 hours. Stir in evaporated milk and parsley. Serve with toasted bread.

Cream margarine and sugars. Beat in eggs. Add water and vanilla. Mix well. Stir in flour. Add baking soda. Fold in oatmeal. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees F for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Yield : 5 dozen.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add trout fillets and cook for about 2 minutes per side. Remove trout from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet add anchovies, lemon zest, rosemary, capers and white wine. Heat wine mixture to boiling then reduce heat to low. Add lemon juice. Add the trout fillets back to the skillet and cook for a few more minutes. Serve with pasta or rice. Prepare with 1 pound of salmon fillets.

Spread a tablespoon of the italian dressing on each pita bread half. Top with the cucumbersprinkle with the dressing mix. Bake at 425 degrees F for 8 to 10 minutes or until the pita is golden brown. Cut each pita bread half into 6 wedges. Makes 12 servings (1 wedge per serving).

Mix together corn muffin mix and sour cream. Stir in taco seasoning mix and beef. Spoon into 12-inch pizza pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until cooked through and crust is golden brown. Sprinkle with cheese and salsa. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Top with sour cream and serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan, combine the chocolate chips and 1/4 cup water. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until chips are melted. Remove from heatcool for 1 minute. Stir in half-and-half until smooth. Stir in the powdered sugar. Pour into a bowlrefrigerate until serving. Serves 2.

Slice pork loin into 1/4 inch thick medallions. Heat chipotles and adobo sauce in small saucepan over low heat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Heat through. Remove from heat. Coat pork with glaze. Grill 3 minutes per side or until done. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare 1 9-inch pie crust according to directions. Press into bottom and up sides of 9-inch glass pie plate. Bake 8 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool on rack. In medium bowl, mix all crust ingredients. Press mixture firmly against bottom and side of 9-inch glass pie plate. In large bowl, pour boiling water on gelatin. Stir until gelatin is dissolved. Stir in lime peel and lime juice. Refrigerate 1 hour or until very thick but not set. Beat gelatin mixture with electric mixer on high speed about 4 minutes or until thick and fluffy. Set aside. In chilled large bowl, beat whipping cream and powdered sugar on high speed until stiff peaks form. Fold whipped cream and crushed strawberries into gelatin mixture. Pour into crust. Refrigerate about 8 hours or until set. Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare 1 9-inch pie crust according to directions.

Peel potatoes and boil until tender. Mash until smooth and add egg yolks and onion. Combine well, add seasonings (salt/pepper) and form into cutlets. Dip cutlets in beaten egg whites (1 egg white per cutlet). Roll in breadcrumbs. Fry in hot oil until light brown.

Boil the sweet potatoes until tender. Drain and cool them. Mix the mustard and mayonnaise together. Cut the bacon into small pieces and fry it until crisp. Add the bacon and sweet potatoes to the dressing. Chop the pineapple into small pieces and add them. Sprinkle the macadamia nuts over the top and serve on a bed of lettuce. Serve with ham or turkey.

Preheat the broiler. Rinse the chickens inside and out under cold running water. Pat them dry. Rub the outside of the chickens with the garlic cloves. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, mustard, lemon juice, rosemary, salt and pepper. Rub the chickens well with the marinade. Let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. When ready to grill or broil, discard the marinade. Arrange the chickens on a broiling pan or a shallow rimmed baking pan. Broil them 5 to 6 inches from the heat source for 20 to 30 minutes or until done. Turn the chickens occasionally and baste with the pan juices. To test for doneness, insert a meat thermometer in the thickest part of the thigh. It should read 180f. Remove from the broiler or broiling pan. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve hot.

In a small bowl combine soy sauce, brown sugar and crushed pepper flakes. Stir until blended and set aside. Lightly coat chicken with cooking spray and sprinkle with curry powder and garlic powder. Heat large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and saute chicken until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer chicken to a plate and set aside. In same skillet heat lime juice and soy sauce mixture over medium-high heat until boiling, about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add chicken and heat through for 1-2 minutes. Sprinkle with green onions and serve over rice.

Mix potatoes, shortening, hot water, flour, sugar, egg, salt, yeast in a bowl until combined. Cover with plastic wrap and let sit in warm place to rise about 1 hour. Roll the dough out and spread with butter or margarine. Roll up jelly roll style and cut into 1 inch rounds. Place rolls in 9√ó13 pan. Bake in 350 degree oven 10 to 15 minutes until golden brown.

Cook the potatoes in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and mash with a little milk and butter. Add the lamb and mix well. Heat the vegetable oil in a frying pan and fry the onion gently until soft and translucent. Add the lamb cube and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the lamb and flour and cook for about 2 minutes until the mixture is well browned and crumbly. Transfer the lamb mixture into a pie dish and cover with the potato mixture. Bake in a preheated 180 C oven for about 20 minutes until the potatoes are golden brown. Decorate with fresh mint before serving.
Dip burgers in mixture to coat both sides. Place on grill. Grill on both sides to cook through. Put on bun, add catsup.

Rub chicken breasts with mustard and place in a glass baking dish. Bake for 1 hour in a pre-heated oven at 180c until done. Place onion and garlic cloves in a blender and blend until smooth. Add lemon juice, green peppercorns and chives and blend again. Heat olive oil in a saute pan and cook the sauce until thickened and serve with chicken.

Cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon, leaving 2 tablespoons bacon fat in skillet. Saut?onions until soft. Stir in flour. Add sugar, vinegar and water. Heat to boiling. Cook until thickened. Add bacon. Add green beans to skillet. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with bacon bits.

Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves and cook for one minute. Add the prawns and cook for one minute or until they turn pink. Add the scallops and cook for one minute or until they turn pink. Add the asparagus and sugar snap peas and cook for one minute or until tender crisp. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the lemon juice, dry white wine, cream and parsley and toss to combine. Serve immediately with steamed rice or pasta.

Mix together 2 cups of flour and all other dry ingredients except raisins. Melt butter. Add water to butter. Add to the dry mixture with 2 more cups of flour. Knead on lightly floured board for about 10 minutes or until dough is smooth. Add raisins and knead again. Cover with a towel. Let rise for about 1 hour or until doubled in size. Punch down the dough. Roll the dough out on lightly floured board into a rectangle about 15 inches by 10 inches. Cut into 10 slices. Twist each slice to form a ring about 5 inches long. Place on greased cookie sheet or pizza pan. Let rise again for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake 15 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Cool on rack. Makes 10 rolls.
Place all ingredients into blender. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook fettuccine for 3-4 minutes or according to package directions. Drain and return to the pot. While pasta cooks, heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add butter and stir until melted. Whisk in egg yolk and heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Add parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Add pasta and toss until well coated. Serve with parsley.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Saute broccoli florets until crisp-tender, stirring often. Stir in red bell pepper and yellow bell pepper until crisp-tender. Combine cornstarch with 2 tablespoons water until smooth. Add to vegetablesstir constantly until thickened. Add green onionscook 1 minute longer. Remove from heatstir in mustard and orange juice. Serve immediately.

Place chicken in 9x13 inch pan and cover with dressing. Dot with 1/2 cup butter. Cover and chill at least 4 hours or up to 24 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Bake for 45 minutes or until chicken is golden brown. Turn chicken over, top with remaining 1/2 cup butter and bake for 45 minutes longer or until golden brown. Serve with more dressing if desired.
Soften whipped topping. Mix together the rest of the ingredients. Fold in whipped topping. Spread into a freezer container. Freeze for several hours or until firm. Serve with graham crackers.

Mix together soy sauce & brown sugar in small saucepan. Heat to boiling point over medium heat stirring constantly to dissolve sugar & blend soy sauce. Pour marinade over meat in large ziplock plastic bag & seal bag. Marinate overnight in refrigerator. Remove steak from bag. Grill over hot coals until desired doneness. Serve with melted butter or oil & lemon slices.

Mix graham cracker crumbs with melted butter. Press into 9x13 pan. Bake at 250 until light brown. Beat eggs with sugar and vanilla then stir in cream cheese and kahlua. Pour over cooled crust and sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake at 425 for about 18 minutes or until firm in the middle and edges are lightly browned. Cool. Cut into squares.

Bring 8 cups of water to a boil. Add 2 tea bags and let steep for 5 minutes. Add 1 cup sugar and stir to dissolve. Strain into a 2 quart pitcher and add 4 cups ice cubes. Pour into 2 glasses and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Rinse the spinach leaves well in cold water. Pat dry in paper towels. In a 12-inch skillet, heat the oil over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 10 minutes. Add the spinach and stir well. Cook until the spinach wilts but remains bright green, about 5 minutes more. Season with the salt and pepper. Put the spinach into an 8-inch square baking dish. Peel the chicken breasts. Season with the paprika and the rosemary. Put the chicken breasts on top of the spinach. Bake until the chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 40 minutes. Cut each chicken breast in half. Arrange the cut halves over the spinach on top of the chicken. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a large skillet saut bacon until crisp. Add ham. Cook until heated through. Drain off all but 2 tablespoons of fat. Add onioncook until soft. Add garlic. Cook 1 minute longer. Stir in the tomato paste. Add beans. Stir in chili sauce and sugar. Add 1 teaspoon dry mustard. Stir until well combined. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 20 minutes longer. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Makes 8 servings.

In a medium skillet combine the onion, garlic and buttercook over medium heat about 2 minutes. Add the ketchup, vinegar, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and brown sugarstir well. Add the salt and pepper. Add the chicken piecescook about 3 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heatcover and let stand for about 15 minutes. Serve immediately over hot cooked rice.

Cook onion and butter until tender. Add mushrooms and garlic. Stir and cook for 2 minutes. Add barley. Cook and stir over medium heat until barley is coated. Stir in soup mixture and thyme. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes or until tender and liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with parsley.

Heat oil in wok over high heat. Saute onion and garlic until aromatic. Add ginger and stir-fry a few seconds more. Add chili and stir-fry until fragrant. Add water and bring to a boil. Add kangkong and cook until tender. Stir in soy sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with basil leaves and sesame seeds and serve immediately.
Peel apples and slice into 1/4-inch pieces. Combine applesauce and cinnamon. Pack mixture into popsicle molds, then insert wooden popsicle sticks and freeze until firm.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon oil. Add beef and crumble with a wooden spoon. When beef is no longer pink, add the remaining oil and onion. Cook and stir until onion is transparent. Stir in the green chilies. Beat eggs in a large bowl. Add the beef mixture and stir to combine. Add mayonnaise, water and cream. Stir in the cumin, cayenne and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Pour into a 9 inch pie dish coated with nonstick spray. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and top with the cheese. Bake 20 minutes or until egg is set. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting.

Wash the rice in a fine mesh strainer until the water runs clear. Set aside. Put the rice into a 3-quart pot or rice cooker with 2 cups of water and the chicken bouillon granules. Bring to a boil, cover and lower the heat to simmer until the rice is tender and all the water has been absorbed, about 40 minutes. Turn off the heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in the orange zest, lemon zest and green onions and fluff with a fork. Serve immediately.

Roast the red peppers in an oven preheated to 350 degrees until the peppers are blackened and the skins are blistered. Peel the skin off the peppers and place them in a food processor. Add the feta cheese, olive oil, oregano, jalapeno pepper and lemon juice. Puree until smooth and creamy. Add the sea salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste. Serve with pita bread or crackers. Great for hors d'oeuvres.

crust: combine vanilla wafer crumbs and margarine until crumbly. Press into bottom of a springform pan. bake at 400 degrees for 5 minutes.cooling: combine cream cheese and sugar until smooth. add milk and eggs one at a time. beat well after each addition. pour into crust. bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.cooling: spread with sweetened whipped cream. top with sliced kiwi. sprinkle with sliced macadamia nuts. chill until serving. serve with pineapple.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine butter, light corn syrup, sugar, soy sauce, and vegetable oil. Bring to a boil, stirring frequently to prevent boiling over. Add crispix cereal and toasted nori. Cook until crispix is coated and fragrant, about 2 minutes more. Transfer to bowl with slotted spoon. Spread to cool completely on waxed paper. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a 12-cup muffin pan with paper liners. Grate the carrots into a large bowl. Add dates, walnuts, and coconut. In a small bowl combine the egg, maple syrup and vanilla. Beat well. Add to the carrot mixture. In a medium bowl combine the flour, ground cinnamon, and nutmeg. Add to the carrot mixture. Stir until just combined. Spoon into the muffin cups filling three-quarters full. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Remove from the pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Cook udon noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles and return to pot. Add tamari, dark sesame oil, scallion, and Szechuan sauce. Heat through. Place in bowl. Top with red bell pepper, pea pods, and peanuts. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Lightly grease a rimmed baking sheet. Beat the egg white with the lemon juice and lemon zest until foamy. Add the salt and stir until well combined. Add the walnuts and mix until well coated. Sprinkle the brown sugar over the walnuts and stir until well coated. Spread the nuts in a single layer over the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until the nuts are lightly toasted and golden brown, about 35 minutes. Remove the nuts from the baking sheet to a wire rack to cool slightly. Sprinkle the red pepper flakes over the nuts just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. In a medium skillet over medium heat, cook corn, cream cheese and chilies until thoroughly heated. Remove from heat and stir in the cheese. Pour into prepared pan and bake 20 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips on the side.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Mix graham wafer crumbs and butter or shortening in a small bowl. Press into bottom and up side of 8 or 9 inch spring form pan. Bake 5 to 7 minutes. Cool. Beat cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and eggsmix well. Spread over crust. Bake 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Immediately place on wire rack and sprinkle with chocolate baking squares. Spread cherry pie filling over the top. Return to oven and bake 10 to 15 minutes longer. Turn oven off and allow to cool in the oven. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

Beat ricotta cheese until light. Add vanilla extract and powdered sugar to taste. Divide evenly among wonton wrappers. Place a small amount of filling in each wonton wrapper. Press edges to seal. Cut out shapes with a cookie cutter. Place tartlets on a parchment-lined cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees until lightly browned (about 10 minutes). Cool on a wire rack. Spread with cherry pie filling and garnish with whipped cream.

Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a wok over medium-low heat. Add the cabbage and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the red capsicum and spring onions and cook for another 2 minutes. Now add the noodles, garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the dried red chilies and cook for another minute. Add the green onions and season with salt. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil and mix well. Toss well to mix. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly oil two cookie sheets. Combine oat flour and rolled oats. Cream together butter and peanut butter. Add sugar and beat until mixture is fluffy. Add egg and mix well. Combine flour mixture, raisins and vanilla. Stir into butter mixture. Stir in bananas. Drop by teaspoon onto prepared sheets. Bake for about 12 minutes. Let cookies cool on sheets for 2 minutes. Move to wire racks to cool completely.

Bring salted water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Add the pasta and cook until tender but still al dente, 8 to 9 minutes. Drain the pasta and rinse well under cold running water to stop the cooking and prevent the pasta from sticking together. In a large bowl, combine the oil, lemon zest and juice, and pepper to taste. Toss the pasta and parsley with the dressing. Garnish with lemon slices, if desired.

In a pot over medium heat, combine lentils and water. Bring to a boilcover and reduce heat to a simmer. Continue cooking until lentils are tender (about 30 to 45 minutes). Drain and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute onion and oil until onion is translucent (about 5 minutes). Add chopped tomatoes and cook until slightly softened (about 10 minutes). Add lentils to skillet and mix thoroughly. Season with oregano and basil, salt and pepper to taste. Serve as is or with crusty Italian bread. Makes 6 servings.

Place the garbanzo beans in a large bowl and cover with water. Soak overnight or up to 24 hours. Drain and rinse the garbanzos. Transfer to a food processor fitted with a metal blade and add the olive oil and lemon juice. Blend well. Add the garlic and blend for about 30 seconds. Add the water and blend for about 10 seconds. Taste and add salt if needed. Transfer the hummus to a serving bowl. Stir in the tahini. Top the hummus with the sesame seeds and a drizzle of olive oil. Serve with carrots and celery. You can also add chopped tomato to the hummus.

Melt butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Cook onion and garlic powder in the butter for 3 minutes. Sprinkle flour over mixture and stir. Add milk and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened. Add roast beef and stir to coat. Lay tortillas on a clean work surface and spread beef mixture over them. Sprinkle with cheddar and fold over. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes per side or until browned. Serve with sour cream, salsa and lettuce.

Dip chicken in flour, then in egg and then in flour again. In a heavy pan with the hot fat, brown the chicken on both sides. In a casserole put in the browned chicken pieces with the sour cream, broth and paprika. Add mushrooms if desired. Bake in a moderate oven (350f) for about half an hour, or until tender. Serve immediately.

Combine the cranberries and the water in a saucepan over high heat. Cook until the cranberries have popped and the water is reduced to 1/2 cup (125 ml). Let cool to room temperature. Strain the berries from the liquid and place in a large bowl. Add the vodka and the sugar and stir to combine. Add the ice cubes and stir until the mixture is chilled and slushy. Pour into glasses and garnish with cranberries.

Mix biscuit mix, cold water & egg in a bowl until dough forms. Roll dough out to about 1/2" thickness. Spread cheese down the middle of the dough leaving about 1/4" of space from the edge. Sprinkle bacon over the cheese. Fold dough over & press edges together to seal. Cut in squares & brush egg wash over top. Bake @ 400 degrees until golden brown.

Heat olive oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onionsaute until soft, 3-4 minutes. Add apricots and cinnamon stickcook 1 minute more. Add tomatoesbring to boil and reduce heat to low. Simmer 5 minutes more. Remove meatballs from packageadd to tomato mixture and cook 5 minutes more. Serve over rice and top with almonds and cilantro. Serves 4

Heat butter in saute pan. Sauted garlic until it just starts to brown. Add sherry and bring to a boil. Add scallops and saute until just cooked through. Add mushrooms and saute a few minutes more. Add scallions. Add flour to a small bowl and add half-and-half. Whisk until smooth. Add to pan and cook until thickened. Spoon over scallops. Top with chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 375¬∞. Toss turnips with olive oil in an oven-safe baking dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until turnips are soft. In the meantime, combine cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, poultry seasoning, garlic powder, and black pepper. Remove turnips from oven and pour the soup mixture over the top. Bake for another 10 minutes or until the turnips are heated through. Serve hot.

Combine all ingredients in shallow dish. Add pork ribs and turn to coat evenly. Marinate in refrigerator overnight or up to 24 hours. Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Bake ribs for 1-1/2 hours or until pork is cooked through. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting between bones. Serve warm or at room temperature with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with butter. Peel and slice potatoes about 1/4 inch thickplace in a bowl. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heatstir in potatoes, white sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt until coated. Spread potatoes evenly in baking dishbake in oven until potatoes are fork-tender, about 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl combine the creamy peanut butter, brown sugar, honey, light butter and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth. Grease an 8x8-inch baking dish. Spread the mixture in the prepared pan. Sprinkle with the crispy rice cereal and bran buds. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 1 hour. Cut into 16 squares. Makes 16 servings. Each serving has 1 Weight Watchers point.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, whisk eggs and heavy cream together. Add cheese, scallions, and walnuts. Pour mixture in to pie crust. Bake for about 30 minutes.

Beat egg whites and cream of tartar until stiff. Gradually beat in granulated sugar and saltbeat until mixture is glossy and stiff peaks form. Beat in vanilla and butter. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls on wax paper. Bake in 275 oven about 2 hours or until nuts are lightly browned and are firm and dry to touch. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 10 dozen cookies.

In a bowl combine stuffing mix and cheese. In another bowl combine sour cream and butter until well blended. Remove chicken from package and pat dry with paper towels. Place chicken in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Spread with sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with stuffing mixture. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear when the chicken is pierced with a fork. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
In a medium bowl combine all of the ingredients and mix well. Serve on a cracker or small piece of toast.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil and 1 teaspoon spray in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook 4 to 5 minutes or until softened, stirring occasionally. Add mushrooms and fennel bulbcook 5 minutes or until vegetables are lightly browned. Stir in tomatoes and lemon juicecook 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Season cod with salt and pepperplace in skillet. Cook 3 minutes per side or until fish flakes when tested with a fork. Remove cod from skilletkeep warm. Serve cod with mushroom mixture, sprinkled with dill.

In a small saucepan combine apple cider vinegar with low sodium soy sauce and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Add brown sugar and all remaining ingredients. Stir well. Simmer over low heat until thickened, stirring often to prevent scorching. Remove from heat. Cool completely before storing in a covered container in the refrigerator.

Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat and reduce heat to medium. Cook for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes and let cool slightly. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and cook for 10 minutes or until browned and crisp. Add olive oil and stir. Add lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and sprinkle with dried oregano. Serve hot.

Peel and slice zucchini and yellow squash. In 10 inch square baking pan combine zucchini and squash, onion, tomatoes, sugar, salt, oregano and pepper. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. In small bowl combine eggs and milk. Pour over zucchini and squash mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 375 for 40 to 50 min or until set and lightly browned.
Mix together the first five ingredients. Dip chicken cutlets in mixture then roll in corn flake crumbs. Bake at 375 for about 35-40 minutes. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

Soak the beans overnight in a large pot filled with water. Rinse well and place in a large pot. Add the pork knuckle and 6 cups of water. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 hour. Add the lard and onion. Cover and cook for 1 more hour. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 1 hour. Season with cilantro and cumin. Serve with white rice.

In the crock pot, saute the onion in the olive oil until tender. Add the steaks and sprinkle with the ground pepper and garlic salt. Add the beef broth and onion soup mix. Add the tomatoes, stirring well. Cover and cook on high for 2-3 hours or on low for 4-6 hours. Stir in five-spice powder and serve. Serves 4 to 6.

In a small saucepan combine the chicken broth, paprika, and salt and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and return the mixture to a boilreduce the heat and cook for 8-10 minutes or until the chicken is done. Remove the chicken from the broth and discard the solids. Cool the chicken breasts and then shred it with two forks. Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat and add the chicken and paprika. Stir until well coated and cook for about 3 minutes or until heated through. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch and water and stir until smoothstir into the chicken mixture and cook for 1 more minute or until thickened. Stir in the sour cream and red pepper flakes and heat through. Serve immediately over hot cooked noodles or rice.

Heat butter in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add flour and cook, stirring frequently, for 3 minutes. Add half-and-half cream and seasoningsstir until smooth. Heat to boiling over high heat. Add parmesan cheesestir until melted. Serve over spaghetti. Serves 4.

Pour half-and-half into a microwave safe bowl and heat for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until very hot. Add margarine and butter to hot mixture and stir until completely melted and combined. Add sweet corn to mixture and stir until evenly distributed. Cover bowl with plastic wrap or lid and place in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight to firm up. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender but firm. Drain and place into a large bowl and stir in bacon, rosemary, capers, and onion. In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, garlic and pepper. Stir into potato mixture and refrigerate for at least one hour. Taste and add more pepper if desired. Serve with a drizzle of the garlic mayonnaise.

In a large mixing bowl combine butter and icing sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add rum and salt and beat well to combine. Stir in chips and vanilla wafers by hand. Using a medium cookie scoop place mixture on a parchment lined baking sheet. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. Melt chocolate with shortening and drizzle over each ball with a fork. Place on a parchment lined tray and refrigerate until firm. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat the grill or a cast iron skillet on medium high heat. Sprinkle each side with salt and pepper. Cook in the hot pan for about a minute on each side and then place in the oven for 10 minutes or until desired temperature is reached. Enjoy!

Roll pizza crust out to fit 9x13 pan. Layer mozzarella and parmesan cheese on bottom of crust. Top with spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle with pepperoni. Roll up and place seam side down in the pan. Brush with melted butter. Bake at 400 degrees f for 15 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

Combine first 4 ingredients. Reserve 1/2 cup. Heat remaining mixture in a small saucepan over medium heat until bubbly. Cut corn from cobs. Place corn on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Brush corn with reserved mixture. Broil 4 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Serve with lime wedges.

In a large bowl cream together sugar and mayonnaise. Add flour and mix well. Add the whole berry sauce, orange juice and orange rind. Stir in the milk and the baking soda. Mix until smooth.
