Pour into a greased and floured 10x15x1-inch jelly roll pan. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 40 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on a rack. To make frosting, combine all ingredients in a bowl and beat until smooth. Spread on cooled cake. Sprinkle with additional orange rind.

Slice onions and mushrooms into quarters. Place pork chops in a shallow baking pan and arrange onions and mushrooms on top of pork chops. Sprinkle with onion soup mix and water and cover with foil. Bake at 375 for about an hour or until pork chops are fork-tender and meat thermometer reaches 160 degrees F. Add cream of mushroom soup and heat through.

Combine honey, soy sauce and hoisin sauce in small bowlmix well. Thread wings onto skewers alternating with green onions. Place on grill over medium-high heatcook 5 minutes on each side or until donebasting frequently with glaze. Garnish with cilantro sprigs and garlic cloves.

Brown chicken meat on both sides in butter and oil in large pot or Dutch oven. Add remaining ingredients except pasta and rice. Cook until potatoes are tender but firm (about 1 hour). Add pasta. Cook about 30 minutes or until pasta is tender. Add ricecook for about 5 minutes longer or until pasta is tender. Serve immediately. Serves 6-8.

Warm wrap in microwave for about 3 seconds or until pliable. Spread pizza sauce on wrap, top with mushrooms, onions, garlic & cheese. Roll up wrap & cut in half. Serve with sunflower seeds or pita chips for dipping.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook for a few minutes. Add the zucchini, chayote, crookneck squash and continue cooking until tender. Stir in the chives and cilantro and serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saute garlic in olive oil until golden brown but not burned. Stir in green beans and cook until just tender. Stir in tomatoes and heat through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Place sugar and corn syrup in a heavy-bottomed stainless steel or copper pan. Heat over medium heat until sugar melts and mixture reaches 230 degrees fahrenheit. Do not stir. Meanwhile, beat egg whites with whisk attachment of electric mixer until foamy. Continue to beat and gradually sprinkle in 1/3 of the sugar mixture. Beat until stiff peaks form. Continue to add remaining sugar mixture 1/3 at a time, continuing to beat until mixture is glossy and stiff peaks form. Use immediately or store in airtight container for up to 3 weeks.

In a large bowl combine the cauliflower with the oil. Add the oat bran and toss. In a separate bowl combine the bread crumbs with the Parmesan, pepper and garlic salt. Place the cauliflower on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden. Serve immediately.

Remove the turkey legs from the refrigerator and pat dry with paper towels. Season each turkey leg with seasoning salt on both sides. Pour about 1/3 cup of barbecue sauce into a small bowl and stir in the brown sugar and lemon juice until completely combined. Add the turkey legs to the bowl and turn them to coat all sides with the sauce. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, or overnight. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Arrange the turkey legs on a baking sheet and place in the preheated oven. Cook until the turkey legs are golden brown and cooked through, about 1 hour. Turn the turkey legs over and bake for 30 minutes more, or until the turkey legs are dark brown and cooked through. Serve hot with additional barbecue sauce for dipping.

Cream shortening and brown sugar in large mixing bowl with electric mixer at medium speed. Add vanilla and eggs, beating until well blended. Stir in flour and salt. Mix well. Stir in oats and chocolate chips until blended. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for about 8-10 minutes or until edges are light brown. Cool slightly before removing from cookie sheet. Makes about 6 dozen.

Chop one large onion. In a 4-quart pot, bring 8 cups of water to a boil. Add onion. Cook for 10 minutes. Add 2 cups of red lentils. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add 2 teaspoons of tomato paste. Simmer for another 5 minutes. Season with 1 chicken bouillon cube. Add more broth or water if necessary.

Cook the ground chuck and turkey sausage together over medium heat in a large skillet. Drain fat and set aside. In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, saute the onion in olive oil until soft and golden. Add the cream cheese and stir until melted. Add the tomato sauce and spices. Bring to a boil. Add the meat and heat through. Add the cooked pasta and toss until well combined. Serve in bowls and top with the salsa.

Brown the hamburger with the onion. Add the french fries. Season with the seasoning. Cook in the oven at 325 degrees until the meat is cooked through and the french fries are crispy. Great served with corn muffins.

Place frozen rolls on greased baking sheet. Cut each roll into 4 wedges. In small bowl combine asiago cheese, cheddar cheese, and parmesan cheese. Spread butter over each wedge. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 12-15 minutes until golden. Cool 5 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 2 dozen.

In a medium bowl stir together the orange marmalade and grand marnierset aside. Slice the oranges in half crosswise to within 1/4 inch of the peel and remove the segments with a small sharp knife or melon ballerset aside. Dice the apricotsset aside. Halve the strawberriesset aside. Slice the pineappleset aside. Combine the diced apricots, orange segments, strawberries and pineapple in a large glass bowlpour the marmalade mixture over the fruitstir gently to coat evenly. Coverrefrigerate at least 2 hours before serving to allow flavors to blend. To serve, spoon the fruit into a decorative bowl or individual serving dishes.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring soy sauce, sake and mirin to a boil. Add scallions, garlic and ginger and cook for 5 minutes. Cool the glaze, then pour it over the wings and marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Grill the wings over medium heat for about 15 minutes, turning frequently, until they are cooked through and glazed. Garnish with scallions and serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350. Brown spam in large skillet. Drain. In medium saucepan, combine soups and milk. Heat through. Pour 1/2 can soup mixture over spam in skillet. Mix well. In a 1 1/2 quart baking dish layer noodles and 1 cup spam mixture. Repeat layers 3 times. Top with remaining spam mixture. Top with 3/4 cup velveeta. Bake 40 minutes or until bubbly.

Sift together the rice flour and gluten free baking powder. In a separate bowl whisk together the eggs and water. Mix the wet mixture with the dry mixture and stir until combined. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Heat a large skillet or cast iron skillet over medium high heat. Take a heaping teaspoon of batter and drop it into the pan. Use a spoon to create a circular shape. Cook for about 3 minutes per side. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Stir together sambal oelek, rice vinegar, and salt in small bowl until blended. In small nonstick skillet over medium heat, stir together sugar, garlic, and gingerroot until sugar is dissolved. Bring to boil and boil until thickened and reduced to 1/4 cup (about 3 minutes). Cool 10 minutes. Stir in vinegar mixture. Combine sambal oelek mixture and sweet chili mixture in small bowl. Refrigerate. Makes 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 inch pan with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine cake mix and next 4 ingredients. Beat at low speed 1 minute. Beat at medium speed 2 minutes. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool cake completely in pan. In a small bowl, combine cream and cinnamon. Spread over cake. In a medium bowl, combine brown sugar and butter. Drizzle over cream layer.

Dissolve jell-o in boiling water. Add fruit cocktail and chill. Beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla together until smooth. Fold in the dream whip. Spread over the jell-o mixture. Chill until ready to serve. Garnish with a slice of pineapple.

Wash cucumbers. Cut 1/2 inch off each end to form a flat surface. Cut lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Combine onions and sugar in a large bowl. Cover with cold water and soak overnight. Drain onions and discard water. Combine cucumbers, sugar, vinegar, pickling salt and mustard seeds. Add onions. Cover and refrigerate at least 6 hours. Drain. Add alum to vinegar to test for proper acidity. If it forms a solid mass it is not acid enough. Refrigerate for a few more hours. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Place 5 eggs in a pot and cover with 2 inches of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Drain eggs and place in a bowl of ice water. Peel eggs and slice in half. Place a few slices of pork in the center of each egg half. Mix soy sauces and vinegar in a small bowl. Brush over pork. Sprinkle with garlic and a little salt and pepper. Top with a little chopped fresh cilantro. Serve on crackers or toast.

In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat, add broth, pearl barley and beans. Cook 10 minutes. Stir in sweet potato and celery ribs. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for an additional 25 minutes or until barley is tender. Add thyme and sage. Continue cooking 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve immediately or cool and refrigerate up to 3 days. Heat when ready to serve. Garnish with fresh parsley if desired. Serve over brown rice for a complete meal.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine 3 eggs with 1/2 cup butter and 1 1/2 cups water. Mix well. Place mango slices into bottom of greased 9x13 pan. Add batter. Bake for 50-60 minutes. Cool and pour rum over top.

Heat 1 inch vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet until it registers 375 degrees f on a deep-fat thermometer. Place fish in the oil and fry until crisp and cooked through. Remove fish from the oil and place on paper towel to drain. Heat the remaining oil in the skillet over medium heat until the oil is hot but not smoking. Add garlic and ginger and saut for 1 minute. Add white wine, soy sauce and sugar. Stir to combine. Add fish and parsley. Toss to combine. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a bowl combine the eggs and half-and-half. Add the salt, pepper and chives. Set aside. Lay the bacon in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes, or until cooked but not crisp. Remove the bacon from the oven and set aside to cool. Slice the bacon into small pieces. In a small skillet over medium heat, saute the onion in the butter until soft. Add the flour to the onion mixture. Stir until flour is cooked through. Slowly add the half-and-half mixture to the onion mixture while stirring. Add the bacon pieces. Set aside. Pour the filling into the pie shell. Sprinkle the top evenly with the jarlsberg cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken breasts in a 9x13 inch casserole dish or other similar sized dish. Sprinkle with onion soup mix and mushroom soup mix. Place the chicken breasts in the oven for 20 minutes. Increase the temperature to 400 degrees. Remove chicken from oven, increase the temperature to 450 degrees and place chicken back in oven to cook for 15 minutes longer, basting occasionally with the pan juices. Remove from oven and pour 1 1/2 cups of milk over chicken and let it set for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with mushrooms and serve over rice.

In saucepan heat milk over low heat. Add brown sugar, coffee extract. Cook for 1 minute. Stir to dissolve. Beat egg yolks. Gradually pour hot milk over egg mixture. Place over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Pour into ramekins. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Let cool. Top with caramel sauce. Recipe taken from my friend and her mother. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Place garlic in a mortar or the bowl of a food processor and crush or process to a fine paste. Add cilantro and parsley and process until finely chopped. In a bowl whisk together garlic mixture, sherry vinegar, oil, hot sauce and sugar until smooth. Season to taste with salt. Store in an airtight container for several days. Stir before using. Makes about 3/4 cup.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine butter and marshmallows. Stir frequently until the mixture is melted and smooth. Add popcornmix well. Pour popcorn mixture into a 9x9 inch pan. Using a butter knife, spread the mixture out to an even layer. Cool completely. Once cooled, cut into squares. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup water and jellostir until dissolved. Pour jello mixture over popcorn mixture. Chill for 1 hour. Cut into squares and enjoy!

Fry the onions and the bacon for 2-3 minutes. Cut the liver into small pieces. Mix the liver with the onion and bacon. Add the flour and mix well. Add the dry white wine and mix well. Add the sour cream, sugar and vinegar. Bring to boil. Stir well. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the freshly ground black pepper. Serve hot with potatoes. Serves 2-4.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine cream cheese, cheese, and egg in a bowl. Season to taste with pepper. Pour mixture into a greased muffin pan, filling the cups 1/2 full. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Garnish with chives. Makes 18 bites.

Preheat over to 350 degrees. In large bowl combine all sauce ingredients. Remove any silver skin from back of ribs. Place ribs in shallow roasting pan. Pour sauce over ribs. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and baste ribs with sauce. Bake uncovered for an additional 30 minutes. Remove from over, turn ribs over and baste again. Bake an additional 30 minutes. Serve.

Sift together flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt. Add milk and vanillamix until smooth. Beat egg until foamyadd to batter, stirring just until smooth. Melt butter in skillet over medium heatdip bread in batter, turning to coat both sidesadd to hot buttered skillet. Brown on both sides and place in 350f oven until bread is heated through and center is firm, about 10 minutes. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease two baking sheets. Beat egg whites in a large bowl until fluffy. Add brown sugar and beat well. Add vanilla extract and salt. Stir in pecans. Drop mixture by level teaspoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Turn off oven and allow cookies to cool in oven for one hour. After one hour, remove cookies and allow to cool completely on wire racks.

Peel and boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and mash. Add the egg and mix well. Add the cottage cheese and mix. Add the sugar, flour and salt. Mix well. Heat the butter in a skillet and form patties from the mixture. Brown on both sides. Serve with sour cream and raisins.

Heat the drippings in a heavy skillet. Add the flour gradually to the drippings until it forms a roux. Add the mustard, Worcestershire Sauce, salt and pepper. Stir until thickened. Add the consomme. Stir. Add the green onions. Cook until the green onions are tender. Add the Burgundy wine. Stir. Cook until the wine is reduced. Remove from heat.

In a food processor with an on-off switch, combine espresso and 1/4 cup water. Process until smooth. Set aside. Beat egg yolks and 1/4 cup sugar in a bowl until pale. In another bowl, whisk egg whites until stiff. Fold egg yolks into espresso mixture. Add mascarpone and fold until blended. Add marsala and triple sec. Fold in 1/4 of the egg whites and fold until blended. Continue with remaining egg whites. Fold chocolate into mixture. Transfer half of the mixture into a shallow dish. Cover with remaining mixture. Refrigerate at least 6 hours. Serve chilled. Garnish with chocolate shavings.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Place the potatoes on a baking sheet and drizzle with the oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake until tender, about 40 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven and spread the orange marmalade on top of each potato half. Sprinkle with the honey and the ginger. Return the potatoes to the oven for another 5 minutes to bake the marmalade glaze. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).Lightly grease 9√ó13 inch baking dish. In large bowl, combine ground beef, crescent rolls, cheese and onions. Arrange mixture in prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees f (175 degrees c) for 25 minutes.Top with american cheese slices. Bake an additional 15 minutes or until golden.Serve on rolls or buns.

slice lebanon bologna in thin slices. slice hardboiled egg in thin slices. spread mayonnaise on each piece of bread. on one slice of bread, put the egg, then the lebanon bologna, then the sweet gherkins. on the other slice of bread, put the lebanon bologna, then the egg, then the sweet gherkins. sprinkle with dill relish.

Mix cake mix, almond extract, eggs, and water according to package directions. Pour into 13x9 inch pan. Bake 35 minutes. While cake is baking, combine cherry pie filling and water. Pour over hot cake. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake 5 minutes more.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Wash and scrub the sweet potatoes, and place them in a large saucepan. Cover with water and boil over high heat until the potatoes are very tender when pierced with a fork. Drain the sweet potatoes. In a medium bowl, mash the sweet potatoes with the butter and seasoning. Stir in the honey and cinnamon. Place the sweet potatoes in a baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until the potatoes are lightly browned and bubbly, 25 to 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet cook ground beef and onion until done. Drain fat. Add in celery and chili, stirring well to combine all ingredients. Pour into a 9x13 inch pan. In a separate bowl add in taco sauce and tomatoes and mix together. Pour over meat mixture in pan. Spread corn over meat mixture and sprinkle cheese over corn and meat mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until noodles are tender and mixture is bubbly. Serves 6-8

Bring vinegar and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Remove from heat. Add salt and sugar and stir until sugar dissolves. Cool to room temperature, then add dill. Wash watermelon and slice it thinly. Pack slices in a bowl with 1 cup of pickling liquid and refrigerate for 3 days or more. Makes 4 cups pickles.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Pat fish dry with paper towels. Place in a 13 by 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine oil, parsley and red pepper flakesspoon over fish. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Meanwhile, combine cherry tomatoes and olives in a bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss gently. Serve fish with tomato mixture and lemon wedges. Serves 4. Recipe courtesy of the mccormick spice company.

Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the chicken and a small amount of the olive oil. Brown the chicken until cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet. In the same skillet, saute the garlic and onions until translucent. Add the chopped tomatoes, and saute for 2 minutes. Stir in the white wine. Add the stock and cook until reduced by half. Add the sour cream. Reduce the heat to low. Return the chicken to the skillet. Stir to coat with sauce. Serve over white rice. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 170 degrees C / Gas mark 3. Line two baking trays with baking paper or grease lightly with butter. In a medium bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg, vanilla extract and flours until well combined. Fold in coconut and chocolate chips until well combined. Roll tablespoons of mixture into balls. Place on lined baking trays, leaving plenty of room for spreading. Bake for 15 minutes until lightly golden around the edges. Leave on trays for 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Place the chicken in a large pot and pour the chicken stock over the top. Bring it to the boil. Turn down the heat and simmer for about an hour. Remove the chicken from the pot and allow it to cool. Once cooled, strip the meat from the bones. Set aside.In a separate pot, combine the cornflour and the dijon mustard and stir well. Add the cream and stir well. Add the chicken stock mixture and the chicken. Simmer for a further 10 minutes. Preheat the BBQ to high. Cut the capsicum into slices. Combine the capsicum with the tomatoes in a bowl. Slice the onions. Place the salsa on the BBQ with a lid. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the salsa is hot. Place the salsa in a bowl. Place the chicken onto a plate. Slice the meat into strips. Sprinkle the meat with the salsa. Serve with mash potatoes or rice.

Heat the oven to 400f. In the bottom of a shallow roasting pan (a jelly roll pan works well), toss the brussels sprouts with 1 tablespoon of the oil. Roast until well-browned all over but still slightly crunchy when pressed with your finger, 25 minutes to 30 minutes. In a medium saucepan, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil over medium-low heat. Add the sprouts, salt and nutmeg. Stir until the sprouts are evenly coated. Reduce the heat to low. Cook until the sprouts are tender and the liquid has evaporated, 5 minutes. Pour in the heavy cream. Cook until the mixture is very thick, 3 minutes.

Mix half-and-half and fat-free cream cheese until smooth and blended. Beat in Splenda, lime juice concentrate and gelatin mixture until combined well and smooth. Pour into greased 9-inch springform pan and refrigerate until set. To make the crust, combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar substitute with melted butter and press into bottom of pan. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Let cool before topping with cheesecake filling. Chill at least 4 hours before serving. Garnish with lime slices and whipped topping, if desired.
In a large bowl mix hamburger with the velveeta and salsa until well combined. Spread into a 2-1/2 qt slow cooker. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. Mix well and serve with sour cream.

Cook stuffing mix in water according to directions on the box. Drain and add cooked chicken. Add soup and milk. Add cheese. Mix well and pour into a greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-45 minutes.

In a nonstick skillet heat olive oil and saute onion and garlic for 3 minutes or until onion is soft. Stir in carrot, cook for 5 minutes or until carrot is soft. Sprinkle with oregano, pickled jalapeno peppers and salt to taste. Transfer to bowl. Serve hot or cold.
Spread butter over fish. Sprinkle with lemon juice and paprika. Place in microwave and cook for 5 minutes on high. Check after 2 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Mix together thousand island dressing and water. Cut rounds of bread and place between paper towels to absorb moisture. Place 3 slices of corned beef on each round. Top each round with 2-3 teaspoons of sauerkraut. Place one slice of cheese on each round. Carefully pour thousand island dressing over each round. Bake at 400 for 10-15 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oven and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375. Cook hashbrowns according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a skillet, melt butter. Add onion and cook until tender. Combine hashbrowns, soup and onions. Mix in cheeses. Spread into an 11x7 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes.

In a food processor or blender combine beans, pepper, onion, carrot, salsa. Form into 4 burger size patties. In a shallow bowl combine breadcrumbs, flour, black pepper, and chili powder. Coat each burger with breadcrumb mixture. Fry in 2 tbsp of oil on each side until crisp and golden brown. Serve on a whole grain roll with lettuce or tomato.

Mix all ingredients together well. Dip chicken breasts or tenders into the mixture and roll around to coat all sides. Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes, then turn over and bake for another 10 minutes. Let rest for about 5 minutes then serve with a side of fat free ranch dressing.

Saut√© onion in butter until tender. Add ground beef, and cook until browned. Stir in ketchup, yellow mustard, worcestershire sauce, sugar and pepper. Mix in pork & beans. Pour mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serves 8.

Mix meat, onion, seasonings and egg well. Divide into 2 equal partsshape each into a flat round loaf about 1/2-inch thick. Place 1 loaf in each baking dish, leaving space between them. Cover loaves with slices of swiss cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. While burgers are baking, prepare toppings by frying bacon and mushrooms. Drain bacon well on paper towels and crumble. Mix bacon and mushrooms with sauceheat sauce mixture until hot. Remove burgers from oven. Spread each with sauce mixture and top with bacon mixture. Return to oven for 5 minutes to heat through. Serve with buns.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Blanch florets briefly until tender crisp. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a small bowl whisk together orange juice, honey, ginger, cornstarch and water. Set aside. Heat oil in a medium saute pan over high heat. Add broccoli florets. Saute until florets are slightly brown. Add orange juice mixture. Bring to a boil and cook until mixture has thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Drizzle with dark sesame oil and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add garlic and continue cooking until fragrant (approximately 1 minute). Add rice and jalapeno and continue cooking for another minute or so stirring constantly. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered until rice is cooked (about 15 minutes). Add tomato, ancho powder, and salt to taste and stir well. Cover and simmer for 3 minutes more. Remove from heat and serve immediately.

Melt butter and add onion soup mix. Stir for a minute or so. Add beef and brown. Add water. Stir in frozen mixed vegetables and juice. Add 1/4 cup of water. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook on low for 1 hour. Makes 6 servings.

In a food processor or blender, combine garbanzo beans, tahini paste, garlic cloves, lime juice, warm water, extra virgin olive oil, sun-dried tomato, roasted red pepper, fresh basil leaves and pulse until smooth. Transfer to a serving dish and serve with vegetable crudit√©s, crackers or pita bread for dipping.

In a large saucepan, bring water to boil. Add lentils and carrots. Cook until lentils are tender, 20 minutes. Mash with the back of a wooden spoon. Add ginger. Taste and season with miso or soy. Serve.
Slice mushrooms into thin slices. In a small skillet melt the butter with flour. Stir in mushrooms and sour cream. Stir in the seasonings and simmer. Serve warm.

Peel papayas, remove seeds and chop. In a large saucepan combine all ingredients. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until papayas are tender and juice is thickened. Strain through a fine sieve. Serve chilled or over ice. Makes about 3 quarts.

Cream the butter with the cream cheese until light and fluffy. Beat in the sugar until well blended. Add the milk, vanilla and mix well. Sift together the flour and salt. Add to the creamed mixture and blend well. Chill for several hours or overnight. Roll into 1 inch balls and roll in walnuts. Place on a buttered cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Cool on racks.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash potatoes. Poke with fork several times. Bake until fork inserted in potato goes in easily. Set aside. Melt butter in small saucepan over low heat. Stir in ranch dressing mix. Add sour cream. Simmer 2-3 minutes until thickened. Stir in cream cheese until melted. Stir in potato. Spoon into buttered casserole. Bake 30 minutes. Serve warm. 4-6 servings.

Trim fennel bulb and cut into 1/2 inch slices. Heat oil in heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onion and fennel and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and wine and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add garlic cloves and cook until tender, about 5 minutes more. Add lemon juice and herbs and cook until liquid is reduced by half and sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes more. Stir in capers and season with salt and pepper. Serve over cooked pasta or rice.

Soak beans overnight. Heat oil in a pan, add onions and saute until brown. Add rice and saute for about 1 minute. Add beans and water, bring to boil and simmer covered for about 15 minutes or until rice is tender and beans are cooked through. Add salt and pepper. Serve hot with paprika and bay leaves sprinkled on top. Serves 4-6.

In a large pot combine cinnamon sticks, bay leaves, whole cloves and lemon and orange slices. Pour enough water to cover the fruit and spices. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Strain the liquid and pour it into a clean container. Refrigerate overnight. The next day remove the container and add the vodka. Strain again. Refrigerate and use within 3 weeks.

Slice bananas into 1/4" thick pieces. Cut each cookie into fourths. Line bottom of 9x13 pan with a layer of cookies. Add a layer of banana slices. Sprinkle with about 1/2 of the condensed milk. Add another layer of cookies. Add a layer of banana slices. Sprinkle with the remaining condensed milk. Add a layer of cookies. Add a layer of cool whip. Refrigerate overnight. Sprinkle with chopped nuts before serving.

Peel gala apples. Using a sharp knife, cut apples into small dice. Combine apple pieces with the clementine sections in a small non-reactive bowl. In a small saucepan, combine vinegar, sugar, lemon juice, zest, cinnamon, garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon of the red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 2 minutes. Add the apple mixture to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until the mixture thickens to a syrupy consistency, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of the red pepper flakes. Serve warm or cool to room temperature. Keeps for one week in the refrigerator.

Place the garlic in the bowl of a food processor with a pinch of salt and pulse until finely minced. Add the butter and process until the butter is in small pieces. Add the buttermilk and process until a dough forms. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Place the dough in a large bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line 24 miniature muffin cups with paper liners. Divide the dough into 24 equal portions and roll into ballsplace in the prepared cups. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned on top. Remove from the oven and place the cups on a wire rack to cool completely. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine the cheese and Italian seasoningset aside. Once the cups are cooled, spoon the cheese mixture into the cups. Cover the cheese with the parsley and

Preheat oven to 225 degrees F. Spray 2 large cookie sheets with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl combine cereal, walnuts and salt. In a small bowl combine the honey, vanilla and cinnamonmix well. Add the honey mixture to the cereal mixture and stir well. Spread the mixture on the 2 cookie sheets. Bake for 1 hour or until the mixture is golden brown and crisp. Stir the mixture occasionally as it bakes. Remove from the oven and cool completely on the baking sheets. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 weeks. Makes about 16 cups.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cube feta cheese into 1 inch cubes. Place in a shallow dish. Toss with olive oil, pepper and oregano. Bake until cheese is lightly golden brown, about 15 minutes. Serve with sliced pita bread.

Combine first five ingredients in large bowl. Stir in next five ingredients. Spoon half of mixture into lightly greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Cover with potato chipstop with remaining mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until set. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Yields 8 servings.

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Trim asparagus to 1 inch below woody ends. Cut the woody ends off the asparagus and place in a bowl. Add the olive oil and red wine vinegar and toss. Roast in the oven 15-20 minutes or until tender. Combine tomatoes and scallions in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Add the parsley and toss. Divide asparagus among 4 plates and top with tomato salad.

Peel oranges and slice into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Place orange slices into a large bowl. Add vinegar, oil, salt and pepper to taste. Toss to combine. Gently fold in avocado slices. Garnish with basil leaves if desired. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, whisk together the clementines, ground almonds, sugar, baking powder, eggs and vanilla. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until a cake tester inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Allow to cool before cutting into squares.

Boil potatoes in their skins until tender. When they are cooked, drain them and put them in a bowl of cold water. When cool enough to handle, remove the potatoes from the water and pat them dry. Cut them into wedges. Melt the butter in a large heavy saucepan and add the potatoes. Toss until well coated. Sprinkle the potatoes with the basil and salt and toss well. Spread them on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 20 to 30 minutes or until they are crisp and golden. Serve them warm or at room temperature. Serve with soup or salad.
In a blender combine milk, banana, egg whites, and oats. Blend until smooth. Add honey to taste.

Combine cinnamon and sugar. Set aside. Beat together pineapple and brown sugar. Spread into an ungreased 9x13 baking dish. Combine dry cereal and nuts. Sprinkle over pineapple. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40 minutes. Combine brown sugar and butter. Brush over bun tops. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Cool. Combine powdered sugar and milk. Drizzle over buns. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 10x15x1-inch baking pan with foil and spray with cooking spray. In a large saucepan, combine the brown sugar, butter, and water over medium heat. Stir until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture comes to a boilboil for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and stir in the eggs and vanilla. Sift together the flour and cocoa powderstir into the sugar mixture until well blended. Stir in the nuts. Pour into the prepared baking pan, and bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top of the brownies are firm and the center is set. Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan on a wire rack, then remove the brownies from the foil and cut into squares. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week. Makes 24 squares.

Place 1 cup of the whipping cream in a bowl and stir in the yogurt. Stir in the remaining 3 cups whipping cream and the sugar. Place mixture in an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer instructions. While ice cream is churning, stir in the lemon juice and food coloring. Drizzle with lemon peel and serve.

In a bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. In a separate bowl cream butter with caster sugar. Add puree and vinegar and beat until smooth. Add milk a little at a time until a smooth batter forms. Stir in flour mixture to combine. Heat oven to 350f. Line two muffin trays with paper cases (muffin cups). Divide batter between cases to make 12 muffins. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until golden brown. Cool in trays. Serve warm or cold.

In a large dutch oven over medium-high heat, saute onion and garlic in the butter until onion is translucent about five minutes. Add zucchini, carrot and broccoli and cook for about five minutes. Add broth and cook until vegetables are tender about five minutes. Add the flour and cook for one minute stirring constantly. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Stir until thickened and smooth. Add cheese and stir until melted. Serve immediately and garnish with a sprinkle of cheese.

Prepare crepes by beating eggs with skim milk, flour, sugar and salt. Heat butter in nonstick skillet. Pour crepe batter into skillet. Cook over medium heat until crepe is golden brown and top is set. Flip crepe and cook other side. Repeat. Serve with your favorite topping.

Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Add brothstirring constantly. Add carrots, celery, onions and garlicbring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Remove from heatstir in chicken. Makes 6 servings.

In small sauce pan melt butter over medium heat. Add jalapeno and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add chives and mix well. In small mixing bowl whisk together dijon mustard and lemon juice. Add butter mixture and mix well. Set aside. In small plate combine flour and seasonings. Dip shrimp in flour mixture to coat well. In large frying pan heat oil until hot. Add shrimp in batches and fry 4 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned and cooked through. Drain and place on paper towel to remove excess oil. Place on plate and pour butter mixture over top. Serve immediately.
Dissolve pudding in milk in a large bowl. Chill until set. Add gelatin and strawberries. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add corn, tomatoes, olives, green pepper, and onion. Cook 5-10 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Drain vegetables. Add to bowl. Cover and refrigerate. Serve chilled.

In a small bowl combine honey and lime juice. Thread 3 pearl onions, 2 green pepper strips and 1 pineapple chunk onto each skewer. Brush with oil and grill over medium heat for 3 minutes per side. Brush with honey mixture and cook an additional 3 minutes. Remove from grill and brush with remaining honey mixture. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.

Peel and slice potatoes. Heat fat in a large skillet until hot. Add sliced potatoes. Fry well, turn occasionally until nice and brown. Add honey, cook a few minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve hot.

Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add garlic and rosemary and saute. Add wine vinegar and cook until mixture begins to reduce. Season the mixture with salt and pepper. Place the pork in the pan and coat all sides. Cook over medium heat for 10-15 minutes. Turn the pork every 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and coat the pork with the Worcestershire sauce. Slice the pork and serve the sauce on the side.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large frypan on medium heat, add the bacon and cook until golden and crispy. Remove bacon and set aside. Add the zucchini, capsicum and carrot and cook for about 8 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Transfer the vegetables to a small bowl and set aside. Whisk together the eggs and milk in another large bowl, season and add the bacon and vegetables and mix well. Pour the egg mixture into a large pie dish or pie plate. Sprinkle with the grated cheese and bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes or until just set. Serve warm.

Toast one slice of bread in sandwich press until toasted on both sides. Add cheese slice. Add ham slice. Add remaining slice of bread. Close sandwich press. Cook until cheese is melted. Serve on plate with lettuce, tomato or other condiments.

Peel and slice the potatoes. In a large saucepan bring skim milk and paprika to a boil. Add potatoes and boil for 5-7 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile in a small skillet over medium-high heat saute the garlic in a little oil for 1 minute. Add the potatoes and 1/4 cup of the milk, and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Meanwhile in a small skillet over medium heat toast the black peppercorns for 2 minutes. When the potatoes are done add the remaining milk and toasted peppercorns and heat through. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Serve sprinkled with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt.
While rice is cooking, heat milk. Add the egg and beat well. When rice is cooked, stir in rice. Stir in sugar and cinnamon. Bake in a buttered casserole dish at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Wash and scrub potatoes. Cut the Idaho potatoes into 1-inch pieces. Wash the red potatoes and cut into 1-inch pieces. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the Idaho potatoes. Cook until tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Add the red potatoes. Continue to cook for an additional 10 to 15 minutes or until both potatoes are tender. Drain the potatoes. Return to the pot. Add the butter. Mash with a hand masher until you have a chunky mash. Add the horseradish. Stir until incorporated. Add the heavy cream. Stir to combine. Add the salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Gently reheat the potatoes in the microwave if necessary.

In large bowl, cream butter and honey. Add sugar and eggmix well. Combine flour, baking soda and saltgradually add to creamed mixture and mix well. Stir in ginger and cinnamon. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from baking sheets to cooling racks. Makes about 4 dozen.

To prepare the filling, combine the blueberries and peach in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, combine the sugar, cornstarch and lemon juice. Add the sugar mixture to the berry mixture and stir well to combine. In a large bowl combine the flour, brown sugar and cinnamon. Add the melted butter and mix well. Spread the mixture evenly in the bottom of a greased 8-inch square baking pan. Spoon the fruit mixture evenly over the crust mixture. Bake for 45 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream and/or whipped cream.
In a large bowl combine spinach and cream cheese until smooth, add remaining ingredients and mix well. Chill 1 hour and serve with crackers, vegetables or chips. Serves 25-30.

Heat the oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add the carrots, zucchini and onion. Saute until vegetables are tender-about 5 minutes. Add the celery and saute for another 3 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and saute for another minute. Pour in the stock and lentils. Bring the soup to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat to simmer and cook for 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Serve with freshly ground pepper and the parsley.

Combine vodka, rum, and cointreau in a shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into an ice-filled glass. Fill the glass with sweet and sour mix and top with pineapple juice. Garnish with an orange slice and a lime wedge and serve.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, cook onion and garlic in butter for 4 minutes, or until softened. Add endive and cook for an additional minute. Add potatoes and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add milk and cook until potatoes are tender. Puree mixture in a blender or food processor until smooth. Stir in seasonings. Garnish each serving with a sprinkling of chives and a sprig of dill. Serve hot.
Melt oil over medium heat in large saucepan. Add garlic saltstir 1 minute. Add nutsstir. Cook 1 minute. Add seasoning mixstir 1 minute. Stir in chili powderstir. Serve warm.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the onions in the butter and oil for about 20 minutes. Add the brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Saute until the brown sugar caramelizes. Remove the skillet from the heat, and stir in the food coloring until the onions are the desired color. Use right away or cool completely, cover and refrigerate for up to one week.

Beat whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Fold in marshmallow cream and cream cheese until smooth. Fold in peanut butter and vanilla. Spoon mixture into an ungreased pie pan and freeze for several hours. Melt chocolate and pour over frozen layer. Freeze until set. Cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a cookie sheet with wax paper. In a large bowl mix together all ingredients. Spread cereal mixture onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Spread out to cool and break into pieces. Store in an air-tight container.

Cut squash into 1/4-in-thick slices. Toss with oil and vinegar. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and basil. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until lightly browned and tender. Sprinkle with cheese and serve with crackers or breadsticks.

In a large skillet, saute the red and green onions and red pepper until just soft. In a mixing bowl, combine crab meat, onions and red peppers. Add the Swiss and cheddar cheeses and seasonings. Stir until combined. Add half and half and beat until smooth. Pour into a greased 9-inch pie plate. In another mixing bowl, combine bread crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over crab mixture. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, until golden. Cut into wedges to serve.

In a food processor puree the grapefruit juice, soy sauce, grapefruit and garlic. Add chicken and olive oil and process until chicken is coated in marinade. Cover and marinate overnight in refrigerator. Thread chicken onto skewers. Grill for 5-6 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with salad.

Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until softened. Stir in ginger. Add red curry paste to saucepan and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Add sweet potato and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in coconut cream and coriander leaves. Season with sugar to taste. Serve immediately. Serves 4
Cut melon into small cubes (about 1 inch). Toss with remaining ingredients. Chill for 1 hour before serving. Serve with grilled fish or poultry.

Make an overnight marinade of the chicken in a mixture of salt, pepper, garlic, lemon grass, lemon juice and lime juice with the annatto seeds for coloring. Place in the refrigerator overnight, turning the chicken occasionally to ensure an even coat of marinade on the chicken. Remove the chicken from the marinade. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels and rub with a mixture of garlic butter and chili pepper flakes. Cook the chicken on an outdoor grill or under the broiler until the skin is crisp and the chicken is done through.

Combine soup and crushed pineapple in medium saucepan. Cook over low heat 15 minutes or until heated through. Stir in root beer. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Add brown sugar. Stir well. Add the onion and ham. Serve in hamburger buns.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown beef. Add the onions, celery and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in tomatoes with their liquid, water, noodles and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 12 minutes or until noodles are tender. Stir in cheesecover for 5 minutes more or until cheese melts. Serve with shredded parsley if desired. Serves 6.

Toss together apples and sugar in a large bowl and set aside. Combine oats, flour and nutmeg in a separate bowl and mix well. Add butter and cut in with a pastry blender until crumbly. Spread crumbs over apples in a greased baking dish and bake for 25 minutes. In a small bowl combine coconut and milk until well mixed and spread over top of apples. Return to oven for about 5 minutes or until topping is bubbly. Serve with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

Boil rice in a large pot with hot water, cinnamon pods and cardamom pods. Once done add butter. Mix well. In a separate pan, add butter to almonds and raisins. Add to the rice mixture. Add peas. Season to taste with salt.
Cook orzo in boiling water 12 minutes. Drain. Combine orzo with vinegar and remaining ingredients. Refrigerate 4 hours. Yield 4 servings.

Place beef in slow cooker. Top with mexican-style tomatoes. Sprinkle with chipotle chiles and cover with water. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. About 15 minutes before serving, mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Stir into crock pot. Cook until slightly thickened. Serve with tortillas and any of your favorite mexican-style toppings. I like a dollop of sour cream. This can also be served over white rice.

In microwave safe bowl, melt butter. Add marshmallows. Stir until completely melted. Add vanilla. Stir well. Stir in peanut butter chips. Spread into 13 by 9-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cereal. Let stand until set. Cut into bars. Makes about 3 dozen.

Melt butter in a dutch oven or large pot over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until softened, about 3 minutes. Add chicken and rosemarycook until browned, about 5 minutes more. Add broth, water, celery, and pepperbring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove chicken and allow broth mixture to cool slightlydiscard rosemary stems and remove chicken from bones and shred or dice. Return chicken and basil to broth mixtureheat through. Serve in bowls with noodles and additional basil sprinkled on top if desired.
Place all of the ingredients in a 4-quart slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cook on low for 5 hours. Serve biscuits hot. Serves 4 to 6.
Add the gin and vodka to a pitcher and stir. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the lemon juice and sparkling wine and stir again. Add ice cubes and serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press mixture into a 12x18 inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until crust is lightly browned and set. Cool on a wire rack. In a small bowl, combine brown sugar and butterstir in vanilla and pecans. Spread over cooled crust and cool in the refrigerator for 1 hour or until set. Cut into bars and store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator. Makes about 12 bars.

Cook tortellini according to package directions in salted boiling water. Drain and reserve 1/4 cup of the pasta cooking liquid. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and cook 1 minute or until tender. Add cream and whipping cream to skillet and cook until heated through, stirring constantly. Add reserved pasta cooking liquid. Stir until mixture is slightly thickened. Add tortellini and cheese and toss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Add prosciutto and artichoke hearts and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9√ó13 inch pan. Bake for 22-25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting into bars. In a small saucepan, melt margarine over low heatstir in chocolate chips until melted. Cool completely before drizzling over bars. Drizzle with sweetened condensed milk before serving if desired.

Melt oil in large skillet over medium heat, add onion and cook, stirring, 3-4 minutes or until softened. Add sweet potato and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 5-7 minutes or until softened. Add milk, salt and pepper and bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, 10-15 minutes or until thickened. Add butter, stirring until melted. Serve hot with roast meats or fish or as a side dish with braised meats such as lamb shanks or pork shoulder.

Mix lemon juice, garlic, scallions and rosemary. Rub pork chops and sprinkle black pepper on both sides. Place on baking pan and bake for 45 minutes at 325 degrees fahrenheit. Let chops rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Butter two shallow dishes. Rinse and dry shrimp. Dip in beaten egg and then coat with unseasoned breadcrumbs. Place in prepared dishes and bake at 425 degrees for 12 minutes. Turn over and bake for 10 minutes more or until breadcrumbs are lightly browned. Sprinkle with garlic salt and parsley before serving. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9-inch square baking pan. Combine pears, cashews, flour, sugar, margarine and syrup in a large bowl. Mix well until combined and starting to come together. Press mixture firmly and evenly in prepared pan with lightly floured hands. Bake for 20-25 minutes until lightly golden brown on top. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before slicing into squares. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled.

Heat the marinara sauce in a medium saucepan over medium high heat. Heat the vodka in a small saucepan over low heat until almost evaporated. Add the dill and cream to the saucepan. Add the smoked salmon, pasta and peas. Cook until heated through. Serve hot.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook spinach for 3 minutes or until wilted. Drain and rinse well under cold water. Drain again and squeeze out excess water. In a small bowl, combine spinach and remaining ingredients. Toss and serve.
Cook ground beef and drain. Add soup, catsup, and salt to ground beef. Heat through. Serve on hamburger buns.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add cinnamon. Stir in raisins. Cook noodles in milk until tender. Stir in sugar, salt and almond extract. Cool slightly. Stir in eggs. Pour into greased 1-quart casserole. Bake in 350 oven for 40 to 50 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. In medium bowl, combine milk, butter, egg substitute and sugar. Stir to blend. In small bowl, combine flour and baking powder. Mix well. Add to milk mixture and stir to blend. Spray 9x13-inch baking pan with nonstick spray. Pour batter into pan. Bake at 400f degrees for 20-25 minutes or until done. Cut into squares and serve.

In a large pot cook the butter, leeks and potatoes for 10 minutes or until tender. Add the cooking onion and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Pour in the wine and reduce by half. Add the hummus and stir well. Add the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with pepper. Serve hot.
Combine the rice, beans, cooked chicken and cilantro in a bowl. Top with salsa and banana slices. Garnish with onion slices and serve.

Slice the garlic cloves in half. In a crock pot combine the beef, garlic, and seasonings. Cook, covered, for 2-3 hours. Add the beans and tomatoes and simmer for another hour. Stir in the sweet onions and serve.

Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl. Cut in mayonnaise with a pastry cutter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk to form a soft dough that holds together well. Turn onto floured surfaceknead lightly 6-8 times. Pat or roll out dough 1/2-inch thick. Using 2 1/2-inch fluted cookie cutter or glass dipped in flour, cut out roundsplace 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake in 400 degree oven 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 1 minuteremove from cookie sheets. Makes 2 dozen muffins.

Cook green beans in boiling salted water for 5 minutes. Drain beans and place in serving dish. In a separate bowl, combine the sour cream, cheese and onions. In a third bowl, combine the soup, water and margarine. Add to the onion mixture and stir until well blended. Pour over the beans. Sprinkle with the cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serves 6.

Melt butter and chocolate together. Add eggs and vanilla and beat until fluffy. Add flour and salt and mix well. Pour into a 2 quart souffle dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

In medium saucepan heat butter over medium high heat. Add hearts of palm. Cook 2 to 3 minutes stirring occasionally. Add flour and cook 1 minute. Stir in stock. Cook until slightly thickened. Stir in milk and cream. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 to 10 minutes. Stir in white pepper. Serve hot. Serves 4.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute lardons in oil until lightly browned. Remove lardons with slotted spoon. Saute onions in the same skillet in the remaining lardons fat until soft and translucent. Add potatoes and saute 5 minutes stirring often. Stir in wine and simmer 5 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese and top with lardons and onion mixture.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease loaf pans. Beat eggnog until frothy. Add flour, baking powder, salt and walnuts. Beat until smooth. Beat in butter. Beat in egg until blended. Add sugar gradually. Stir in nutmeg. Divide into two loaf pans. Bake 55-60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks. Drizzle with eggnog. Dust with candied fruit.

In a small saucepan stir together vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, salt, pepper and garlic powder. Bring just to a boil. Cook about 1 minute or until hot and slightly thickened. Stir in peaches and cook for another minute. Cool slightly. In a large salad bowl combine greens, turkey, oranges, broccoli florets and cauliflower florets. Toss with enough dressing to moisten evenly. Sprinkle with almonds.
Mix all the dry ingredients together. Add the water and mix in the oil. Pour onto hot griddle and cook each side until light brown. Serve with your favorite toppings.

In a skillet over medium heat, saute the garlic and shrimp for about 4 minutes or until shrimp turns opaque. Add red pepper flakes to taste. Add lemon zest, lemon juice and parsley. Serve over your favorite pasta or rice.
Heat oil in skillet. Add spinach leaves. Sprinkle on basil. Add cider vinegar, dijon mustard, honey. Stir well. Cover and cook 1-2 minutes. Add milk. Cook 1 more minute. Season to taste.
In a large bowl, toss the capsicums and tomatoes with the lemon juice. Add the ground cumin and extra virgin olive oil and mix well. Add the parsley and season with salt and pepper.

Heat oven to 375f. Spray 4-quart casserole with nonstick cooking spray. Stir together first 5 ingredients in large bowl. Add mushroomstoss to coat. Spoon into casserole. Bake 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheesesbake 15 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings.
In large bowl combine pasta, yogurt, tuna, dressing. Add celery and carrots. Spoon mixture onto salad plates. Sprinkle with cheese and herbes de provence. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the milk in a small pot over low heat. Add the butter and sugar, and stir until the butter melts. Add the cocoa, and stir until smooth. Cook for about 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Pour the syrup through a strainer into a glass jar or bottle. Store at room temperature in a sealed container. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Preheat oven to 400 f degrees. In a bowl whisk together 1 1/2 cups of flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. In another bowl whisk together beer and butter. Pour butter mixture into flour mixture, stirring just until combined. Turn out dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 1 minute to form a smooth dough. Roll out dough into a rectangle 10 x 12 inches. Use a pizza cutter to cut dough into 8 equal pieces. Place pieces on ungreased baking sheet. Brush tops of each piece with 1 tbsp melted butter. Bake for 10 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes on baking sheet before transferring to wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Saute onion in butter in large skillet until transparent. Add mushrooms and carrot, saute until mushrooms are soft. Remove from heat. Add breadcrumbs, salt and pepper. Mix well. Combine turkey, onion mixture, mustard, syrup, parsley. Add egg. Mix well. Add mixture to lightly buttered 8x8-inch pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 1 hour. Slice. Makes 2 servings. Serve with cranberry sauce.

Combine condensed milk and lemon juice in a large bowl. Stir until smooth. Cover and refrigerate at least 24 hours. Meanwhile, whisk yogurt in another bowl until smooth. Divide yogurt among four bowls. Top each bowl evenly with about 1/3 cup of condensed milk mixture and then garnish each serving with one of the following toppings. 1/4 cup of the chopped fruit 1/4 cup of the marshmallows 1/4 cup of the pecans 1/4 cup of the whole berries

In a food processor, combine the tomatoes, chili peppers, green onions, cilantro, cumin and garlic. Process until smooth. Add the salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips. Can be made up to two hours ahead. Makes about 2 cups.

Slice garlic. In large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic, saute until lightly browned. Add tomatoes and crush with potato masher. Add oregano, salt and pepper. Simmer for one hour.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat, add garlic and saute for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add tomatoes, celery, thyme and water. Bring to boil. Stir in macaroni. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in frozen peas. Simmer until peas are tender, about 2 minutes more. Remove thyme stems and sprinkle with cheese before serving if desired. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 deg. Lightly grease a 9x5 loaf pan. In a food processor or blender, combine pecans and fresh breadcrumbs. Process until fine and crumbly. Add butter and continue to process until smooth. Stir in onion and carrot. Add cottage cheese and process until smooth. Add eggs one at a time and mix well. Stir in dried oregano and mix thoroughly. Turn mixture into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Cool in pan for 20 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely. Serve with lettuce and tomato. Serves 4-6.

In a large saucepan over medium heat saute onion and celery until soft. In a bowl combine parsley flakes, poultry seasoning, salt and pepper. Add to onion mixture. Stir to blend. Add stale bread cubes and mix well. Add chicken broth. Cook, stirring occasionally until heated through. Serves 8.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli rabe and stir. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the red pepper flakes and cook for another minute. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with the cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large skillet, brown round steaks in oil for about 5 minutes per side. Remove meat to a plate. In same skillet, add onions, green pepper, celery and carrot. Saute for 3 minutes. Add soup, water, salt and pepper. Bring to boil over medium heat for 1 minute. Return meat to pan, cover tightly and place in oven for 1 hour or until meat is very tender. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles. Serves about 6.
In a skillet melt butter. Add asparagus. Stir fry until tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve warm. Drizzle with lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch cubes. Season with salt and pepper. Dip chicken in flour. Heat butter in large skillet until butter is foaming. Brown chicken. Remove chicken from skillet. Add garlic, thyme and sage to pan. Cook until garlic is golden. Stir in white wine and cook until wine is evaporated. Add broth and chicken to skillet. Cover and place in oven. Bake 45 minutes until chicken is done.
Heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, celery, chickpeas, and broth. Simmer for 25 minutes. Add mint. Puree. Stir tahini into soup. Season to taste with pepper. Serve with toasted pita wedges.

Heat oil in a medium heavy-bottom pan over medium-high heat. Add mustard seeds and let splutter for 30 seconds. Add turmeric and cook for 1 minute more. Add onion and saut 5 to 6 minutes more until golden brown. Add garlic cloves and chilies and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds more. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes more until lightly toasted. Add 4 cups of water and cook until rice is tender and all water is absorbed. Add lemon juice and kosher salt and stir. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes more. Fluff with fork before serving. Top with roasted cashews and cilantro.
Combine all ingredients (except banana) in a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. Add banana and process until smooth. Serve immediately or refrigerate and serve later.

Remove the greens from the baby beets and boil the beets until cooked through. Drain and cut into quarters. Mix the rocket with the pine nuts and pine nuts and then arrange the beets and the rocket mixture in a bowl and garnish with the goats cheese and the onion rings. Dress with the lemon juice and olive oil and then sprinkle with the sugar and some salt and freshly ground pepper. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine cake mix & diet soda. Beat at high speed 1 minute or until well blended & smooth. Beat until smooth 2 more minutes at high speed. Fold in 1/2 of the instant pudding mix until well blended. Fold in 1/2 of the cool whip free. Spoon into two 9-inch round baking pans sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool. Fold remaining cool whip free into remaining instant pudding mix. Spread over cake. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). Grease 2 large baking sheets. Place peppers on one baking sheet and asparagus on another. Drizzle both with olive oil. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes, garlic powder and salt and pepper. Roast until peppers are tender and asparagus is bright green and crisp tender about 35 minutes. Serve at once or store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Drain and rinse cannellini beans. Place artichoke hearts and roasted red peppers in food processor and process until chunky. Add beans and remaining ingredients and process until smooth. Spoon into a bowl and top with basil. Serve with crackers.

Place potatoes in a large bowl and cover with cold waterlet stand for 15 minutes. Drain potatoes. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the hamburger until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in the sloppy joe sauce. Combine the potatoes and the sauce mixture. Transfer to a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Combine the cream of potato soup and the milkstir well. Pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Place the instant espresso in the bottom of a small bowl and slowly add the boiling water. Stir until smooth. In a larger bowl combine the heavy cream, light corn syrup, and dark chocolate. Melt the mixture over a double boiler. Remove from heat and pour into the bowl with the espresso mixture. Stir until smooth. Let cool to room temperature. Pour into a small bowl for a quick treat or into a container for a longer shelf life. Refrigerate for at least an hour or until set. If desired, dip strawberries into ganache or top with toffee bits.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add shrimp and cook until just firm but still pink in center (about 1 minute). Remove from skillet. Add water or low-sodium chicken broth (about a 1/4 cup) and bring to boil over medium high heat. Add shrimp back into pan and reduce heat to low. Add lemon juice, salt-free seasoning, table salt and pepper. Cook until shrimp are heated through (about a minute). Add fresh parsley right before serving. Serve over pasta or on a bed of greens for a delicious meal!

Peel onions and cut into 1/4-inch slices. Melt butter in heavy saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onionscook 5 minutes, stirring often. Add chilies, sugar, garlic powder and soy saucecook 10 minutes, stirring often. Cool slightlytransfer mixture to jar with tight-fitting lid. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate until cold. Makes 1 cup jam.

Beat the egg. Add the pancake mix and 7-up to the egg. Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add 1/4 cup of the batter to the pan. Cook the pancake for about 3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Makes 4 pancakes.
Mix butter, sugar, vanilla and egg. Add flour, mix well. Add cocoa, mix. Pour into 9x13 pan greased with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place raisin bran and sugar in bowl. Pour boiling water over the cereal mixture. Set aside to cool. In separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and fine salt. Beat in the canola oil, egg, and buttermilk. Stir the blueberries into the bran mixture. Stir into the batter just until blended. Spoon into greased muffin pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 5 minutes, then turn out onto wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Slice the cauliflower and broccoli into small florets and chop the onions. Mix together the Miracle Whip, sugar, red wine vinegar, and water. Add the cauliflower, broccoli, and onions to the dressing. Put in the fridge for one hour to let the dressing soak into the vegetables. Add the sunflower seeds and raisins and serve.

Cut squash in half lengthwise. Slice off ends and seeds. Brush cut sides with olive oil. Place on grill and cook until just tender. Turn once. Remove from grill and brush cut side with butter. Sprinkle with garlic and season with pepper. Serve.

Cut chicken breasts into long strips. In a bowl, combine egg and buttermilk with a fork. In a shallow bowl or dish, combine flour with garlic powder, baking powder and salt. In another shallow bowl or dish, combine bread crumbs and seasoned salt. Dip each chicken strip into flour mixture then into egg mixture, then into bread crumb mixture. In a frying pan, heat oil over medium heat until a few drops of oil bubble up when you put a piece of breading into it. Fry chicken strips about 3-4 minutes on each side. Serve with ketchup or honey mustard.

Melt butter in a 8-10 inch non stick pan. Add eggs and season with salt and pepper. Stir in apple. Cook until set. Sprinkle with brie cheese. Broil in oven until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with a glass of chilled white wine and a nice bread or baguette.

Preheat oven to 350F. Brush both sides of bread slices lightly with butter. Toast until golden. In a medium skillet over medium heat, whisk together 1 egg and 1/4 cup water. Season with salt. Cook eggs until almost set. In a small bowl, mash egg yolk and hot pepper sauce. Spread 1 slice of bread with pesto and top with goat cheese. Arrange tomato halves over goat cheese. Place egg on top. Drizzle with pesto. Sprinkle with basil and serve on remaining bread.

Beat cream cheese and sugar until well combined. Add sour cream and beat until well combined. Add vanilla and beat until well combined. Pour into crust. Sprinkle with the chopped nuts if desired. Refrigerate at least 3 hours. Top with Cool Whip.

In a medium bowl, combine mustard and vinegar and mix well. Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Rub the chicken with margarine. Combine thyme and cayenne. Sprinkle the chicken inside and out with the thyme mixture, rubbing it in. Roast for 45 minutes or until done (170 degrees F). Combine breadcrumbs with butter and spread over the corn on the cob and place on a foil-lined cookie sheet. Roast alongside the chicken for the last 45 minutes or until the corn is done and the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Serve the chicken with the corn on the cob and drizzle with the mustard-vinegar sauce.
Combine coconut oil and powdered sugar. Add vanilla and mix well. Add coconut milk. Mix well. Add cherry preserves and mix well. Spread on your favorite cupcake. Decorate with cherries.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 4 to 5 minutes, until onion is softened. Add garlic and stir for 1 minute. Whisk in flour and cook for 3 minutes. Whisk in chicken broth. Add potato and carrots and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until potato is tender. Stir in chicken and cook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with basil and cheese.

Bring cream to a simmer over low heat. Add garlic cloves and gently stir for about 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and sun-dried tomatoes. Heat through for about 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking and burning. Add olives and gnocchi and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the baby spinach and stir gently until wilted. Add pine nuts and toss gently until mixed and warm through. Serve immediately with extra pine nuts for garnish and serve with a sprinkling of Parmesan cheese.
In a small bowl combine the green beans, garlic, vinegar, 1/4 teaspoon each of the salt and pepper, and the basil leaves. Toss to coat. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Garnish with scallions.

Heat butter in a 6 to 8 inch non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the mushrooms. Cook for a few minutes. Add the onions and cook for a few more minutes. Add the egg mixture. Cook for a few minutes until the edges are cooked. Fold the egg mixture in half. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes until the center is set. Season with the salt, white pepper and mustard powder. Serve immediately.

Peel rutabaga and chop into small dice. Place in pot with enough water to cover half way. Simmer until tender. Drain rutabaga and mash until smooth. Add breadcrumbs, salt, butter, milk, sugar and egg. Cook in small sauce pan until thick. Serve warm or cold with whipped cream on top.

Mix beef, flour and oil in skillet and brown on medium heat. Drain excess fat from pan and stir in soup and mushrooms. Mix well and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes until liquid is absorbed. Add sherry and onion soup mix and cook for another 5 minutes or until beef is tender. Serve over rice.

Heat 2 tablespoons of bacon drippings in skillet. Add pork tenderloin and brown well. Add soy sauce, ground ginger and garlic salt. Pour 1/4 cup of water into skillet. Cook until pork is tender. In a saucepan combine remaining 2 tablespoons of bacon drippings with red wine vinegar and brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Add tomato sauce. Boil and stir until thickened. Add pineapple tidbits. Cook and stir until heated through. Serve over cooked rice.

Combine yeast with warm water and sugar. Let stand until foamy -- about 5 minutes. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining water with milk. Add salt to yeast mixture. Gradually add flour and mix well. Knead on floured board until smooth. Place in oiled bowl. Cover. Let rise until doubled -- about 45-60 minutes. Prepare pizza topping. Divide dough into 4 portions. Roll or pat into 8-inch circles. Add toppings. Bake at 400 degrees until done -- about 25 minutes. Makes 4 personal size pizzas.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add zucchini and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a plate. Add garlic to skillet and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in chopped herbs and 2 teaspoons watercook 30 seconds more. Return zucchini to skilletsprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes more. Stir in crumbled fetacook until zucchini is tender and golden brown, about 1 minute. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Toss potatoes with olive oil, shallots, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, salt, pepper, rosemary, and thyme. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until potatoes are very tender.

Place ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown beef, drain fat. Add catsup, mustard and cooked macaroni. Spoon mixture into each biscuit shell. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Bake at 350 F for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with french fries. Serves 6.

Cut breast into long strips about 1/2-inch thick and 6 inches long. Thread strips onto skewers. Mix remaining ingredients together in a small saucepan over medium heatbring to a boil, lower heat, and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heatpour sauce over skewers and toss gently to coat well. Let marinate in the refrigerator for at least an hour, or up to overnight. Grill skewers over medium-hot coals for about 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Serve warm.
Mix lemon juice, anchovy fillets, dijon mustard, fresh garlic, worcestershire sauce, olive oil, black pepper and salt together and add parmesan cheese and sugar and mix again. Chill for 2 hours.

Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onioncook and stir until tender. Stir in turkey and cook until no longer pinkdrain excess fat. Stir in tomato sauce and oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 15 minutes or until thickened. Mix together turkey mixture, cabbage and Parmesan cheese in a large bowl. Transfer to a 2-quart baking dish. Combine soup and milkstir well. Pour over cabbage mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 for 35 to 45 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet cook beef over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in rice, fajita seasoning mix, tomatoes and cilantro. Cook 2-3 minutes or until rice is heated through. Serve with tortillas, avocado, cheese and lettuce.

Cut round steak into 1-inch cubes. Brown steak over medium heat. Add carrots and celerycook until vegetables are tender. Add crushed tomatoes and tapiocastir to mix. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer until tapioca is tender and stew is thickened. Season to taste with pepper and onion. Serve over hot rice or noodles.

Cut apple into small cubes. Combine horseradish, lemon juice, sugar and apple cubes in food processor until smooth puree forms. With the machine running slowly pour in the creams to create the desired thickness. Season with salt to taste.

Combine rice and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover tightly. Reduce heat and cook for 18-20 minutes or until all water is absorbed. Cool. In a small bowl combine tuna, mayonnaise, onion, sweet pickle relish and celery. Season with salt and black pepper. Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo rolling mat. Spread a thin layer of rice lengthwise on the bamboo mat. Place about a tbsp of tuna mixture lengthwise down center of the rice. Lift up mat and roll up rice. Wet sides of roll with water. Continue until all rice is used. Cut into 1-inch slices. Serve with wasabi. Makes 4-6 servings.
Saute the chicken breasts in the butter. Add mushrooms, onion, bacon and cook until tender. Add the soup, milk, cheese and cook until heated through. Serve over noodles.

Cook pasta according to directions. Drain and return pasta to the pan. Add pesto and mix well. In a saucepan combine alfredo and milk. Add tuna and heat through. Pour over pasta mixture. Sprinkle cheese over top. Bake in 350 preheated oven for 30 minutes.

Heat the oil in a wok over medium-high heat and stir-fry the vegetables in batches for about 4 minutes each until just tender-crisp. Remove from the wok and set aside. Add the teriyaki marinade and stir-fry until boiling for 30 seconds. Add the vegetables and stir-fry until heated through for another 30 seconds. Season to taste with the salt and pepper and serve immediately.

1. In a pitcher, combine sugar, orange juice, tea bags and mint leaves. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Let steep for 30 minutes. 2. Remove tea bags and stir in lemon juice. Add water and ice to taste. Serve over ice.

Combine cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla in a bowl. Mix until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Fold in strawberries. Chill for 2 hours. Serve cold in 2-inch-diameter ramekins or small parfait glasses.

Combine all dressing ingredients in small bowl. Peel and chop onion and cucumber into bite-size pieces. Mix together cucumber and onion. Fold in shrimp and dill. Spread dressing over bread. Top with shrimp mixture.

Preheat oven to 400. Lightly grease a cookie sheet. Combine almonds, oil, cheese, garlic salt. Mix well. Spread evenly onto prepared baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool 10 minutes. Stir and serve.

Mix all ingredients except for the bread and cheese together in a large bowl. Divide the mixture into 8 balls and flatten them out into patties. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Add sauce to the bottom of the bread. Add the meatballs on top of the sauce and sprinkle with cheese.
