Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Combine melted butter and garlic powder. Spread mixture over pita rounds. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake in oven for 4-6 minutes. Serve warm with dipping sauce such as ranch dressing or sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine the brown sugar, eggs, vanilla and butterbeat until smooth. Stir together the flour and saltgradually beat into the brown sugar mixture. Press onto a greased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack. In a small bowl, melt chocolate chips and shorteningcool slightly. Beat in powdered sugar until smooth. Drizzle over the brownies. Sprinkle with pecans. Cut into squares.
Mix together the flour and sugar in a bowl. Cut in the butter. Add cranberry sauce and mix thoroughly. Place in a greased 9x13 pan and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve warm with ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease 9" square baking pan. Peel pears, cut into chunks and add to baking pan with gingerroot. Mix sugar and flour together and sprinkle over pears. Dot with butter. Bake for 30 minutes or until pears are tender. Spread mangoes over crumble topping. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake for another 15-20 minutes or until mangoes are cooked through and topping is golden. Serve hot or cold with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat oven broiler. Line a baking sheet with foil. Combine milk and cornstarch in a medium bowl. Add cream cheese. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in mushrooms and scallions. Spread mixture on baking sheet. Broil until golden brown. Cook fettuccine according to directions on package. Drain. Toss fettuccine with Alfredo sauce. Serves 4.

Cook rice according to package directions. Add cauliflower to pot with rice and cook until tender. In a large skillet cook mushrooms and onion with olive oil over medium heat for about 7 minutes or until tender. Add tomatoes, pepper, salt and pepper to taste and cook for 1 minute. Add cooked rice mixture to skillet with mushrooms. Stir to combine. Add cooked eggs and mix well to combine. Transfer to casserole dish and sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm.

Peel and shred the potatoes by hand. In a medium bowl, mix the shredded potatoes with the onion. Add the salt and pepper and mix well. Add the egg, egg white and flour and mix to incorporate. Let the mixture rest for 30 minutes. Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the canola oil to the pan. Working in batches, form the potato mixture into patties by hand and carefully place in the pan. Do not overcrowd the pan. Fry the latkes until golden brown and crisp on both sides. Remove the latkes from the pan and place on paper towels to absorb any excess oil. Repeat with remaining potato mixture. Serve hot.
In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, sugar and milk. Add vinegar to taste. Place lettuce on plates. Top with onion, pomegranate seeds, poppy seeds and dressing.
Grease a loaf pan. Combine all ingredients. Pour into pan and bake in a 375 degree oven for about 1 hour. Cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Coat a 13x9x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine fish fillets, butter, garlic and lemon juice. Spread in the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle with parsley. Yield 12 servings

Heat oil in wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add green beans and cook 2-3 minutes or until bright green. Add soy sauce to pan. Cook 1 minute or until hot. Add vinegar and sesame oil. Cook 3-4 minutes or until hot. Serves 2.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in almond extract. Add eggs one at a time beating after each. Beat in the flour baking soda and salt. Stir in white baking chocolate until combined. Add in almonds. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on wire rack. Makes 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment paper. Using a vegetable peeler, slice zucchini into 1/8-inch-thick strips. Combine Italian style breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, seasoning salt and garlic powder in a bowltoss with zucchini strips until coated thoroughly. Spray a wire rack with nonstick cooking spray, and place on another baking sheetset aside. Dip zucchini strips into egg mixture, one at a timedrain excess egg onto paper towels. Place zucchini strips on wire rack, and bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until crisp. Serve immediately.

Add vinegar and orange peel to a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2 minutes. Add cranberries and cook for 5 minutes. Add sugar, orange juice and cinnamon. Cook for another 5 minutes.

Pour vodka, gin and tequila into shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well for 30 seconds or until chilled, strain into highball glass filled with ice cubes, add the orange juice, stir gently, add the orange slice as a garnish, and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease pizza pan with cooking spray. Roll out crust thinly on lightly floured surface into rectangle about 10 inches by 16 inches. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until crust is light golden brown (about 8-10 minutes). Remove from oven and top with onion and garlic. Sprinkle with oregano. Return pan to oven. Bake until cheese is golden brown (about 10 minutes). Cool slightly before slicing into wedges with a pizza cutter. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place sugar snap peas on a baking sheet. Roast peas for 15 minutes. In a medium skillet cook bacon until crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towel lined plate. Add shallots to skillet. Cook until softened and starting to brown, about 5 minutes. Add peas to skillet and toss to combine. Remove from oven and toss again until peas are coated with shallots and bacon fat. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Peel and core the apples. Put in a large pan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook for 20 minutes or until the apples are tender but still hold their shape. Remove from the pan and when cool enough to handle, cut into thick slices and discard the cooking water. Put the apples in a saucepan with the mint and just enough water to cover the apples and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the sugar and vinegar and simmer for 5 minutes or until the apples are tender and translucent. Transfer to a blender and puree until smooth. Add the redcurrant jelly and puree again. Season to taste and return to the pan to keep warm while you prepare the salmon.

Melt butter in large skillet. Saut onion until tender. Add eggs and cook until eggs begin to set. Add artichoke hearts, olives and cheese. Cook until cheese has melted. Serve immediately or refrigerate overnight. To serve, place one slice of toast on each plate. Top each with 1/2 cup of egg mixture. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Prepare chicken according to package directions. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine pecans and spices in a small bowl. Dip chicken in milkdredge in nut mixture and place in greased 9-inch square pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until done and golden brown. Serve hot or at room temperature with your favorite side dishes. Serves 6.
Melt butter in large saucepan. Add garlic cloves and saute until slightly browned. Add herbes de provence to taste. Stir in popcorn. Serve in shallow bowl.

Heat oil in heavy-duty 12-inch skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add leek and zucchinicook 4 minutes or until tender-stirring frequently. Add capsicumcook 1 minute. Add frozen spinachcook 1 minute. Remove vegetables from skillet. Increase heat to highadd oil to skillet. Add eggscook 1 minute or until just set. Remove from heat. Add vegetablestoss to combine. Add feta and next 5 ingredients. Toss to combine. Divide vegetable mixture evenly among 12 paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 180 degrees celsius for 30 minutes. Cool in pans 5 minutes. Remove from panscool completely on wire racks. Store in refrigerator. Yields 12 servings.

In food processor fitted with steel blade, pulse flaked coconut until fine. Transfer to large bowl. Add dried coconut. In small bowl, combine condensed milk, butter and salt. Microwave on high until very hot (mixture will bubble), about 3 minutes. Add to flaked coconut mixture. Stir until well coated. Add chocolate. Stir until well coated. Drop by tablespoons onto wax paper. Refrigerate. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9√ó5-inch loaf pans. In a large bowl, mash bananas with a potato masher until smooth. Add applesauce and mix well. Beat in eggs and water until smooth. In another bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder and baking sodastir into banana mixture just until moistened. Stir in vanilla and cinnamon. Pour into prepared pans. Bake 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Peel potatoes and cut into cubes. Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add potatoes and green peppers and cook until the potatoes are almost done. Add broth and bring to a boil. Cook for about 10 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed and the potatoes are tender. Add beer and sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the liquid has evaporated. Add beef broth to moisten if desired. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise, and remove seeds. Place halves face down in a 9x13 inch baking dish, and bake for 45 minutes, or until squash is very tender when pierced with a knife. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes. In a medium frying pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add tomatoes and zucchini, and saut until lightly browned. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove seeds from spaghetti squash, scoop flesh into a serving bowl, and top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Cook the asparagus in boiling water for 1-2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and plunge into ice water to stop the cooking. Drain again and squeeze dry. In a large bowl combine the soup, cheese, and asparagus. Spoon the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Melt butter and sprinkle over the top. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and the sauce is bubbly.

Clean and peel potatoes and cut into wedges. Place potato wedges in a bowl and sprinkle with garlic salt and seasoning salt. Coat the wedges with the seasonings and toss to coat evenly. Place potatoes in a single layer on a greased baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Stir once during baking time and continue baking for another 15 minutes. Melt butter and stir in paprika. Remove potatoes from oven and sprinkle with butter and paprika mixture. Return potatoes to oven and bake for 10 minutes longer or until potatoes are crisp and brown. Serve immediately with ketchup or other desired dips.

Cut beef into 1/4 inch slices. In a large non-stick skillet, heat oil. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds or until browned. Add tomatoes and beef. Cook and stir until meat is browned. Add oregano and seasonings. Cook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley and serve over pasta or with a baguette.

In a skillet, saute the shallots and garlic in olive oil until soft and translucent. Add the spinach and tomatoes and tomato paste and cumin and cook for about 2-3 minutes until heated through. Remove from heat and fold in the fish.

In medium bowl, combine eggs, lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste. In another medium bowl, toss lettuce with olive oil and season to taste. Place lettuce salad on a plate and spoon egg salad on top. Sprinkle with dill and onion, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare cornbread mix according to package directions, using milk instead of wateradd eggs in last 2 minutes of cooking. Cool for 10 minutes in pan before cutting into 1 inch cubesset aside. In a large bowl combine the cornbread cubes with celery, onion, bell pepper, mayonnaise, and tomatoestoss to coat. Serve on a bed of lettuce garnished with celery leaves and tomato wedges. Serve immediately or refrigerate 1 hour before serving. Makes 6 servings.
Mix all ingredients and chill at least 1 hour before serving. Top with sliced tomatoes and green onions. Serve with pita wedges.

In small bowl combine orange juice and soy sauce. Add garlic and green peppermix well. Place scallops in a shallow dish and pour soy mixture over scallops. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour or overnight. Remove scallops from soy mixture and pat dry with paper towels. In hot skillet with oil over medium-high heat brown scallops about 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove scallops from pan and keep warm. Add rice and almonds to soy mixture in skillet and cook until rice is heated through and almonds are golden brown. Place scallops on serving plates and top with rice and almond mixture. Garnish with orange zest and fresh orange slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In medium bowl combine flour and baking soda. In another bowl combine sugar and butter and mix together. Then add the eggs and vanilla extract and mix well. Slowly add the flour mixture and mix well. Roll dough out 1/4 inch thick and cut into 12 cookies. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until the edges begin to brown. Makes 12 cookies.

Beat together butter and extract until blended. Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar. Add food coloring if desired. Divide the dough into 3 parts and wrap in wax paper. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. On wax paper, roll each part into a 12 inch rope. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 30 minutes or until dry and crisp. Cool on wire racks. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator. Makes 3 pounds.

Cut bread into slices, about 1 inch thick, and arrange on a baking sheet. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, lemon juice and garlic. Pour over the bread and toss gently until the bread is thoroughly coated. Spread the bread in a single layer on the baking sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes, turning once or twice, until lightly browned and crisp on the edges. Sprinkle with the herbs and serve.

Place bagels in a greased skillet over medium heat and cook until they are a nice golden color on both sides. While bagels are cooking in the skillet, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until it is crisp. Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and drain the fat from the skillet. Cut the bacon in half crosswise and place it on the bagel halves. Spread a little fat-free cream cheese over the top of the bagel halves. Slice the tomatoes and place them over the top of the bagels.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a baking sheet. In a large bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Add salt, sugar, and cinnamon. Beat until thick. Stir in nuts. Spread on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden. Cool completely. Makes about 5 dozen.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Slice cherry tomatoes in half. On a rimmed baking sheet toss with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until skins are wrinkled and browned, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, cook chorizo in a skillet over medium heat until browned and crispy. Drain and let cool. Drain beans and rinse under cold water. In a large bowl combine chorizo and beans. Add red onion and toss to combine. In a small bowl combine vinegar, honey and sherry. Pour over bean mixture. Toss to combine. Serve salad over mixed greens. Garnish with roasted tomatoes and drizzle with a little olive oil.

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Add the cucumbers and onion and toss gently. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. I prefer to allow the pickles to marinate overnight. The longer the pickles marinate the crisper they become. Serves 6

Preheat oven to 375. Cut each cracker into 2 triangles. In a bowl, combine 2 cups of the crackers and 1/2 cup of the melted butter. Press onto bottom and sides of a 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown. In a small bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups of the remaining crackers, the sugar and the vanillaset aside. In a large bowl combine the remaining melted butter and the remaining crackersmix until well combined. Press onto bottom and sides of the baking pan. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown. Combine the powdered sugar and remaining 2 tablespoons butterblend well. Spread over cooled brownies. Sprinkle with the pecans and white and dark chocolate chips. Cut into bars. Makes 36 bars.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Cut them into cubes and place them in a large bowl. Add the eggs and onion and mix well. In another bowl combine the mustard and mayonnaise. Blend well. Pour over the potatoes and eggs. Add the sweet pickle and mix well. Chill at least one hour before serving. Add the salad dressing. Mix well. Refrigerate until serving time.
Dissolve jello in boiling water. Cool 10 minutes. Add cold water. Fold in ice cubes. Spoon into pie crust. Refrigerate overnight. Top with fat-free cool whip.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Brown meat and onion in 10-inch skillet over medium heat until no longer pink, stirring to crumble. Stir in remaining ingredients except macaroni. Bring to boilcover and bake for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, cook macaroni as package directsdrain. Stir macaroni into chili. Bake uncovered 15 more minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 4-6.

In a large stockpot over medium heat, melt butter and add onions. Sweat onion until translucent. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add flour and cook for 1 minute. Whisk in broth. Add broccoli and corn. Simmer until tender. Remove from heat. Whisk in half-and-half and season to taste. Serve in bowls. Garnish with grated Parmesan.

Prepare the green tea according to package instructions. Cool and place in the refrigerator to chill. Remove the tea bags and discard. Combine the cranberry juice concentrate and water in a large pitcher or bowl and stir until the concentrate dissolves. Add the green tea and the club soda and stir gently to combine. Serve over ice.

In a large pot, place the cubes of bouillon in the water. Add the bay leaf and the pork chops. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remove the chops from the pot. Let cool slightly. Remove the bay leaf. Remove the fat from the water and discard. In a medium pot, add the flour to the water. Stir until it is completely mixed. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Add the potatoes and onion. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the pork chops. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine butter, olive oil, garlic, shallot and dry red pepper flakes. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Set aside 1/4 of the butter mixture for the garnish. Place the crabs in a shallow ovenproof dish or baking pan. Pour the remaining butter mixture over crabs. Bake for 15 minutes or until crabs turn bright red or just slightly opaque. Sprinkle with thyme and parsley. Drizzle with blood orange juice and serve immediately.
Cook ground beef and drain. Combine with spaghetti sauce and heat through. Pour over cooked macaroni noodles and sprinkle with cheese.

In a large skillet, brown sausage until cooked through. Remove to a bowl. Add onion to drippings left in the skillet. Cook until softened. In a large bowl combine eggs, sugar, milk, vegetable oil and melted sausage. Stir in cornmeal mix. Add cheddar cheese and sausage mixture. Mix well. Pour batter into a greased 9 inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 30 to 35 minutes or until done. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together first 6 ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Cut in cold butter with pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in egg and vanilla. Spread mixture into a greased and floured 9-inch pie pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Garnish with chocolate chips and nuts if desired. Cut into wedges and serve.

In a bowl, combine the flour and green bean juice. Add 1/4 cup of the green beans and cook for 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in remaining green beans and 1/4 cup cheese until melted. Spread onto baked tortillas. Top with remaining cheese and bake at 425 for 8 to 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with a garnish of green onions if desired.

Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with foil. Mix graham cracker crumbs with butter until moistened. Press into prepared panbake at 350 degrees f for 10 minutes. Remove from ovenset aside. In a medium saucepan, combine sweetened condensed milk, chocolate chips and white chocolate chipsheat until melted. Remove from heatstir in walnuts and coconut. Pour over hot crustspread to form a thick layer. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into barssprinkle with chopped walnuts.

Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Lay the taquitos in a single layer over the bottom. Pour the enchilada sauce over the top. Pour the evaporated milk over the top. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is bubbly. Serve with sour cream. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place chicken breasts between 2 pieces of plastic wrap and pound to 1/4-inches thick. Beat together yogurt and stuffing cubes until well combinedspread onto chicken breasts. Roll up and place in a baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Meanwhile, mix peaches with cinnamon and sugar in a separate baking dish coated with cooking spray and bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until tender. Serve chicken and fruit together.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour a 12 cup bundt pan or two round 9 inch cake pans. Prepare cake according to box directions and pour into bundt pan. Bake about 35 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely. Meanwhile combine frozen whipped topping with the pudding mix and chill until ready to use. Slice cake horizontally into two layers. Place one layer on a cake plate. Spread half of the pudding mixture over the cake layer. Top with half of the mandarin oranges and half of the whipped topping. Top with the second layer of cake and spread the remaining pudding mixture over the cake layer. Top with the remaining mandarin oranges and the remaining whipped topping. Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.
Cut muffin in half. Place egg and cheese on one half. On the other half place bacon. Fold and eat.

In a large skillet over medium heat brown the ground turkey and onion and garlic until no longer pink. Drain any excess fat and add the green beans and the frozen tater tots and cook until heated through. Pour the soup over the top and bake uncovered for 10-15 minutes at 350 degrees or until cheese is melted. Serve with a salad and fruit.

Preheat oven to 375. Press pastry into 10-inch pie plate. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Combine egg yolks, sugar, gelatin, water, cream and liqueur. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until set. Cool. Stir rum into chocolate. Spoon over filling. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Makes 8 servings.

Wash tomatoes and cut tops off. With a sharp knife cut a circle out of the flesh of each tomato leaving a thick wall of flesh around the inside of each tomato. Scoop out pulp and seeds from each tomato and place in a bowl. Add cottage cheese, season with pepper and sprinkle with chervil. Spoon back into tomatoes and replace tops. Sprinkle with seafood cocktail sauce. Serves 4.

Combine flour, sugar & butter in a large bowl. Use a pastry blender or two knives to cut mixture until it forms fine crumbs. Stir in milk until a dough forms. Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Spread with jam, then roll up. Cut into 1/4 inch thickness. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter 2 large cookie sheets. In large bowl beat together butter, sugars and vanilla until creamy. Beat in instant pudding mix until blended. Beat in eggs one at a time until blended. Beat in flour, baking soda and salt. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheets. Remove from cookie sheets and cool completely. Store in air-tight container. Yields 3 dozen cookies.

In a large frying pan or wok, heat the olive oil and saute the onion for 3 minutes until soft. Add the pork and continue cooking for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the vinegar and the Worcestershire sauce. Cook for 2 minutes until the sauce thickens. Add the sugar and the roasted garlic. Toss to combine. Add the salad and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add olive oil. Add onion and garlic. Cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add rice. Cook 1 minute. Add chicken broth. Cook until all liquid is absorbed. Repeat until rice is cooked. Add asparagus. Cook until tender. Add lemon peel. Add cream cheese spread. Cook until melted. Stir in lemon juice. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Cook bacon in frying pan until crisp. Pour off fatset aside. In skillet, brown onion in bacon fat. Add flour and stir constantly for 2 minutes. Add water, mushrooms, peas and seasoning. Heat through. Stir in sour cream. Bake uncovered in casserole dish at 350F for 30 minutes. Bake uncovered in casserole dish at 350F for 30 minutes.

Pour the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, chili-garlic sauce, garlic cloves and dark sesame oil in a bowl or pan. Marinate the steaks in the mixture for 30 minutes to 2 hours in the refrigerator (or overnight). Remove steaks from the marinade mixture and grill to desired degree of doneness. Serve with toasted sesame seeds sprinkled on top.

In a 9x13 pan, combine rhubarb, sugar-free strawberry gelatin, brown sugar, and flour. Mix well. Melt butter. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop evenly over rhubarb mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until topping is lightly browned. Serve warm with ice cream.
Stir tomatoes, onion, garlic and jalapeno together. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and hot pepper sauce. Chop cilantro and toss with salsa. Cover and chill. Makes 3 cups.

Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add sugar and stir over low heat until melted. Add milk and vanilla. Stir until well blended. Stir in rolled oats and cocoa. Cook until mixture thickens. Pour mixture into greased 2 qt casserole. Top with coconut. Bake at 350f for about 35 minutes or until lightly browned.

Saute garlic and onion in olive oil until tender. Add clam juice and crushed red pepper flakes and boil for about 1 minute. Add clams and margarine. Cook for 1 minute longer then add milk and parsley. Stir and serve immediately over hot pasta.

Clean your mushrooms and remove stems. In a bowl combine all of your stuffing ingredients and mix well. Place each mushroom cap stuffing into each mushroom. Sprinkle each mushroom with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15-20 minutes. Serve hot.

Butter both sides of each slice of bread. Place turkey in large skillet over medium heat, and add carrot, onion and celerystirring occasionally until turkey is no longer pink and vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Add thyme, salt and pepper. Add turkey gravy and stir until heated through. Place slices of turkey in each slice of bread and top with gravy mixture.

Bring water and sugar to a boil. Stir well. Add cherries and currants. Cook over low heat about 25 minutes or until thick. Spread in a hot jar. Seal and process in boiling water for 20 minutes. Makes about 2 pints.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add vegetarian ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Add onion and cook until browned. Stir in beans and next 8 ingredients (through chili powder). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to lowcover and simmer 30 minutes. Transfer to a 3-quart baking dishtop with cheddar. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with corn chips or tortilla chips. Makes 8 servings.

Pound each chicken breast half to 1/4 inch thick. Combine salt and pepper and sprinkle over both sides of the chicken breasts. Heat butter in skillet and brown chicken breasts 2 minutes per side. Remove from pan and set aside. Add mozzarella cheese to the skillet and stir over heat until melted. Add mushrooms and saute 3 minutes. Add the soup, chilies and tomatoes and heat through. Add the rice and heat through. Place chicken breasts in the bottom of a 2 quart casserole. Top with the soup mixture and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Serves 4.

In large mixing bowl combine eggs, egg whites, milk, honey and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Pour mixture into casserole dish or 9x13 baking dish. Top with bread cubes. Bake for 40 minutes at 350. Cut into squares. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.

Combine artichokes with all ingredients in a small bowl. Chop the baguette into 1 inch cubes and place them into a medium bowl. Pour dressing over the cubed bread and toss to coat. Spread onto a large serving platter. Sprinkle with romano cheese. Serve with a side of artichoke bruschetta.

Pour caramel topping into a 12-ounce glass. Add dark chocolate and stir to melt. Add butterscotch schnapps and Baileys Irish Cream. Top with ice cubes. Stir to cool. Add cream and stir until blended. Serve with straws.

Cook macaroni in boiling water until al dente. Drain and add to a casserole dish with the rest of the ingredients. Stir and bake uncovered at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle with paprika just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Season fish fillets with flour, salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown fillets in hot oilturn and brown other side. Place fillets in a shallow 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Stir together couscous and chicken broth in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in salsa and olives. Pour over fish in dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Combine soymilk and margarine in a heavy bottom saucepan over medium-low heat. Bring to a simmer and cook until the mixture has reduced to 1-1/2 cups and is thick and syrupy -- stirring constantly with a wire whisk. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the sugar and salt. The condensed milk will continue to thicken as it cools. Refrigerate until thickened. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (fan-forced). Sift the flour and baking powder into a large bowl. Add the lemon myrtle. Use a pastry blender or two knives to cut the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles fine breadcrumbs. In a small bowl, combine the milk and honey until well blended. Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and stir until a soft dough forms. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Divide the dough in half and shape each half into a round disc. Place on a tray lined with baking paper and flatten into a circle approximately 3mm thick. Scatter the figs and coconut on top and gently press into the dough. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. To make the icing, beat the lemon myrtle and honey until thickened. Spread over the biscuits and serve.
Combine all ingredients in sauce pan on medium heat and simmer for 15 minutes, or until apricots are soft and mixture is thick. Cool slightly before spreading on cakes or rolls.

Peel and seed butternut squash. Cube squash and place in a microwaveable bowl with 2 Tablespoons of margarine. Microwave for 10 minutes. Add sour cream and cook for another 10 minutes. Season to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream sugar and butter. Add egg. Add 1/2 c. of flour, baking soda and salt. Add vanilla and sour milk. Blend. Fold in blueberries. Pour into a well-greased 8-inch square baking pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool. Makes 8 servings.

Boil milk and sugar over medium-high heat. Add egg yolks one by one and keep stirring. Add dry sherry and stir. Add ground cinnamon and nutmeg. Stir and boil for 1 minute. Pour into 12 individual serving cups. Chill for 4 hours. Beat egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff. Add sugar and keep beating until stiff. Spread over pudding. Sprinkle with blanched almonds. Garnish with whipped cream.

Slice eggplant into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Dip in egg and fry in olive oil in a nonstick skillet until golden brown. Remove and set aside. In a small bowl combine garlic clove, lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Add eggplant and toss until coated. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with feta cheese and basil pesto. Garnish with tomatoes and fresh thyme. Serve with rice.
In medium bowl, mix all the ingredients together. Top burgers with this mixture.

Mix butter and sugars until creamy. Beat in vanilla and egg. Stir in flour, soda and salt. Stir in white chocolate chips. Stir in a few drops of red food coloring. Stir in crushed candy cane. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 3 dozen.

Whisk together soy sauce, lime juice and ginger. In a small bowl, combine lime juice, garlic, thyme and pepperplace in a large zip-top plastic bag. Add salmon to bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat broiler. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Remove salmon from bagdiscard marinade. Broil salmon 4 inches from heat until just cooked through, about 4 minutes per side. Serve with lime wedges.
In a medium bowl toss together lettuce and bacon. Add vinegar, sugar and onion. Toss well and serve immediately.
